original: dge slong gi lus khrag gam rnag 'dzag pa de ni lus 'dzag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi lus khrag gam rnag 'dzag pa de ni lus 'dzag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The body of a monk from which blood or pus flows is called “a body from which something flows.”

original: des rnag gzan bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des rnag gzan bcang bar bya'o //
translated: He should wear a bandage for the pus.

original: de chos gos kyi nang du bgo'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de chos gos kyi nang du bgo'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should wear it inside his robes.

original: rnag gzan de chos gos kyi nang rol du bgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnag gzan de chos gos kyi nang rol du bgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: He should wear the bandage for the pus inside his robes.

original: 'byang na bska ba'i chu dang / so phag gi phye ma dang sbyar ba'i chus spangs te dal bus khad kyis khad kyis dgog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽rang gzan de lus la 'byar na shing pib pa la la sogs pa'i shun pa dang sbyar ba bska ba'i chu'am /
analyzed: 'byang na bska ba'i chu dang / so phag gi phye ma dang sbyar ba'i chus spangs te dal bus khad kyis khad kyis dgog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / rang gzan de lus la 'byar na shing pib pa la la sogs pa'i shun pa dang sbyar ba bska ba'i chu'am /
translated: If it comes off, he should remove it with water that is astringent or with water mixed with brick-powder, and he should slowly and gradually reapply it.🔽If the bandage sticks to his body, he should remove it with water that is astringent or with water mixed with brick-powder.

original: so phag gi bye ma dang sbyar ba chus spangs te dal bus khad kyis khad kyis dgog par bya'o //
analyzed: so phag gi bye ma dang sbyar ba chus spangs te dal bus khad kyis khad kyis dgog par bya'o //
translated: He should slowly and gradually reapply it.

original: de gnyis kyis ni dri ma 'dag pa dang rma 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni dri ma 'dag pa dang rma 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the wound will heal and the dirt will be removed.

original: rnag dang khrag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnag dang khrag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And also for blood and pus.

original: bska ba'i chu dang so phag gi phye ma dang sbyar ba'i chus spangs te dal bus khad kyis khad kyis dgog par bya'o ;
analyzed: bska ba'i chu dang so phag gi phye ma dang sbyar ba'i chus spangs te dal bus khad kyis khad kyis dgog par bya'o ;
translated: He should avoid it with astringent water and water mixed with brick-powder, and he should stop it gradually, little by little.

original: / dus dus su de bkru ba dang bskam pa dang kha bsgyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnag gzan de'o //
analyzed: / dus dus su de bkru ba dang bskam pa dang kha bsgyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnag gzan de'o //
translated: From time to time he should wash it, dry it, and change the bandage.

original: de'i de ni btsag gis bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i de ni btsag gis bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is good for the abscess.

original: rnag gzan de'i kha bsgyur ba de'o //
analyzed: rnag gzan de'i kha bsgyur ba de'o //
translated: That is the change of the bandage on the abscess.

original: de'i de la ni sa'i snying po bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i de la ni sa'i snying po bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is good for the earth-core.

original: 'dzag pa de'i skam pa dang sha bkrar mi 'gyur ba de'i sman du ni sa'i snying @190b po'i phye ma bzang ngo //
analyzed: 'dzag pa de'i skam pa dang sha bkrar mi 'gyur ba de'i sman du ni sa'i snying @190b po'i phye ma bzang ngo //
translated: The earth-core powder is good for the medicine to dry up the discharge and prevent the flesh from rotting.

original: chos gos ngag gar bab bab tu mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gos ngag gar bab bab tu mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not put the robe down anywhere at random.

original: skad 'ga' tsam gzhag pa'i gnas dgag pa ni sngar byas zin pas 'di ni mdzod du gyur pa'i gnas gang yin pa de'i dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: skad 'ga' tsam gzhag pa'i gnas dgag pa ni sngar byas zin pas 'di ni mdzod du gyur pa'i gnas gang yin pa de'i dgag pa yin no //
translated: The prohibition of a place to put it down for a while has already been done before, so this is the prohibition of a place to store it.

original: de'i don du gdang bu bca'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i don du gdang bu bca'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should make a rack for that purpose.

original: chos gos gzhag pa de'i don du'o //
analyzed: chos gos gzhag pa de'i don du'o //
translated: For the purpose of hanging up the Dharma robes.

original: de'i don du sbubs khung bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i don du sbubs khung bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For that purpose, a hollow space should be made.

original: gos kyi gdang bca' ba de'i don du ni rtsig ngos la sbubs khung gdod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gos kyi gdang bca' ba de'i don du ni rtsig ngos la sbubs khung gdod par bya ba'o //
translated: For the purpose of installing a robe rack, a hollow space should be made in the wall.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na de'i phyir gtsug lag khang rtsig pa'i tshe na 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na de'i phyir gtsug lag khang rtsig pa'i tshe na 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: When? Therefore it is said: “When the monastery is being built.”

original: dang po gtsug lag khang gi rtsig pa brtsig pa'i tshe nyid na sbubs khung gdod par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po gtsug lag khang gi rtsig pa brtsig pa'i tshe nyid na sbubs khung gdod par bya'o //
translated: When the monastery walls are being built for the first time, a hollow space should be made.

original: brtsigs zin pa'i 'og tu ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: brtsigs zin pa'i 'og tu ni mi bya ste /
translated: After it is built, it should not be done.

original: rtsig pa brkos na gtsug lag khang ma rung bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsig pa brkos na gtsug lag khang ma rung bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the wall is dug up, the monastery will be ruined.

original: byas zin na bug mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byas zin na bug mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is already built, a hole should not be made.

original: gtsug lag khang brtsigs zin na sbubs khung bya ba'i phyir gtsug lag khang la bug gdod par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang brtsigs zin na sbubs khung bya ba'i phyir gtsug lag khang la bug gdod par mi bya ba'o //
translated: If the monastery is already built, a hole should not be made in the monastery for the purpose of making a hollow space.

original: khang khyim la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khang khyim la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same applies to houses.

original: gdang bu bca' ba'i phyir dang / rtsig pa'i tshe na sbubs khung gdod pa dang / byas zin na bu gu mi bya ba gtsug lag khang bzhin no //
analyzed: gdang bu bca' ba'i phyir dang / rtsig pa'i tshe na sbubs khung gdod pa dang / byas zin na bu gu mi bya ba gtsug lag khang bzhin no //
translated: When building a wall, one should not make a hollow space in the wall, nor make a hole in what has already been built. It is like a temple.

original: de ni shing bu'am thag pas 'grub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni shing bu'am thag pas 'grub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be made of wood or rope.🔽It should be made of wood or rope, whether in the forest or in the monastery.

original: dgon par yang rung gtsug lag khang du yang dung ste /🔽chos gos gzhag pa'i gdang bu de ni shing bu'am thag pas 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: dgon par yang rung gtsug lag khang du yang dung ste / chos gos gzhag pa'i gdang bu de ni shing bu'am thag pas 'grub pa'o //
translated: It should be made of wood or rope.🔽It should be made of wood or rope.🔽It should be made of wood or rope.🔽It should be made of wood or rope.

original: gtur bus gos dag bskur na bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /🔽chos gos dag chud za bar 'gyur ba spong ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtur bus gos dag bskur na bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni / chos gos dag chud za bar 'gyur ba spong ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It should be made of wood or rope.🔽It should be made of wood or rope.

original: de bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtur bu de bya'o //🔽khru gsum dang byed dang gsum gnyis lteb tu byas te bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /

original: zheng du ni khru phyed dang gsum las nyis ltab tu byas te bcom mo //
analyzed: zheng du ni khru phyed dang gsum las nyis ltab tu byas te bcom mo //
translated: It should be made of wood or rope.

original: dbus su kha gdod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbus su kha gdod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be

original: gtur bu de'i dbus su srid du kha gdod par bya'o //
analyzed: gtur bu de'i dbus su srid du kha gdod par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that box, one should make a hole the size of the opening.

original: kha ran bug can bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha ran bug can bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should make a rim with a hole.

original: gtur bu de'i kha der kha ran bu gu can bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtur bu de'i kha der kha ran bu gu can bya ba'o //
translated: In that opening of the box, one should make a rim with a hole.

original: kha ran bu gu can ci las bya zhen de'i phyir thag gu las so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: kha ran bu gu can ci las bya zhen de'i phyir thag gu las so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: From what should the rim with a hole be made? For that reason, it is said, “From a rope.”

original: kha brgyud gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha brgyud gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And also another string for the opening.

original: kha brgyu ba'i srad bu gzhan yang gdags pa'o //
analyzed: kha brgyu ba'i srad bu gzhan yang gdags pa'o //
translated: One should also attach another string for the opening.

original: spyod par bya ba dag steng du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyod par bya ba dag steng du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should put the robes on top.

original: gos spyad par bya ba dag gtur bu'i kha logs su gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: gos spyad par bya ba dag gtur bu'i kha logs su gzhug pa'o //
translated: One should put the robes to be used on the side of the box opening.

original: sang 'gro bar 'gyur ba nyid na bla ma la zhus pa ste gnang na 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sang 'gro bar 'gyur ba nyid na bla ma la zhus pa ste gnang na 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one is going the next day, one should ask the guru. If permitted, one should go.

original: zhag gcig gi @191a * //
analyzed: zhag gcig gi @191a * //
translated: After one day.

original: 'og tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i mdun rol nas bla ma la zhus te gal te gnang na de'i 'og tu 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'og tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i mdun rol nas bla ma la zhus te gal te gnang na de'i 'og tu 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Before going after one day, one should ask the guru. If permitted, then after that one should go.

original: rang gi gnas su chag chag la sogs pa byas te'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi gnas su chag chag la sogs pa byas te'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having sprinkled and so on in one's own place.

original: 'gro gar bdag nyid gang na gnas pa'i gnas der chag chag la sogs pa byas te gzhan du 'gro bar bya ba'o ;
analyzed: 'gro gar bdag nyid gang na gnas pa'i gnas der chag chag la sogs pa byas te gzhan du 'gro bar bya ba'o ;
translated: One should go elsewhere, having sprinkled and so on in the place where one is staying.

original: / sogs pa zhes smos pa'i sgras ni phyag dar dang lci ba 'jam pos byug par bya ba dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: / sogs pa zhes smos pa'i sgras ni phyag dar dang lci ba 'jam pos byug par bya ba dag bsdu'o //
translated: The word and so on includes sweeping and anointing with soft cow dung.

original: lam du chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis sam 'phags pa'i mi smra ba nyid kyis 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lam du chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis sam 'phags pa'i mi smra ba nyid kyis 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should go by the path with Dharma talk or by noble silence.

original: dge slong lam du zhugs pas so //
analyzed: dge slong lam du zhugs pas so //
translated: A monk who has set out on the path

original: ngal bso ba'i gnas su gtsug lag khang gi tshigs su bcad pa gdon to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngal bso ba'i gnas su gtsug lag khang gi tshigs su bcad pa gdon to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should recite the verses of the monastery in a place of rest.

original: gang du ngal bsos pa'i gnas de nas 'gro ba'i tshe drang srong gis gsungs pa'i tshigs su gcad pa gdon pa'o //
analyzed: gang du ngal bsos pa'i gnas de nas 'gro ba'i tshe drang srong gis gsungs pa'i tshigs su gcad pa gdon pa'o //
translated: When one leaves the place where one has rested, one should recite the verses spoken by the sages.

original: chu bcus par yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: chu bcus par yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: One should also do so when drawing water.

original: gnas su drang srong gis gsungs pa'i tshigs su gcad pa gdon pa'o zhes su'i phyir zhe na /🔽de'i phyir chu de gang gi yin pa de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnas su drang srong gis gsungs pa'i tshigs su gcad pa gdon pa'o zhes su'i phyir zhe na / de'i phyir chu de gang gi yin pa de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For whose sake?🔽 Therefore, it is said, For the sake of that person,

original: yul gyi bdag po'am khron pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: yul gyi bdag po'am khron pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: meaning for the sake of the owner of the water or the owner of the well.

original: lha rnams kyi phyir yang gzhan no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi phyir yang gzhan no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of the gods, it is different.

original: chu bcus pa'i gnas su chu'i lha rnams kyi phyir yang drang srong gis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gdon pa'o //
analyzed: chu bcus pa'i gnas su chu'i lha rnams kyi phyir yang drang srong gis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gdon pa'o //
translated: In the place where water is drawn, one should recite other verses spoken by the sages for the sake of the gods of water.

original: gnas par ni rgyud chags gsum pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas par ni rgyud chags gsum pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of abiding, it is the third recitation.

original: zhag tu gnas pa'i gnas su ni dgongs ka dang nang par gyi dus gnyis su rgyud chags gsum pa gdon par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhag tu gnas pa'i gnas su ni dgongs ka dang nang par gyi dus gnyis su rgyud chags gsum pa gdon par bya ba'o //
translated: In the place where one abides for a night, one should recite the third recitation twice, in the evening and in the morning.

original: dpyang thag bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpyang thag bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should carry a rope.

original: 'bab chu dkon pa'i yul du khron pa la ltos shing 'gro ba'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: 'bab chu dkon pa'i yul du khron pa la ltos shing 'gro ba'i tshe na'o //
translated: In a place where water is scarce, one should carry a rope when going to rely on a well.

original: de'i tshad ni khru brgya yan chad nas brgya lnga bcu man chad do zhes bya ba ni dpyad thag de'i srid kyi tshad do //
analyzed: de'i tshad ni khru brgya yan chad nas brgya lnga bcu man chad do zhes bya ba ni dpyad thag de'i srid kyi tshad do //
translated: This is the measure of the length of that rope.

original: kha cig las ni yul gyi rjes su mthun pa zhes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig las ni yul gyi rjes su mthun pa zhes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In some texts it is called “in accordance with the country.”

original: gzhung kha cig las de skad 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las de skad 'byung ste /
translated: In some texts it is stated like that.

original: yul ser che bar ni dpyang thag thung du yang rung ba'o //🔽de med par khron pa'i chu ma yin pa dkon pa'i yul du kun du rgyu bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul ser che bar ni dpyang thag thung du yang rung ba'o // de med par khron pa'i chu ma yin pa dkon pa'i yul du kun du rgyu bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In a country with much yellow earth, a short rope is suitable.🔽In the absence of that, one should not travel to a place where there is no well water.

original: dpyad thag de med par khron pa'i chu ma yin pa 'ba' chu la sogs pa'i chu dkon pa'i yul du ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dpyad thag de med par khron pa'i chu ma yin pa 'ba' chu la sogs pa'i chu dkon pa'i yul du ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: In the absence of that rope, one should not travel to a place where there is no well water, such as a place where water such as river water is scarce.

original: lam du 'gro bas chos gos sprugs shing khrus bya ba'am rka lag bkrus te chu thogs nas mchil lham phyis shing chos gos gsum gyon te spyod lam zhi bas gtsug lag khang du 'jug par bya ba'o zhes bya @191b pa ni ;
analyzed: lam du 'gro bas chos gos sprugs shing khrus bya ba'am rka lag bkrus te chu thogs nas mchil lham phyis shing chos gos gsum gyon te spyod lam zhi bas gtsug lag khang du 'jug par bya ba'o zhes bya @191b pa ni ;
translated: When going on the road, a monk should shake out his robes, wash, or wash his hands and feet, take a water vessel, wipe his sandals, put on the three Dharma robes, and enter the temple with a peaceful demeanor.🔽This is what is said.

original: dge slong lam du 'gro bas gtsug lag khang gzhan du phyin du nye ba na /
analyzed: dge slong lam du 'gro bas gtsug lag khang gzhan du phyin du nye ba na /
translated: When a monk is going on the road and is about to enter another temple,

original: chos gos sprugs shing nus na khrus bya ba'am /
analyzed: chos gos sprugs shing nus na khrus bya ba'am /
translated: he should shake out his robes and, if able, wash.

original: ma nus na rkang pa dang lag pa bkrus te btung ba'i chu rung ba thogs nas mchil lham phyis shing chos gos gsum gyon te spyod lam zhi bas gtsug lag khang du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: ma nus na rkang pa dang lag pa bkrus te btung ba'i chu rung ba thogs nas mchil lham phyis shing chos gos gsum gyon te spyod lam zhi bas gtsug lag khang du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: If unable, he should wash his hands and feet, take a suitable drinking water vessel, wipe his sandals, put on the three Dharma robes, and enter the temple with a peaceful demeanor.🔽Here the text says:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag pas dge slong lam du 'gro ba'i kun du spyod pa'i chos gos dag bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag pas dge slong lam du 'gro ba'i kun du spyod pa'i chos gos dag bcang bar bya ste /
translated: Monks, a pure monk should carry his robes when going on the road.

original: dge slong lam du 'gro bas chu mthong na lhung bzed dang chos gos phog ste phyogs gcig tu gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong lam du 'gro bas chu mthong na lhung bzed dang chos gos phog ste phyogs gcig tu gzhag par bya'o //
translated: When a monk sees water on the road, he should put down his bowl and robes and set them aside.

original: de'i 'og tu chos gos dag sprugs par bya zhing khrus bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos gos dag sprugs par bya zhing khrus bya'o //
translated: Then he should wash his robes and bathe.

original: yang na rkang pa dang lag pa dag bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rkang pa dang lag pa dag bkru bar bya'o //
translated: Or he should wash his feet and hands.

original: chu btsag par bya'o //
analyzed: chu btsag par bya'o //
translated: He should boil the water.

original: ras ma spangs te mchil lham gnyis byi dor bya'o //
analyzed: ras ma spangs te mchil lham gnyis byi dor bya'o //
translated: He should not discard the cloth, but should clean his sandals.

original: lag pa bsnyal nas legs par gyon pa dang sham thabs legs par ba gos pas zhi ba'i spyod lam gyis gtsug lag khang du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa bsnyal nas legs par gyon pa dang sham thabs legs par ba gos pas zhi ba'i spyod lam gyis gtsug lag khang du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Having washed his hands, he should put on his sandals and enter the monastery with a peaceful demeanor, wearing his lower robe and upper robe properly.

original: gzhan du na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, he would be at fault.

original: rgan rims bzhi la phyag byas nas tha mal pa'i phyogs su bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgan rims bzhi la phyag byas nas tha mal pa'i phyogs su bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should bow to the four elders and sit in an ordinary place.

original: gtsug lag khang gzhan du son nas gnyug mar gnas pa'i dge slong rgan rims bzhi tsam la phyag byas nas tha mal ba'i phyogs lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa dge slong thams cad 'du ba'i gnas gang yin pa der bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gzhan du son nas gnyug mar gnas pa'i dge slong rgan rims bzhi tsam la phyag byas nas tha mal ba'i phyogs lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa dge slong thams cad 'du ba'i gnas gang yin pa der bsdad par bya'o //
translated: Having gone to another temple, he should pay respect to the four elders who are permanent residents, and then he should sit down in the place where all the monks gather, a place that is not hidden from the view of ordinary people.

original: sgra bskyangs pa dang mdzes pa dang shin tu bsdams pa dang spyod lam ran par ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgra bskyangs pa dang mdzes pa dang shin tu bsdams pa dang spyod lam ran par ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should be quiet, attractive, well-controlled, and moderate in his behavior.

original: de na sdod cing gzhan dang phrad pa'i tshe de ltar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de na sdod cing gzhan dang phrad pa'i tshe de ltar bya ba ste /
translated: When he is sitting there and others come, he should act in this way.

original: sgra bskyungs pa zhes bya ba ni mi cor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra bskyungs pa zhes bya ba ni mi cor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Quiet” means not talking.

original: mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni cha lugs 'o gze ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni cha lugs 'o gze ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Attractive” means having a pleasing appearance.

original: shin tu bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Well-controlled” means being composed.

original: spyod lam ngan pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba tshul dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod lam ngan pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba tshul dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Moderate in his behavior” means acting in a way that is appropriate.

original: rgyus shes pa dang ldan pas bsu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyus shes pa dang ldan pas bsu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should greet them with a knowledge of the rules.

original: gnyug par gnas pa gang gis glo bur du 'ongs pa de la 'di ni che ge mo zhig go //
analyzed: gnyug par gnas pa gang gis glo bur du 'ongs pa de la 'di ni che ge mo zhig go //
translated: The one who is abiding in the natural state, when a guest arrives, should know the reason, thinking, This one is so-and-so.

original: gnas che ge mo zhig nas 'ongs so //
analyzed: gnas che ge mo zhig nas 'ongs so //
translated: He has come from such-and-such a place.

original: che ge mo zhig dang lhan cig gnas pa'am nye gnas yin no zhes rgyus shes pa dang ldan pa des de bsu zhing rang gi gnas su ngal sor gzhug pa dang cham du dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: che ge mo zhig dang lhan cig gnas pa'am nye gnas yin no zhes rgyus shes pa dang ldan pa des de bsu zhing rang gi gnas su ngal sor gzhug pa dang cham du dbab par bya'o //
translated: He is a companion or attendant of so-and-so.

original: mi shes na mu gcig pa yin yang bsu bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi shes na mu gcig pa yin yang bsu bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not know, even if it is a fellow monk, one should not receive them.

original: rgyus mi shes na mu gcig pa zhes bya ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yin yang rang gi gnas su bsu bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyus mi shes na mu gcig pa zhes bya ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yin yang rang gi gnas su bsu bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: If one does not know the reason, even if it is a fellow monk, a fellow practitioner of pure conduct, one should not receive them in one's own place, thinking, This one is so-and-so.

original: gzhan du @192a * //
analyzed: gzhan du @192a * //
translated: He has come from such-and-such a place.🔽He is a companion or attendant of so-and-so.

original: mu mi gcig pa dag bsu bar mi bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: mu mi gcig pa dag bsu bar mi bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: Not only should one not receive those who are not fellow monks, but also those who are fellow monks.

original: sgo chod cig tshol na ma sbyin cig len na bzlog shig ces bcol ba khas blangs nas yal bar bor ram /
analyzed: sgo chod cig tshol na ma sbyin cig len na bzlog shig ces bcol ba khas blangs nas yal bar bor ram /
translated: If one has accepted the request, Close the door! If someone seeks, do not give! If they take, stop them! and then neglects it,

original: 'di kho bo'i grogs yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis yid gcugs pa'i dngos po nyid du bsgrubs pa las rlag par gyur na gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di kho bo'i grogs yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis yid gcugs pa'i dngos po nyid du bsgrubs pa las rlag par gyur na gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a monk is ruined by the words of a householder, such as, This is my friend, he is to be assessed.

original: gal te dge slong brang bdag gis dge slong gzhan la 'di skad ces gnas 'di'i sgo chod la /
analyzed: gal te dge slong brang bdag gis dge slong gzhan la 'di skad ces gnas 'di'i sgo chod la /
translated: If a monk tells another monk, Close the door to this house and do not let anyone in, saying, I am friends with the householder.

original: 'dir kho bo dang yid gcugs so zhes zer ba su yang ma btang shig kho bo'i 'am gzhan gyi rdzas chol na de la ma sbyin cig /
analyzed: 'dir kho bo dang yid gcugs so zhes zer ba su yang ma btang shig kho bo'i 'am gzhan gyi rdzas chol na de la ma sbyin cig /
translated: If he steals my or another's property, do not give it to him.🔽If he comes to take it himself, stop him.

original: rang thug thub tu len na de bzlog shig ces de skad du bcol nas dge slong gzhan des kyang da'i tshig khas blangs nas de'i 'og tu yal bar dor te /
analyzed: rang thug thub tu len na de bzlog shig ces de skad du bcol nas dge slong gzhan des kyang da'i tshig khas blangs nas de'i 'og tu yal bar dor te /
translated: If the other monk accepts those words and then later abandons the householder,

original: sgo yang ma bcad tshol na yang byin /
analyzed: sgo yang ma bcad tshol na yang byin /
translated: opens the door and gives the householder's property to him,

original: len na yang ma bzlog pa las dge slong brang bdag de'i rdzas brlag par gyur na de'i rdzas ci brlag pa'i skyin pa dge slong gzhan des gzhal byar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: len na yang ma bzlog pa las dge slong brang bdag de'i rdzas brlag par gyur na de'i rdzas ci brlag pa'i skyin pa dge slong gzhan des gzhal byar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If he accepts it, but does not stop the theft, then the other monk must pay the value of the goods lost by the monk who is the owner of the house.

original: gzhan yang dge slong gzhan zhig gis dge slong brang bdag gi gnas su gang zag gzhan zhig khrid de 'ongs shing 'di skad ces /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong gzhan zhig gis dge slong brang bdag gi gnas su gang zag gzhan zhig khrid de 'ongs shing 'di skad ces /
translated: Also, suppose that another monk brings another person to the house of the monk who is the owner of the house, and says,

original: 'di kho bo'i grogs yin gyi 'di'i nang du 'jug na sgom bcad cig tshol na byin cig / len na ma bzlog shig ces bya ba'i tshig gis yid gcugs pa'i dngos po nyid du bsgrubs pa las /
analyzed: 'di kho bo'i grogs yin gyi 'di'i nang du 'jug na sgom bcad cig tshol na byin cig / len na ma bzlog shig ces bya ba'i tshig gis yid gcugs pa'i dngos po nyid du bsgrubs pa las /
translated: “This is my friend. If you let him in, then I will pay you. If you do not let him in, then do not give me anything.”

original: der brang bdag de yi rdzas brlag par gyur na de'i rdzas ci brlag pa'i skyin pa dge slong gzhan des gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: der brang bdag de yi rdzas brlag par gyur na de'i rdzas ci brlag pa'i skyin pa dge slong gzhan des gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If the goods of the owner of the house are lost because of this, then the other monk must pay the value of the goods lost.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni gnyug mar gnas pa dang glo bur du 'ongs pa gnyi ga la bye brag med pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni gnyug mar gnas pa dang glo bur du 'ongs pa gnyi ga la bye brag med pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: These two aspects should be understood as not being distinguished in either the innate or the adventitious.

original: yid ches pa la brten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yid ches pa la brten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should rely on the trustworthy.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa thams cad ni yid ches pa la brten par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa thams cad ni yid ches pa la brten par bya ba'o //
translated: All the requisites such as the robes and alms-bowl should be relied on by the trustworthy.🔽In regard to what?

original: ji lta bu la zhe na de'i phyir gzhan gyis mi shes pa'i bye brag tu brtag pa ni thabs yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji lta bu la zhe na de'i phyir gzhan gyis mi shes pa'i bye brag tu brtag pa ni thabs yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says: the investigation of the unknown by another is the means.

original: gang zag gzhan gyis mi shes pa'i bye brag brtag pa de ni smras pa'i tshig bden nam mi bden pa bgam par bya ba'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan gyis mi shes pa'i bye brag brtag pa de ni smras pa'i tshig bden nam mi bden pa bgam par bya ba'i thabs yin no //
translated: The investigation of the unknown by another is the means for testing whether the words of the latter are true or false.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang zag yid mi ches pa zhig na re nor bdag che ge mo zhig gis chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad che ge mo zhig kho bo la byin gyis skur cig ces zer na /
analyzed: gang zag yid mi ches pa zhig na re nor bdag che ge mo zhig gis chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad che ge mo zhig kho bo la byin gyis skur cig ces zer na /
translated: If an untrustworthy person were to say: “So and so, the owner of this property, has given me this robe, alms-bowl and other requisites.

original: yid mi ches pa de la gya tshom du bskur bar mi bya @192b bar des rgyus mi shes pa'i rtags ci yod pa brtag pa'i sgo nas bden nam brdzun pa bgam par bya zhing rtags la ma bab cing yid ma ches na ni mi bskur ro //
analyzed: yid mi ches pa de la gya tshom du bskur bar mi bya @192b bar des rgyus mi shes pa'i rtags ci yod pa brtag pa'i sgo nas bden nam brdzun pa bgam par bya zhing rtags la ma bab cing yid ma ches na ni mi bskur ro //
translated: One should not rashly send it to one who is not trustworthy. One should test the signs of his ignorance and determine whether he is truthful or deceitful. If the signs are not clear and one is not convinced, one should not send it.

original: rtags la bab cing yid ches na ni bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtags la bab cing yid ches na ni bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If the signs are clear and one is convinced, one should send it.

original: dbul bar bya ba lhung na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbul bar bya ba lhung na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the thing to be given falls,

original: dbul bar bya ba'i dngos po 'bul bar byed pas 'dzin ma nus te /
analyzed: dbul bar bya ba'i dngos po 'bul bar byed pas 'dzin ma nus te /
translated: if the giver is unable to hold the thing to be given,

original: len par byed pa'i lag tu ma song bar chu la sogs pa'i nang du lhung na 'bul bar byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: len par byed pa'i lag tu ma song bar chu la sogs pa'i nang du lhung na 'bul bar byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: it is as if it were weighed by the giver, if it falls into water, etc., and does not reach the hand of the recipient.

original: gal te ma blangs par btang na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te ma blangs par btang na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is released without being accepted,

original: gal te gang la dbul bar bya ba des ma blangs par 'bul bar byed pas btang na ni des na 'bul bar byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te gang la dbul bar bya ba des ma blangs par 'bul bar byed pas btang na ni des na 'bul bar byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: if the giver releases the thing to be given without being accepted by the one to whom it is to be given, then it is as if it were weighed by the giver.

original: ji ste gang la dbul bar byas pa des blangs nas 'dul bar byed pas btang na ni /
analyzed: ji ste gang la dbul bar byas pa des blangs nas 'dul bar byed pas btang na ni /
translated: If the one to whom it is given accepts it and then gives it away,

original: de'i tshe 'bul bar byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bul bar byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: then at that time the one who gives it is not the one who is tested,

original: len par byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: len par byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: but the one who accepts it is the one who is tested.

original: de'i phyir sbyin pa dang len pa'i dus na de la bag med par mi 'gyur ba bya ba'i phyir dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin pa dang len pa'i dus na de la bag med par mi 'gyur ba bya ba'i phyir dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, in order to be heedful at the time of giving and receiving, one should ask,

original: 'bul ba dang len pa'i dus de la shor cing lhung ba zhes bya ba'i bag med pa de mi 'grub par bya ba'i phyir khyod kyis zin tam 'on te ma zin ces bya ba'i tshig gis dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bul ba dang len pa'i dus de la shor cing lhung ba zhes bya ba'i bag med pa de mi 'grub par bya ba'i phyir khyod kyis zin tam 'on te ma zin ces bya ba'i tshig gis dri bar bya'o //
translated: In order to prevent the heedlessness called “loss and downfall” at the time of giving and receiving, one should ask with the words, “Have you received it? Or have you not received it?”

original: gal te dris pa na 'di skad ces kho bos zin to zhes zer na de'i tshe blangs pa'i dngos po de shor cing lhung ba ni len par byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te dris pa na 'di skad ces kho bos zin to zhes zer na de'i tshe blangs pa'i dngos po de shor cing lhung ba ni len par byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If, when asked, the one who is giving says, “I have received it,” then at that time the thing that is given, which is lost and falls away, is the one that is tested by the one who accepts it.

original: gal te kho bos ma zin to zhes zer ba'i skabs su dbul bar bya ba'i dngos po shor cing lhung bar gyur na ni de'i che 'bul bar byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //🔽brnyas pa mi gtsang bas ma rung bar gyur pa bkru ba la sogs pas sems gzung bar ma grub na rin sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te kho bos ma zin to zhes zer ba'i skabs su dbul bar bya ba'i dngos po shor cing lhung bar gyur na ni de'i che 'bul bar byed pas gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no // brnyas pa mi gtsang bas ma rung bar gyur pa bkru ba la sogs pas sems gzung bar ma grub na rin sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he says, “I did not receive it,” and the object to be given is lost or destroyed, then he should be made to pay the value of that.🔽If the object given in trust is defiled by filth, and the owner’s mind is not won over by washing it and so on, then the value of the object should be paid.

original: brnyan po byas pa'i rdzas mi gtsang bas ma rung bar gyur ba bkru ba la sogs pas bdag po'i sems gzung bar ma grub na de'i tshe gang las brnyas pa de la des de'i rin sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: brnyan po byas pa'i rdzas mi gtsang bas ma rung bar gyur ba bkru ba la sogs pas bdag po'i sems gzung bar ma grub na de'i tshe gang las brnyas pa de la des de'i rin sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If the object given in trust is defiled by filth, and the owner’s mind is not won over by washing it and so on, then the value of the object should be paid.

original: zhar la byung ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhar la byung ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The section on the digression is finished.

original: // / bam po lnga bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: // / bam po lnga bcu bzhi pa /
translated: The section on the main point

original: rgyus shes pa dang ldan pas bsu bar bya'o zhes gang smras pa de la bsu ba ji ltar bya zho na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyus shes pa dang ldan pas bsu bar bya'o zhes gang smras pa de la bsu ba ji ltar bya zho na de'i phyir /
translated: Now, as for what was said about knowing the cause and welcoming, how is welcoming done? Therefore it is said:

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos blang bar bya'o //
translated: The alms-bowl and Dharma robes should be received.

original: stan gding bar bya'o //
analyzed: stan gding bar bya'o //
translated: One should prepare a seat.

original: rkang pa bkru bas mgron du gnyer bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rkang pa bkru bas mgron du gnyer bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: One should invite them to wash their feet.

original: 'di dag dang 'og nas 'byung ba dag gis bsu @193a * //
analyzed: 'di dag dang 'og nas 'byung ba dag gis bsu @193a * //
translated: These and the following are the duties of the host.

original: par bya'o // chus kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: par bya'o // chus kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should invite them with water.

original: btung ba'i don gyi chus kyang mgron du gnyer bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: btung ba'i don gyi chus kyang mgron du gnyer bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should invite them with water for drinking.

original: phyag bya'o spyod pa bde'am dri'o //
analyzed: phyag bya'o spyod pa bde'am dri'o //
translated: One should bow to them and ask if they are well.

original: ci nus kyis yang dag par dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci nus kyis yang dag par dga' bar bya'o //
translated: One should please them as much as possible.

original: gnas mal rkyen du 'bab pa sbyin no zhes bya ba dag gis kyang bsu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas mal rkyen du 'bab pa sbyin no zhes bya ba dag gis kyang bsu bar bya'o //
translated: One should give them a suitable bed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong grong mtha' las dge slong 'ongs shing lhags pa dag rgan rims su ci rigs par bsu par bya zhing gnas mal ci bdog pa yang bstabs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong grong mtha' las dge slong 'ongs shing lhags pa dag rgan rims su ci rigs par bsu par bya zhing gnas mal ci bdog pa yang bstabs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says: “If a monk comes to a monastery, the resident monks should receive him according to seniority and give him whatever bedding they have.”

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi gan du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni glo bur bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi gan du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni glo bur bya'o //
translated: One should go to the elder of the saṅgha.

original: tshig de ni glo bur ba lam du mi 'gro ba dag gi phyir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig de ni glo bur ba lam du mi 'gro ba dag gi phyir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That statement was made for those who are not on the path.

original: des de gnas 'cha' ba la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des de gnas 'cha' ba la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should be assigned to a place to stay.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan des glo bur du 'ongs pa de'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan des glo bur du 'ongs pa de'o //
translated: That means that the elder of the saṅgha should assign a place to stay to the newcomer.

original: gal te rgan na de la gnas mal bstabs pa'i phyir de'i dge skos la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te rgan na de la gnas mal bstabs pa'i phyir de'i dge skos la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he is senior, then to the one who assigns the bedding.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pa de la gnas ma la bstabs pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis gnas mal stobs pa'i dge skos la bsko bar bya'o //🔽bab chol tu gnas mal gsol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pa de la gnas ma la bstabs pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis gnas mal stobs pa'i dge skos la bsko bar bya'o // bab chol tu gnas mal gsol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The elder of the saṅgha should assign a place to stay to the newcomer.🔽One should not request a place to stay in a disorderly way.

original: skabs la ma bsdad pa'i gnas mal brnya bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: skabs la ma bsdad pa'i gnas mal brnya bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not take a place to stay that is not assigned.

original: de ni ha ba shur can du 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ha ba shur can du 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to avoid becoming one who is noisy.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pas gal te gnas mal bsko bar byed na legs par so sor brtags te mnod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pas gal te gnas mal bsko bar byed na legs par so sor brtags te mnod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text is saying that if a newly arrived monk is to assign bedding, he should do so after carefully examining it.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pa'i skabs rdzogs so /🔽// / chos gos kyi mtha' zegs na mtha' skor gyis glan zhing phyir bcos so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pa'i skabs rdzogs so / // / chos gos kyi mtha' zegs na mtha' skor gyis glan zhing phyir bcos so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The section on newly arrived monks is finished.🔽If the edge of a robe is torn, it should be darned and then sewn.🔽If the edge of a robe is torn, it should be darned and then sewn.

original: chos gos kyi mtha' ma zegs par gyur na mtha' skor gyi lhan rings kyis glan zhing phyir bcos par bya ba'o //🔽smyung tshems lta bu dag gis de'i gzungs gdab po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gos kyi mtha' ma zegs par gyur na mtha' skor gyi lhan rings kyis glan zhing phyir bcos par bya ba'o // smyung tshems lta bu dag gis de'i gzungs gdab po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the edge of a robe is torn, it should be darned and then sewn.🔽If the edge of a robe is torn, it should be darned and then sewn.🔽If the edge of a robe is torn, it should be darned and then sewn.

original: khab srubs smyung tshems 'dra ba rir po dag drubs pas mtha' skor de'i gzungs gdab pa'o //
analyzed: khab srubs smyung tshems 'dra ba rir po dag drubs pas mtha' skor de'i gzungs gdab pa'o //
translated: If the edge of a robe is torn, it should be darned and then sewn.

original: ro'i gos ni bla ga ba med par shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i steng du nyi ma bdun nam brgyad dam kha cig las lnga'am drug bzhag ste 'khrur bcug nas spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽dur khrod pas ro'i gos ni bla gab med par zhag lon par bzhag ste spyad par bya'o //🔽phyogs gang du zhe na /
analyzed: ro'i gos ni bla ga ba med par shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i steng du nyi ma bdun nam brgyad dam kha cig las lnga'am drug bzhag ste 'khrur bcug nas spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / dur khrod pas ro'i gos ni bla gab med par zhag lon par bzhag ste spyad par bya'o // phyogs gang du zhe na /
translated: for seven or eight days, or until it is dry.🔽The corpse-cloth is a cloth from a corpse.

original: shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i steng du'o //🔽dus ji srid du zhe na /
analyzed: shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i steng du'o // dus ji srid du zhe na /
translated: The corpse-cloth should be used without a roof-cover, placed on a tree, etc., for seven or eight days, or until it is dry.

original: zhag bdun nam brgyad dam gzhung kha @193b cig las zhag lnga'am drug ces kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhag bdun nam brgyad dam gzhung kha @193b cig las zhag lnga'am drug ces kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: Some texts say that it should be used for five or six days.

original: de nas 'khrur bcug ste spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'khrur bcug ste spyad par bya'o //
translated: Then, after it is dry, it should be used.🔽If one is called, one should go to a monastery or to a house,

original: bdag dur khrod pa'o zhes go bar byas nas 'bod na gtsug lag khang dang khyim dag tu 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag dur khrod pa'o zhes go bar byas nas 'bod na gtsug lag khang dang khyim dag tu 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: having announced oneself as a “charnel-ground person.”

original: dur khrod pa gtsug lag khang dang khyim gyi 'dab tu phyin pa na gya tshom du 'jug par mi bya bar bdag dur khrod pa'o zhes skad kyis bod cing go bar byas nas /
analyzed: dur khrod pa gtsug lag khang dang khyim gyi 'dab tu phyin pa na gya tshom du 'jug par mi bya bar bdag dur khrod pa'o zhes skad kyis bod cing go bar byas nas /
translated: When the charnel-ground practitioner goes near a temple or a house, he should not enter thoughtlessly, but should announce himself by saying, “I am a charnel-ground practitioner.”

original: gal te blas tshur shog ces 'bod na gzod gtsug lag khang dang khyim dag tu 'jug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te blas tshur shog ces 'bod na gzod gtsug lag khang dang khyim dag tu 'jug par bya ba'o //
translated: If he is invited to come in, he should then enter the temple or the house.

original: dur khrod pas bdag gir bya ba ma btang ba la yang spyad pa bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dur khrod pas bdag gir bya ba ma btang ba la yang spyad pa bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The charnel-ground practitioner should also use things that have not been given to him, but which have been discarded.

original: sbyin bdag gis stan yan chad bdag gir bya ba ma btang ba thams cad kyi thams cad du ma bor ba'i yo byad la sbyin bdag bsod nams 'dod pas 'di la 'dug cig 'di spyod cig ces mgron du gnyer na /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis stan yan chad bdag gir bya ba ma btang ba thams cad kyi thams cad du ma bor ba'i yo byad la sbyin bdag bsod nams 'dod pas 'di la 'dug cig 'di spyod cig ces mgron du gnyer na /
translated: If the owner of the things, such as a seat, has not given them up, they are not to be used at all. But if the owner, wishing to create merit, invites the charnel-ground practitioner to use them, saying, “Please sit on this” or “Please use this,”

original: dur khrod pas de la spyad pa bsten par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dur khrod pas de la spyad pa bsten par bya ba'o //
translated: the charnel-ground practitioner may use them.

original: btang ba la ni mgron du ma gnyer kyang ci dgar spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: btang ba la ni mgron du ma gnyer kyang ci dgar spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “even if they have not been given” is that he may use them even if he has not been invited to do so.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas mal la spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas mal la spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not use the bedding of the Saṃgha.

original: dur khrod pas so //
analyzed: dur khrod pas so //
translated: This is for the charnel-ground dweller.

original: mchod rten la 'dom gang tsam gyis 'gyed do zhes bya ba yang dur khrod pas so //
analyzed: mchod rten la 'dom gang tsam gyis 'gyed do zhes bya ba yang dur khrod pas so //
translated: One should give a cubit’s distance to a stūpa. This is also for the charnel-ground dweller.

original: sbrang yab bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbrang yab bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should carry a fly-whisk.

original: sbrang bu za ba'i yul du dge slong thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: sbrang bu za ba'i yul du dge slong thams cad kyis so //
translated: This is for all monks in a place where there are flies.

original: de ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: de'i phyir ba la las byas pa dang sha na las byas pa dad ras bal las byas pa'i ras ma'am 'dab ma'i dog pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ba la las byas pa dang sha na las byas pa dad ras bal las byas pa'i ras ma'am 'dab ma'i dog pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore it says, “It is made of wool, cotton, or silk.”

original: glang po che dang rta dang ba lang gi spu la sogs pa las byas pa mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: glang po che dang rta dang ba lang gi spu la sogs pa las byas pa mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not suitable to be made of elephant, horse, or cow hair, and so on.

original: spu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: spu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: The word “hair”

original: glang po che la sogs pa gsum char dang so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa gsum char dang so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: is to be applied to all three, elephant and so on, individually.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pas ni /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pas ni /
translated: Since “and so on” is mentioned,

original: sbrang bu dag 'chi ba'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de yang 'dir bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: sbrang bu dag 'chi ba'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de yang 'dir bkag pa yin no //
translated: whatever is of the nature of killing flies is also prohibited here.

original: thams cad du gang zag gi khar brtsi can nyid dang khra bo nyid mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad du gang zag gi khar brtsi can nyid dang khra bo nyid mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not possible for the person to be the color of the stick or the color of the fan.

original: sbrang yab kyi yu ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi lus brten pa'i khar ba gzhan thams cad la yang gang zag gi khar ba rtsi can dang khra bo mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: sbrang yab kyi yu ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi lus brten pa'i khar ba gzhan thams cad la yang gang zag gi khar ba rtsi can dang khra bo mi rung ba ste /
translated: Not only the handle of the fan, but also all the other parts of the body that are the color of the person's stick or the color of the person's body are not possible.

original: tshon la sogs pa'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa yang yan lag tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshon la sogs pa'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa yang yan lag tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even the color of the stick, etc., is a part of the body.

original: sbrang skyabs kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbrang skyabs kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The fan is also like that.

original: de ji lta bu zhig ce na de'i phyir shing bu'i steng du ras kyis g-yogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhig ce na de'i phyir shing bu'i steng du ras kyis g-yogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: What is it like? Therefore, it is said to be a cloth covering on top of a stick.

original: ji ltar shing bu la g-yogs par bya zhe na de'i phyir bcing bas so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ji ltar shing bu la g-yogs par bya zhe na de'i phyir bcing bas so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: How is it covered on the stick? Therefore, it is said to be bound.

original: @194a * // ras ji tsam zhig ci na de'i phyir khru bzhi dang do pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: @194a * // ras ji tsam zhig ci na de'i phyir khru bzhi dang do pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How big is the cloth? Therefore, it is said to be four cubits and a half.

original: srid du khru bzhi la zhed du khru do pa'i tshad do //
analyzed: srid du khru bzhi la zhed du khru do pa'i tshad do //
translated: The size is four cubits in length and two cubits in width.

original: ngos cis g-yogs she na de'i phyir ras khru bcu gnyis pas g-yogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngos cis g-yogs she na de'i phyir ras khru bcu gnyis pas g-yogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is it covered with? Therefore it says, “It is covered with a twelve cubit cloth.”

original: de'i srid du khru bcu gnyis kyi tshad yod pas so //
analyzed: de'i srid du khru bcu gnyis kyi tshad yod pas so //
translated: Because it has the size of twelve cubits in length.

original: ji ltar g-yogs par bya zhe na de'i phyir 'byar ba dang bcas par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar g-yogs par bya zhe na de'i phyir 'byar ba dang bcas par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How is it covered? Therefore it says, “Together with the edges.”

original: ras kyi mtha' ma rnams 'byar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ras kyi mtha' ma rnams 'byar bar bya'o //
translated: The edges of the cloth are joined together.

original: de'i ma mtha' ni mal chas sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i ma mtha' ni mal chas sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The minimum size is that it is joined with bedding.

original: g-yogs ma'i ras de'i ma mtha' ni mal chas sbyar cing mtshams bsub par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yogs ma'i ras de'i ma mtha' ni mal chas sbyar cing mtshams bsub par bya'o //
translated: The minimum size of that covering cloth is that it is joined with bedding and the edges are sewn together.

original: sgo bsegs khar gdod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgo bsegs khar gdod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is placed at the edge of the door.

original: sbrang skyabs kyi sgo snol mar gdod par ro //🔽tsha bar ni bsil yab sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbrang skyabs kyi sgo snol mar gdod par ro // tsha bar ni bsil yab sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The door of the beehive is placed at an angle.🔽In the hot season, a fan is joined.

original: tshad khungs su ni bsil yab sbyar bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad khungs su ni bsil yab sbyar bar bya ba'o //
translated: In the hot season, a fan is joined to the edge.

original: bsil yab bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsil yab bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The fan should be held.

original: rlung g-yab pa ni bsil yab bo //
analyzed: rlung g-yab pa ni bsil yab bo //
translated: The fan is the yak-tail fan.

original: bsil yab mkhan gyis byas pa'am ta la'i chang bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsil yab mkhan gyis byas pa'am ta la'i chang bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The yak-tail fan is either made or natural.

original: bsil yab mkhan gyis byas pa ni bcos ma ste bsil yab mkhan gyis byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsil yab mkhan gyis byas pa ni bcos ma ste bsil yab mkhan gyis byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The made yak-tail fan is artificial because it is made by a maker of yak-tail fans.

original: ta la'i chang bu ni rang 'khrungs te ta la'i lo ma'i tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ta la'i chang bu ni rang 'khrungs te ta la'i lo ma'i tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The natural yak-tail fan is natural because it is a collection of palm leaves.

original: khra khra bo mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khra khra bo mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The variegated yak-tail fan is not suitable.

original: yu ba ni sngar gri'u dang sbrang yab kyi skabs su bkag zin pas 'di ni bsil yab kyi lus spyi la snyegs so //
analyzed: yu ba ni sngar gri'u dang sbrang yab kyi skabs su bkag zin pas 'di ni bsil yab kyi lus spyi la snyegs so //
translated: The handle was previously prohibited in the context of the knife and fly whisk, so this refers to the body of the yak-tail fan in general.

original: dge 'dun gyis ni gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis ni bsil yab mkhan gyis byas pa dang ta la'i chang bu las gzhan pa ko lpags las byas pa dang rma bya'i gshog pa la sogs pa las byas pa dang / khra khra bo ma yin pa las gzhan pa khra khra bor 'dug pa dang yu ba rtsi can dang khra bo yang bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis ni gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis ni bsil yab mkhan gyis byas pa dang ta la'i chang bu las gzhan pa ko lpags las byas pa dang rma bya'i gshog pa la sogs pa las byas pa dang / khra khra bo ma yin pa las gzhan pa khra khra bor 'dug pa dang yu ba rtsi can dang khra bo yang bcang bar bya ste /
translated: The Saṅgha may also use other types of fans, such as those made of palm leaves, peacock feathers, and so on, and those that are not multicolored, but are colored with one color, or have handles made of precious substances.

original: de lta bu ni gang zag la bkag pa'i phyir ro //🔽nor bu dang rnga ma'i bsil yab rnyed na mchod rten la dbul lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bu ni gang zag la bkag pa'i phyir ro // nor bu dang rnga ma'i bsil yab rnyed na mchod rten la dbul lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Saṅgha may also use fans that are not made of leather, because the prohibition applies only to individuals.🔽If one obtains a fan made of precious substances or peacock feathers, it should be offered to the caitya.

original: gal te gang zag gis bsil yab yu ba nor bu las byas pa dngos rda ma las byas pa man chad rnyed cing mchod rten gyi phyir len par byed na de'i tshe nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gang zag gis bsil yab yu ba nor bu las byas pa dngos rda ma las byas pa man chad rnyed cing mchod rten gyi phyir len par byed na de'i tshe nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: If an individual obtains a fan made of precious substances or peacock feathers for the sake of the caitya, there is no offense.🔽To which caitya?

original: mchod rten gang la zhe na de'i phyir nyan thos kyi la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mchod rten gang la zhe na de'i phyir nyan thos kyi la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text states, “Also to the śrāvaka caitya.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: Not only the Buddha.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis rnga ma'i bsil yab yu ba nor bu can bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis rnga ma'i bsil yab yu ba nor bu can bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Here the text is: “A monk should not use a yak-tail fan with a jeweled handle.

original: ji ste de snyed na de blangs te sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten nam nyan thos kyi mchod rten la dbul bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste de snyed na de blangs te sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten nam nyan thos kyi mchod rten la dbul bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he has one, he should offer it to a Buddha stūpa or a Śrāvaka stūpa.”

original: stan nang tshangs can dang la ba dang sngas nang @194b tshangs can dang gor bu dag bcad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stan nang tshangs can dang la ba dang sngas nang @194b tshangs can dang gor bu dag bcad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He should cut the inner lining of a seat, a blanket, a pillow, and a mattress.”

original: ma mo las bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi gnas mal rjes su gnad ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma mo las bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi gnas mal rjes su gnad ba 'di lta ste /
translated: In the Mātṛkā, the Blessed One said: “Monks, I allow the following bedding:

original: khri dang khri'u dang stan nang tshangs can dang la ba dang sngas nang tshangs can dad gor bu dang stan dang bgo ba dge 'dun gyi yang rung gang zag gi yang rung ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khri dang khri'u dang stan nang tshangs can dang la ba dang sngas nang tshangs can dad gor bu dang stan dang bgo ba dge 'dun gyi yang rung gang zag gi yang rung ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: a bed, a bench, a seat with an inner lining, a blanket, a pillow with an inner lining, a mattress, a seat, and a robe, whether belonging to the Saṅgha or to an individual.”

original: bu dang chung ma'i rnyed pa ni sbyin par byed pa'i dbang gis bsgrub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bu dang chung ma'i rnyed pa ni sbyin par byed pa'i dbang gis bsgrub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The acquisition of a son and wife is accomplished by the power of giving.

original: sbyin par byed pa rang gi bu dad chung ma 'bul na sbyin par byed pas ji ltar rnam par nges par byas pa de bzhin du rnam par nges par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa rang gi bu dad chung ma 'bul na sbyin par byed pas ji ltar rnam par nges par byas pa de bzhin du rnam par nges par bya'o //
translated: If the giver gives his son and wife, he should determine them as he has determined the other things.

original: gal te slu bar byed na de ji tsam du 'dod pa de tsam du btsong ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te slu bar byed na de ji tsam du 'dod pa de tsam du btsong ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he deceives, then to that extent he is sold.

original: gal te sbyin par byed pas bu dang chung ma phul ba phyir slu bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te sbyin par byed pas bu dang chung ma phul ba phyir slu bar 'dod na /
translated: If the giver, having given his son and wife, wants to deceive,

original: sbyin par byed pa deng ni ji tsam du 'dod pa de tsam du btsong ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa deng ni ji tsam du 'dod pa de tsam du btsong ba nyid yin te /
translated: then to that extent the giver is sold.

original: sbyin par byed pa des bu dang chung ma slu ba'i phyir ji tsam 'gul ba de tsam blangs te slur sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa des bu dang chung ma slu ba'i phyir ji tsam 'gul ba de tsam blangs te slur sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The giver should take back as much as he can get for the deception of his son and wife.

original: 'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi rgyal byed kyi tshal der dus ston chen po byung ba na dge 'dun la bu dang chud ma phul ba'i tshe /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi rgyal byed kyi tshal der dus ston chen po byung ba na dge 'dun la bu dang chud ma phul ba'i tshe /
translated: Here, when a great festival occurred in the Jetavana grove of the householder Anathapindada, the monks did not give the children and wealth to the saṅgha.

original: dge slong rnams kyis ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pa nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pa nas /
translated: Not knowing how to proceed,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: the Blessed One said,

original: khyim bdag la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag la dri bar bya'o //
translated: “Ask the householder.”

original: de dag gis khyim bdag la dris pa dang des smras pa 'phags pa dag rin skyed cig dang bdag gis rin dbul lo //
analyzed: de dag gis khyim bdag la dris pa dang des smras pa 'phags pa dag rin skyed cig dang bdag gis rin dbul lo //
translated: When they asked the householder, he said, “Noble ones, determine the value and I will give the price.”

original: drug sde dag gis de dang lhan cig gtod par brtsams pa na /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis de dang lhan cig gtod par brtsams pa na /
translated: When the group of six began to determine the value with him,🔽a woman with a young son touched the feet of the householder Anathapindada and said,

original: de na bud med bu gzhon nu can zhig gis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin de'i rkang pa gnyis la gtugs te smras pa /
analyzed: de na bud med bu gzhon nu can zhig gis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin de'i rkang pa gnyis la gtugs te smras pa /
translated: “Householder, please give me the price of this child.”

original: rje'i sras bdag ni bu gzhon nu can lags na bdag mi gtong bar ci gnang zhes bya ba'i bar gyi skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: rje'i sras bdag ni bu gzhon nu can lags na bdag mi gtong bar ci gnang zhes bya ba'i bar gyi skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag bud med ni snying stobs chung bas dngangs par 'gyur gyi de lta bas na dge slong dag gis bud med bskyed par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag bud med ni snying stobs chung bas dngangs par 'gyur gyi de lta bas na dge slong dag gis bud med bskyed par mi bya ste /
translated: “Monks, women are timid. They are frightened. Therefore, monks should not raise women.

original: skyed par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do raise them, they commit an offense.

original: 'di ltar sbyin bdag nyid dad cing dang pa'i dbang gis sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid blang par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin bdag nyid dad cing dang pa'i dbang gis sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid blang par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In this case, the one who is faithful and has faith should take what is given by the donor.”

original: yang dang yang dbul du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dang yang dbul du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It is suitable to give again and again” means

original: phul zin pa'i dngos po len pa po de nyid la yang dang yang du dbul du rung ba ste /
analyzed: phul zin pa'i dngos po len pa po de nyid la yang dang yang du dbul du rung ba ste /
translated: that it is suitable to give again and again to the one who has already received the gift.

original: @195a * // sbyin bar byed pa 'dad pa spel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @195a * // sbyin bar byed pa 'dad pa spel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the donor’s faith and devotion increases.

original: shing ljon pa la phul ba gal te rgyan zhig yin na dus ston gyi tshe de nyid brgyan par bya ba'i phyir gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing ljon pa la phul ba gal te rgyan zhig yin na dus ston gyi tshe de nyid brgyan par bya ba'i phyir gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is an ornament, it is set aside for the purpose of decorating the tree during the festival.

original: sbyin bdag gis gtsug lag khang gi shing ljon pa la rdzas phul ba gal te rgyan zhig yin na ni dus ston gyi tshe shing ljon pa de nyid brgyan par bya ba'i phyir gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis gtsug lag khang gi shing ljon pa la rdzas phul ba gal te rgyan zhig yin na ni dus ston gyi tshe shing ljon pa de nyid brgyan par bya ba'i phyir gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If the donor gives goods for the tree in the monastery, and if it is an ornament, it is set aside for the purpose of decorating the tree during the festival.

original: shing ljon pa de rdib na de dang rigs mthun pa'i shing ljon pa gzhan brgyan par bya ba'i phyir gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa de rdib na de dang rigs mthun pa'i shing ljon pa gzhan brgyan par bya ba'i phyir gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If the tree falls down, another tree of the same kind is set aside for the purpose of decorating it.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa gzhan med na rigs mi mthun pa gzhan brgyan pa'i phyir gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa gzhan med na rigs mi mthun pa gzhan brgyan pa'i phyir gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If there is no other tree of the same kind, another tree of a different kind is set aside for the purpose of decorating it.

original: rtsig pa la ni gal te gnas khang gi ni ri mo bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsig pa la ni gal te gnas khang gi ni ri mo bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is a wall, it is set aside for the purpose of painting the temple.

original: rtsig pa la phul na gal te rtsig pa de'i gnas khang gi yin na rdzas de gnas khang gi rtsig pa la ri mo bri ba'i phyir spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa la phul na gal te rtsig pa de'i gnas khang gi yin na rdzas de gnas khang gi rtsig pa la ri mo bri ba'i phyir spyad par bya'o //
translated: If it is offered to a wall, if that wall is part of a building, that substance should be used for painting the wall of the building.

original: gal te ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not,

original: ka ba la na las sar ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ka ba la na las sar ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: if it is offered to a pillar, for the sake of the building.

original: gal te rtsig pa de gnas khang gi ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rtsig pa de gnas khang gi ma yin nam /
translated: If that wall is not part of a building,

original: ka ba la phul na /
analyzed: ka ba la phul na /
translated: if it is offered to a pillar,

original: rtsig pa de dang ka ba de la phul ba'i rdzas te mkhar lan gyi phyir gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa de dang ka ba de la phul ba'i rdzas te mkhar lan gyi phyir gzhag par bya'o //
translated: that substance offered to the wall and pillar should be set aside for the sake of the building.

original: sa la na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa la na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is on the ground,

original: 'di ni 'og ma rnams kyi spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og ma rnams kyi spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: this is a general statement for what follows.

original: me khang gi ni snang mar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: me khang gi ni snang mar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is in the kitchen, for the lamps.

original: me 'bud pa'i me khang gi sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni dge 'dun gyi snang ma gang dang gang du dgos pa'i rgyur spyad kyis me khang de nyi tshe'i nang du 'dud pa'i snang mar bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: me 'bud pa'i me khang gi sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni dge 'dun gyi snang ma gang dang gang du dgos pa'i rgyur spyad kyis me khang de nyi tshe'i nang du 'dud pa'i snang mar bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: A substance offered on the ground of the kitchen where the fire is lit should be used by the Saṅgha as a cause for whatever lamps are needed. It is not only for the lamps that are lit in that kitchen.

original: yang na snum bag gi rnyed par ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na snum bag gi rnyed par ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or it is the Saṅgha’s oil-supply.

original: me khang gis la phul ba'i rdzas de yang na dge 'dun gyi snum bag gi rnyed pa /
analyzed: me khang gis la phul ba'i rdzas de yang na dge 'dun gyi snum bag gi rnyed pa /
translated: That substance offered in the fire-house is either the Saṅgha’s oil-supply,

original: sha'am / nya sha'am /
analyzed: sha'am / nya sha'am /
translated: or it is fish, or it is meat,

original: sha skam mam /
analyzed: sha skam mam /
translated: or it is dried meat,

original: zho 'am / 'o ma 'am /
analyzed: zho 'am / 'o ma 'am /
translated: or it is curd, or it is milk,

original: mar ram / zhun mar la sogs par bsgyur zhing spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: mar ram / zhun mar la sogs par bsgyur zhing spyad par bya'o //
translated: or it is butter, or it is ghee, and so on.

original: rung ba'i khang pa ni na ba'i sman du gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rung ba'i khang pa ni na ba'i sman du gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The suitable house is to be set aside as medicine for the sick.

original: rung ba'i khang pa'i sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni na ba'i sman du bsgyur zhing gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i khang pa'i sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni na ba'i sman du bsgyur zhing gzhag pa'o //
translated: The substance offered in the place of the suitable house is to be set aside as medicine for the sick.

original: bkad sa'i ni zas su bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bkad sa'i ni zas su bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The assembly hall is to be used as food.

original: bkad sa'i khang pa'i sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni /
analyzed: bkad sa'i khang pa'i sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni /
translated: The substance offered in the place of the assembly hall

original: zas su bsgyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: zas su bsgyur bar bya'o //
translated: is to be used as food.

original: skye mal gyi ni btung bar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye mal gyi ni btung bar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The bed-chamber is to be used as drink.

original: skye mal gyi sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni btung bar bsgyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye mal gyi sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni btung bar bsgyur bar bya'o //
translated: The substance offered in the place of the bed-chamber is to be used as drink.

original: bsro gang gi gnas kyi ni bsro gang ngam snum bag gi rnyed par ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsro gang gi gnas kyi ni bsro gang ngam snum bag gi rnyed par ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The property of a sauna is for the sauna or for the acquisition of oil.

original: bsro gang gi gnas kyi sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni bsro gang gi yo byad dam dge 'dun gyi snum bag gi rnyed par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsro gang gi gnas kyi sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni bsro gang gi yo byad dam dge 'dun gyi snum bag gi rnyed par bya ba'o //
translated: The property offered to the ground of a sauna is for the acquisition of oil for the saṅgha.

original: 'khor gyi khyams dang spong sa'i ra ba'i ni snum bag gi rnyed @195b par ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khor gyi khyams dang spong sa'i ra ba'i ni snum bag gi rnyed @195b par ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The property of a courtyard and of a cloister is for the acquisition of oil.

original: de gnyis kyis la phul ba'i rdzas ni dge 'dun gyi snum bag gi rnyed par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis la phul ba'i rdzas ni dge 'dun gyi snum bag gi rnyed par bya ba'o //
translated: The property offered to those two is for the acquisition of oil for the saṅgha.

original: yang na skye ba'i rabs kyi sde bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: yang na skye ba'i rabs kyi sde bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Or, the jātaka collection should be written.

original: snga ma de gnyis kyi sa la phul ba'i rdzas de'i yang na 'dir spyad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma de gnyis kyi sa la phul ba'i rdzas de'i yang na 'dir spyad par bya ba'o //
translated: The property offered to the ground of those two previous ones is also to be used here.

original: bang rim dang 'chags dang sgo khang dang khyams dag la phul ba ni bgo ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bang rim dang 'chags dang sgo khang dang khyams dag la phul ba ni bgo ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The property offered to the terraces, the stairs, the door-chambers, and the courtyards is to be distributed.

original: de dag gi sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni dge 'dun gyis bgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sa la phul ba'i rdzas ni dge 'dun gyis bgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: The property offered to the ground of those is to be distributed by the saṅgha.

original: rdzing bu'i yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzing bu'i yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the pond means

original: rdzing bu'i sa la phul ba'i rdzas kyang bgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdzing bu'i sa la phul ba'i rdzas kyang bgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: that the substance offered to the pond should also be distributed.

original: kha cig las de ni phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi nyid du bzhag go zhes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig las de ni phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi nyid du bzhag go zhes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Some say that it should be set aside for the Saṅgha of the four directions.

original: gzhung kha cig las rdzing bu'i sa la phul ba'i rdzas de ni 'di ltar bya'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las rdzing bu'i sa la phul ba'i rdzas de ni 'di ltar bya'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: This means that some texts say, The substance offered to the pond should be treated like this.

original: dkon mchog gi don du bslang du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dkon mchog gi don du bslang du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is suitable to take for the sake of the Three Jewels.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi don du dge slong gis gzhan la yo byad blang du rung ba'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi don du dge slong gis gzhan la yo byad blang du rung ba'o //
translated: This means that it is suitable for a monk to take requisites from others for the sake of the Three Jewels.

original: bsgrag tu yang ngo zhes bya ba yang rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin bdag rnams kyi ming nyan du gzhug pa ni bsgrag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgrag tu yang ngo zhes bya ba yang rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar te / sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin bdag rnams kyi ming nyan du gzhug pa ni bsgrag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is also suitable to proclaim.🔽This means that it is suitable to proclaim the names of those who give and the gifts.

original: bsngo byang dang smon lam klag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsngo byang dang smon lam klag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means to recite the dedication, purification, and aspiration prayers.

original: gang gi che bsgrag par bya zhe na de'i phyir len pa'i tshe'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gi che bsgrag par bya zhe na de'i phyir len pa'i tshe'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it is asked for what purpose, it is said, “at the time of receiving.”

original: rnyed pa 'bul ba len pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa 'bul ba len pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: At the time of receiving the offered wealth.

original: mthong bar bya ba'i phyir 'phang lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthong bar bya ba'i phyir 'phang lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to be seen, a wheel.

original: sgrog par byed pa gzhan gyis mthong bar bya ba'i phyir der 'phang lo bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrog par byed pa gzhan gyis mthong bar bya ba'i phyir der 'phang lo bya ba'o //
translated: In order to be seen by others who proclaim it, a wheel is made there.

original: 'dir 'phang lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir 'phang lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, a wheel is

original: 'phang lo gnyis dang ldan pa'i shing rta yin par dgongs te /
analyzed: 'phang lo gnyis dang ldan pa'i shing rta yin par dgongs te /
translated: a chariot having two wheels.

original: de'i steng nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng nas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: It is intended to be accomplished on top of that.🔽In order to not be touched by the harm of wind, rain, and snow, a four-doored

original: cha ba dang rlung dang char pa'i gnod pas mi reg par bya ba'i phyir khang pa brtsegs pa sgo bzhi dang ldan pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cha ba dang rlung dang char pa'i gnod pas mi reg par bya ba'i phyir khang pa brtsegs pa sgo bzhi dang ldan pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: house is also made.

original: bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: It is said, “one should make.”

original: tsha ba la sogs pa'i gnod pas sgrog par byed pa'i dge slong la mi reg par bya ba'i phyir 'phang lo de'i steng du khang pa brtsegs pa sgo bzhi dang ldan par bya'o //🔽dus ston gyi rjes la 'phang lo rtul lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tsha ba la sogs pa'i gnod pas sgrog par byed pa'i dge slong la mi reg par bya ba'i phyir 'phang lo de'i steng du khang pa brtsegs pa sgo bzhi dang ldan par bya'o // dus ston gyi rjes la 'phang lo rtul lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order that the monks who are bound by the heat and so on do not touch the wheel, a house with four doors should be built on top of it.🔽After the festival, the wheel should be removed.

original: dus ston zin pa'i rjes la 'phang lo brtul zhing sba bar bya ba'o //
