analyzed: dus ston zin pa'i rjes la 'phang lo brtul zhing sba bar bya ba'o //
translated: After the festival, the wheel should be removed and hidden.

original: snod spyad 'drub pas rnyed par drub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snod spyad 'drub pas rnyed par drub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The utensils should be made by the monk who is a craftsman.

original: dus ston de la rnyed pa byung ba gang yin pa de dag dge slong snod spyad 'drub pas drub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus ston de la rnyed pa byung ba gang yin pa de dag dge slong snod spyad 'drub pas drub par bya ba'o //
translated: The utensils that are obtained at that festival should be made by the monk who is a craftsman.

original: gnyi ga lam bsngos pa ston pa mchod pa'i tshe phul ba dge 'dun gyi la dge slong ma rnams kyi 'jug pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga lam bsngos pa ston pa mchod pa'i tshe phul ba dge 'dun gyi la dge slong ma rnams kyi 'jug pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When the Teacher is worshipped, the offering to both is dedicated to the path. The offering made to the Sangha of monks is not to be used by the nuns.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun dang dge slong ma'i dge @196a * //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun dang dge slong ma'i dge @196a * //
translated: The Sangha of monks and the Sangha of nuns

original: 'dun gnyi ga la thun mong du ma bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dge slong rnams kyis ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs kyang ston pa yin pas /🔽de mchod pa'i tshe byung ba dge 'dun dbang ba la ni /
analyzed: 'dun gnyi ga la thun mong du ma bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dge slong rnams kyis ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs kyang ston pa yin pas / de mchod pa'i tshe byung ba dge 'dun dbang ba la ni /
translated: The Sangha of monks does not have a share in the property dedicated to both the Sangha and the Buddha,

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis 'jug pa med de skal ba mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis 'jug pa med de skal ba mi dbang ngo //
translated: but when it is offered to the Buddha, the Sangha of nuns does not have a share in it.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma rnams kyis byas pa'i tshe dge slong ma la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa byung ba gang yin pa de la ni yang dge slong rnams kyis 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma rnams kyis byas pa'i tshe dge slong ma la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa byung ba gang yin pa de la ni yang dge slong rnams kyis 'jug pa med do //
translated: Similarly, when the Sangha of nuns performs a rite, the Sangha of monks does not have a share in the property dedicated to the Sangha of nuns.

original: gnyi gas byas pa na gnyi ga la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa byung ba gang yin pa de la ni gnyi ga'i 'jug pa yod de /🔽gnyi ga dbang ngo //
analyzed: gnyi gas byas pa na gnyi ga la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa byung ba gang yin pa de la ni gnyi ga'i 'jug pa yod de / gnyi ga dbang ngo //
translated: When both the Sangha of monks and the Sangha of nuns perform a rite, both have a share in the property dedicated to both.

original: 'di la gcig gi nang du de dag gis 'phang lo tha dad pa btsugs pa ni nyes ba spom po'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la gcig gi nang du de dag gis 'phang lo tha dad pa btsugs pa ni nyes ba spom po'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard, if they establish separate wheels within one Sangha, this is a gross fault.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here means

original: sangs rgyas rje btsun la sogs pa mchod pa la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rje btsun la sogs pa mchod pa la'o //
translated: in the worship of the Lord Buddha, etc.

original: gcig gi nang du zhes bya ba ni mchod pa gang du dge slong rnams kyis 'phong lo btsugs pa de nyid kyi nang du'o //
analyzed: gcig gi nang du zhes bya ba ni mchod pa gang du dge slong rnams kyis 'phong lo btsugs pa de nyid kyi nang du'o //
translated: In the same place means in the very same place where the monks set up the wheel.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dag gis te /
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dag gis te /
translated: By them means by the nuns.

original: der dge slong ma dag gis 'phang lo tha dad pa gzhan btsugs na de dag la dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi skabs su gtogs pa'i nyes pa sbom po 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der dge slong ma dag gis 'phang lo tha dad pa gzhan btsugs na de dag la dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi skabs su gtogs pa'i nyes pa sbom po 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nuns set up a separate wheel there, they commit a serious offense belonging to the category of schism in the community.

original: gzhan du btsugs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan du btsugs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if they set it up elsewhere.

original: snod spyad 'ged pas bgo par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snod spyad 'ged pas bgo par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The distributor of goods should distribute them.

original: dus ston de la byung ba'i rnyed pa gang yin pa de dag gang zag snod spyad 'ged pas bgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus ston de la byung ba'i rnyed pa gang yin pa de dag gang zag snod spyad 'ged pas bgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: The goods that arise from that festival should be distributed by the distributor of goods.

original: de bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should be appointed.

original: dge 'dun gyis kyang gang zag snod spyad bged pa de spro bar byas nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis kyang gang zag snod spyad bged pa de spro bar byas nas /
translated: The community should encourage the person who distributes the goods.

original: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsko bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsko bar bya ba'o //
translated: The monk who is to be appointed is asked, and the appointment is made by means of a formal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement.

original: 'di'i sngags ni ming 'di zhes bgyi ba khyod dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par spro'am /
analyzed: 'di'i sngags ni ming 'di zhes bgyi ba khyod dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par spro'am /
translated: The formula for the appointment is as follows: “So-and-so, do you agree to distribute the Saṅgha’s utensils?”🔽“I agree.”

original: spro'o // dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: spro'o // dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable members of the Saṅgha, please listen!

original: ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par spro na /🔽gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par bgo ste /
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par spro na / gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par bgo ste /
translated: This person, so-and-so, agrees to distribute the Saṅgha’s utensils.🔽If the time has come for the Saṅgha and it is agreeable to you, the Saṅgha should appoint so-and-so to distribute the Saṅgha’s utensils.🔽The Saṅgha is appointing so-and-so to distribute the Saṅgha’s utensils.

original: snod spyad bged pa ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dge 'dun gyis snod spyad 'ged par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snod spyad bged pa ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dge 'dun gyis snod spyad 'ged par 'gyur ro //
translated: So-and-so will distribute the Saṅgha’s utensils.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable members of the Saṅgha, please listen!

original: ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par spro ste /
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par spro ste /
translated: This person, so-and-so, agrees to distribute the Saṅgha’s utensils.

original: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par @196b bsko ste /🔽snod spyad bged pa ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par @196b bsko ste / snod spyad bged pa ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, the Saṅgha is appointing so-and-so as the distributor of the Saṅgha’s goods.🔽If the appointment of so-and-so as the distributor of the Saṅgha’s goods is pleasing to the venerable ones, let them be silent.🔽He to whom it is not pleasing should speak.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis🔽ming 'di zhes bgyi pa snod spyad bged par bskos lags te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge 'dun gyi snod spyad bged par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis ming 'di zhes bgyi pa snod spyad bged par bskos lags te /
translated: The Saṅgha has appointed so-and-so as the distributor of the Saṅgha’s goods.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since there is silence, it is considered that this is pleasing to the venerable ones.

original: des ji ltar bgo bar bya zhe na de'i phyir btsong bar bya ba rnams btsongs te'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des ji ltar bgo bar bya zhe na de'i phyir btsong bar bya ba rnams btsongs te'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How should he distribute them? Therefore it is said, “Having sold those that are to be sold.”

original: btsong bar 'os pa ni btsong bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: btsong bar 'os pa ni btsong bar bya ba ste /
translated: Those that are suitable to be sold are to be sold.

original: gos la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: gos la sogs pa'o ;
translated: They are robes and so forth.

original: / de dag ni btsongs te bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: / de dag ni btsongs te bgo bar bya'o //
translated: They should be sold and divided.

original: su la btsongs te zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: su la btsongs te zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: To whom should they be sold?

original: dge 'dun 'dus pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'dus pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “to the assembled Saṅgha.”

original: gang du dge 'dun du gyur ba'i dge slong rnams 'dus par gyur pa de la'o //
analyzed: gang du dge 'dun du gyur ba'i dge slong rnams 'dus par gyur pa de la'o //
translated: To whomsoever the Saṅgha has become, to the assembled monks.

original: ji ltar btsongs te zhe na de'i phyir bskyed pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar btsongs te zhe na de'i phyir bskyed pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How should they be sold? Therefore, it is said, “by means of an auction.”

original: btsong bar bya ba'i dngos po'i rin thang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis ran par bcad pa de las su nyo 'dod pas bskyed pa'i thabs des btsangs te'o //
analyzed: btsong bar bya ba'i dngos po'i rin thang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis ran par bcad pa de las su nyo 'dod pas bskyed pa'i thabs des btsangs te'o //
translated: The Saṅgha’s senior monk should determine the value of the goods to be sold. Whoever wishes to buy them should do so by means of the method of an auction.

original: de nyid kyis der 'du ba'i skabs rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyis der 'du ba'i skabs rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By that very method, the occasion for gathering should be subsequently accomplished.

original: snod spyad 'ged pa'i gang zag de nyid kyis dge 'dun gang du 'du ba'i gnas der 'du ba'i skabs zhes bya ba dge 'dun 'du ba dang 'brel pa gnas mal bsham pa dang rnyed pa bgo ba la lnga bya'o zhes sngar bstan pa de dag rjes su bsgrub
analyzed: snod spyad 'ged pa'i gang zag de nyid kyis dge 'dun gang du 'du ba'i gnas der 'du ba'i skabs zhes bya ba dge 'dun 'du ba dang 'brel pa gnas mal bsham pa dang rnyed pa bgo ba la lnga bya'o zhes sngar bstan pa de dag rjes su bsgrub
translated: The person who distributes the goods should perform the five actions that were previously taught, called “the occasion of the assembly” in the place where the Saṅgha is assembled.

original: par bya ste las su bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: par bya ste las su bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He should perform, should do, those five actions that are related to the assembly of the Saṅgha, the preparation of the seats, and the distribution of the goods.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis rin thang gdab po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis rin thang gdab po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Saṅgha’s most senior monk should determine the value.

original: btsong bar bya ba'i dngos po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: btsong bar bya ba'i dngos po rnams kyi'o //
translated: This refers to the things that are to be sold.🔽If you ask, “What is the value at which they should be determined?”

original: rin thang ji tsam du gdab par bya zhe na de'i phyir ran par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rin thang ji tsam du gdab par bya zhe na de'i phyir ran par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the text says, “At a fair price.”

original: dang po su la yang btsong bar ma brims pa'i mdun du dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis btsong bar bya ba'i rdzas rnams kyi rin thang ran par gdab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po su la yang btsong bar ma brims pa'i mdun du dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis btsong bar bya ba'i rdzas rnams kyi rin thang ran par gdab par bya ba'o //
translated: The Saṅgha’s most senior monk should determine the fair price of the goods that are to be sold in the presence of those to whom they are not to be sold first.

original: das ni de la mi 'bab pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: das ni de la mi 'bab pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “That price is not appropriate for it” means

original: rin thang btab pa des ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan de la rdzas de nyo ba dang de'i rin gzhal ba mi 'bab pa nyid do //
analyzed: rin thang btab pa des ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan de la rdzas de nyo ba dang de'i rin gzhal ba mi 'bab pa nyid do //
translated: The value of the object does not match the price of the object or the price of the object of the elder of the Saṅgha.

original: rin thang btab pa'i 'og tu bskyed na ni de la yang 'bab pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rin thang btab pa'i 'og tu bskyed na ni de la yang 'bab pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is produced after the value has been set, then it does match.

original: yang mi 'byung bar nges bar byas nas bskyed pa la dbab bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang mi 'byung bar nges bar byas nas bskyed pa la dbab bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having made certain that it will not occur again, it should be produced.

original: sngar dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis spyi'i rin thang ran par btab nas snod spyad bged pa'i @197a * //
analyzed: sngar dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis spyi'i rin thang ran par btab nas snod spyad bged pa'i @197a * //
translated: The elder of the Saṅgha first sets the general value appropriately, and the person who distributes the goods

original: gang zag gis rdzas de lag na thogs te /
analyzed: gang zag gis rdzas de lag na thogs te /
translated: holds the object in their hand.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan man chad gsar bu yan chad de na 'dus pa thams cad kyi mdun du rdzas de g-yar snga brim zhing rdzas 'di ni 'di tsam ri'o zhes bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan man chad gsar bu yan chad de na 'dus pa thams cad kyi mdun du rdzas de g-yar snga brim zhing rdzas 'di ni 'di tsam ri'o zhes bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: In front of all those assembled, from the elder of the Saṅgha down to the newest member, the object is passed around and it is announced, “This object is worth this much.”

original: de'i cho gang zag gis rdzas de'i rin yang bskyed pa gzhan mi 'byung bar nges par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i cho gang zag gis rdzas de'i rin yang bskyed pa gzhan mi 'byung bar nges par byas nas /
translated: The person who is performing the rite produces the value of the object, making certain that it will not occur again.

original: rdzas de'i rin sngar bcad pa las bskyed na de la rdzas de mi nyor mi gnang ba dang rin bskyed pa dang bcas pa mi dbul du mi gnang ba 'bab po //
analyzed: rdzas de'i rin sngar bcad pa las bskyed na de la rdzas de mi nyor mi gnang ba dang rin bskyed pa dang bcas pa mi dbul du mi gnang ba 'bab po //
translated: If the price of that substance is increased from the previously determined price, then it is not permitted to not sell that substance or to not give it for the increased price.

original: de bzhin du des bskyed pa'i gang du gzhan gcig gis yang bskyed pa gzhan mi 'byung bar nges par byas nas bskyed na de la 'bab po //
analyzed: de bzhin du des bskyed pa'i gang du gzhan gcig gis yang bskyed pa gzhan mi 'byung bar nges par byas nas bskyed na de la 'bab po //
translated: Similarly, if he increases the price after determining that another will not increase the price further, then it is not permitted to not sell it or to not give it for the increased price.

original: de bzhin du des bskyed pa'i gong du gzhan gcig gis yang bskyed pa gzhan mi 'byung bar nges par byas nas bskyed na de la 'bab ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du des bskyed pa'i gong du gzhan gcig gis yang bskyed pa gzhan mi 'byung bar nges par byas nas bskyed na de la 'bab ste /
translated: Similarly, if he increases the price after determining that another will not increase the price further, then it is not permitted to not sell it or to not give it for the increased price.

original: de bzhin du gong nas gong du bskyed cing tha mar de las zlo zhing gong du skyed par byed pas su'ang ma byung na de'i tshe snod spyad bged pa des dge 'dun thams cad gyi mgo 'jug tu lan cig bzlas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gong nas gong du bskyed cing tha mar de las zlo zhing gong du skyed par byed pas su'ang ma byung na de'i tshe snod spyad bged pa des dge 'dun thams cad gyi mgo 'jug tu lan cig bzlas te /
translated: If no one increases the price further, then that distributor of goods should recite once at the beginning and end of the Saṅgha.

original: rdzas 'di gang zag che ge mos rin 'di tsam gyis bskyed de nyos so zhes spyir bsgrags te tog brdungs nas rdzas de gang zag de'i mdun du bzhag go //
analyzed: rdzas 'di gang zag che ge mos rin 'di tsam gyis bskyed de nyos so zhes spyir bsgrags te tog brdungs nas rdzas de gang zag de'i mdun du bzhag go //
translated: The monk should announce, This article was bought by so-and-so for this much money, and he should ring the gong. The article should be placed in front of that person.

original: de phyin chad ni gzhan gyis bskyed cing nyor mi gnong ngo //
analyzed: de phyin chad ni gzhan gyis bskyed cing nyor mi gnong ngo //
translated: From that time on, it should not be used by anyone else.

original: mi nyo pas bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi nyo pas bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should not be used by the one who bought it.

original: gang zag gang rdzas de nyo par mi 'dod pa de ni mi nyo ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag gang rdzas de nyo par mi 'dod pa de ni mi nyo ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The one who does not want to buy that article is called the one who does not buy it.

original: des de'i tshe bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des de'i tshe bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not use it at that time.

original: bud med mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bud med mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should not be used by a woman.

original: dge slong bud med nyo bas ni rin de ltar bskyed par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong bud med nyo bas ni rin de ltar bskyed par mi bya ba ste /
translated: A monk should not buy a woman for that much money.

original: gzhung ni sngar mgon med zas sbyin gyi byung ba'i mtha' bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhung ni sngar mgon med zas sbyin gyi byung ba'i mtha' bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: The text is the same as the previous explanation of the story of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: rin ma phul gyi bar du spyad pa dang byi dor yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rin ma phul gyi bar du spyad pa dang byi dor yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should not be used or cleaned until the price is paid.

original: gang zag gang gis dge 'dun gyi rdzas bskyed de nyos pa des dge 'dun la rin ma phul gyi par du gos la sogs pa bgo ba la sogs pas spyad par yang mi bya la /
analyzed: gang zag gang gis dge 'dun gyi rdzas bskyed de nyos pa des dge 'dun la rin ma phul gyi par du gos la sogs pa bgo ba la sogs pas spyad par yang mi bya la /
translated: One who generates and purchases the Saṅgha’s property should not use it, such as wearing robes, until the price is offered to the Saṅgha.

original: bkru ba dang kha bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i byi dor yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: bkru ba dang kha bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i byi dor yang mi bya'o //
translated: And one should not wash or dye it, and so on.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bya ba gzhan yang dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽bgo skal ba rnams mang ba nyid yin na bcu la sogs pa'i tshoms kyis bgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bya ba gzhan yang dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir ro // bgo skal ba rnams mang ba nyid yin na bcu la sogs pa'i tshoms kyis bgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “also” indicates that other actions are also prohibited.🔽If there are many shares, they should be distributed by groups of ten and so on.

original: bgo skal ba zhes bya ba rnyed pa'i bgo skal dbang ba'i gang zag mang ba nyid yin na bcu la sogs pa'i tshoms kyis bgo bar bya ste /
analyzed: bgo skal ba zhes bya ba rnyed pa'i bgo skal dbang ba'i gang zag mang ba nyid yin na bcu la sogs pa'i tshoms kyis bgo bar bya ste /
translated: If there are many individuals who have a share in the property, that is, who have a right to the property, it should be distributed by groups of ten and so on.

original: gang zag bcu'i skal ba tshoms gcig tu bcad pa'am nyi shu'i skal @197b ba tshoms gcig tu bcad bar ma sum cu'i skal ba tshoms gcig tu bcad pa la sogs pa dang de bzhin du brgya'i skal ba tshoms gcig tu bcad pa'am /
analyzed: gang zag bcu'i skal ba tshoms gcig tu bcad pa'am nyi shu'i skal @197b ba tshoms gcig tu bcad bar ma sum cu'i skal ba tshoms gcig tu bcad pa la sogs pa dang de bzhin du brgya'i skal ba tshoms gcig tu bcad pa'am /
translated: The portion of the share of ten persons is combined into one group, or the portion of the share of twenty persons is combined into one group, or the portion of the share of thirty persons is combined into one group, and so on.🔽Similarly, the portion of the share of one hundred persons is combined into one group,

original: nyis brgya'i skal ba tshoms gcig tu bcad pa'am /
analyzed: nyis brgya'i skal ba tshoms gcig tu bcad pa'am /
translated: or the portion of the share of two hundred persons is combined into one group,

original: sum brgya'i skal ba tshoms gcig tu bcad pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //🔽phog pa ma bgos par tshoms las 'ga' zhig shi na de'i skal ba tshoms des dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sum brgya'i skal ba tshoms gcig tu bcad pa la sogs pa lta bu'o // phog pa ma bgos par tshoms las 'ga' zhig shi na de'i skal ba tshoms des dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or the portion of the share of three hundred persons is combined into one group, and so on.🔽If some die from among those who have not distributed the combined share, the share of those who have died belongs to the remaining members of the group.

original: tshoms gcig gi rnyed pa'i skal ba phog ba sgo gses su ma bgos par tshoms de las gang zag 'ga' zhig shin de'i skal ba tshoms de pa'i gang zag du yod pa dag spyir dbang ba nyad yin no //
analyzed: tshoms gcig gi rnyed pa'i skal ba phog ba sgo gses su ma bgos par tshoms de las gang zag 'ga' zhig shin de'i skal ba tshoms de pa'i gang zag du yod pa dag spyir dbang ba nyad yin no //
translated: The share of the gain of one group that has not been distributed to each individual is the share of those who remain.

original: bgos pa'i 'og tu shin ni de'i skal pa mtshams su gtogs pa'i rab tu byung ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis shi ba'i yo byad du byin gyis brlab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bgos pa'i 'og tu shin ni de'i skal pa mtshams su gtogs pa'i rab tu byung ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis shi ba'i yo byad du byin gyis brlab par bya ba'o //
translated: After the division, the remaining property belongs to the monks who are his heirs, and they should consecrate it as property of the deceased.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni gos stong phrag brgya pa dang zas ro brgya pa dang khang pa brtsegs pa lnga brgya pa yang 'os so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni gos stong phrag brgya pa dang zas ro brgya pa dang khang pa brtsegs pa lnga brgya pa yang 'os so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is proper to give a monk who has renounced the world with the intention of attaining nirvana, and who is endowed with moral discipline, a hundred thousand robes, a hundred flavors of food, and five hundred mansions.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung ba'i gang zag tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni sbyin bdag lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gang yang rung bas gos dang zas dang gnas rnam pa de lta bu dag phul yang blang zhing longs spyad par 'os🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung ba'i gang zag tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni sbyin bdag lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gang yang rung bas gos dang zas dang gnas rnam pa de lta bu dag phul yang blang zhing longs spyad par 'os pa yin no //
translated: It is proper for a donor, whether human or divine, to give such things to a monk who has renounced the world with the intention of attaining nirvana and who is endowed with moral discipline.

original: gos gang k'ar sh'a pa na 'bum ri bde ni gos stong phrag brgya pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gos gang k'ar sh'a pa na 'bum ri bde ni gos stong phrag brgya pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A robe worth one hundred thousand kārṣāpaṇas is called a robe worth one hundred thousand.

original: zas gang la ro'i rnam pa brgya yod pa de ni kha zas ro brgya pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zas gang la ro'i rnam pa brgya yod pa de ni kha zas ro brgya pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Food that has a hundred tastes is called “food with a hundred tastes.”

original: khang pa brtsegs pa gang la mi lnga brgya'i gnas bcar rung ba'am /
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa gang la mi lnga brgya'i gnas bcar rung ba'am /
translated: A multi-storied building that can accommodate five hundred people or

original: yang na ne tso'i sna lta bu lnga brgya yod pa de ni khang pa brtsegs pa lnga brgya pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ne tso'i sna lta bu lnga brgya yod pa de ni khang pa brtsegs pa lnga brgya pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that has five hundred openings like the beak of a parrot is called “a multi-storied building for five hundred.”

original: dge 'dun gyi rdzas kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rdzas kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: The property of the Saṅgha is also appropriate.

original: 'os so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'os so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The word “appropriate” is supplied.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni dge 'dun gyi rdzas kyang blang zhing longs spyad par 'os pa yin no //🔽dge 'dun gyi rdzas rnam pa ji lta bu zhig 'os she na de'i phyir mi slob pa man chad kyi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni dge 'dun gyi rdzas kyang blang zhing longs spyad par 'os pa yin no // dge 'dun gyi rdzas rnam pa ji lta bu zhig 'os she na de'i phyir mi slob pa man chad kyi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The property of the Saṅgha is also appropriate to take and use by one who has gone forth with the intention of attaining nirvāṇa and who is endowed with morality.🔽What kind of property of the Saṅgha is appropriate? Therefore it is said:🔽The property of those below the nonlearner.

original: mi slob pa'i dge 'dun man chad kyi rdzas te /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i dge 'dun man chad kyi rdzas te /
translated: The property of the Saṅgha of nonlearners and those below them.

original: dgra bcom pa'i dge 'dun mnga' pa'i rdzas kyang 'os pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dge 'dun mnga' pa'i rdzas kyang 'os pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The property of the Saṅgha of Arhats is also suitable for them.🔽With respect to what kind of morality?

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnam pa gang la zhe na de'i phyir so so'i skye bo la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnam pa gang la zhe na de'i phyir so so'i skye bo la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says: even for an ordinary person.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras 'phags pa 'ba' zhig la 'os par ma @198a * //🔽zad do zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras 'phags pa 'ba' zhig la 'os par ma @198a * // zad do zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: The word even indicates that it is not only suitable for the noble ones.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not for one of faulty morality.

original: gos stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa dang dge 'dun gyi rdzas 'os pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gos stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa dang dge 'dun gyi rdzas 'os pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: One of faulty morality is not suitable for the hundred thousand robes and so on, and for the property of the Saṅgha.

original: le lo can la ni blangs pa dang nye bar spyad pa bu lon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: le lo can la ni blangs pa dang nye bar spyad pa bu lon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the lazy, it becomes a debt to take and to use.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa le lo can zhes bya ba bsgrub mi phod pa'i rang bzhin can la ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa le lo can zhes bya ba bsgrub mi phod pa'i rang bzhin can la ni /
translated: For the lazy one who possesses morality, one of a nature that cannot accomplish,

original: blangs pa zhes bya ba bdag gir byas pa dang / nye bar spyad pa zhes bya ba longs spyod pa dag bu lon du 'gyur zhes bya ba tshe rabs gzhan la sbyin bdag de la dpya 'jal pa'am /
analyzed: blangs pa zhes bya ba bdag gir byas pa dang / nye bar spyad pa zhes bya ba longs spyod pa dag bu lon du 'gyur zhes bya ba tshe rabs gzhan la sbyin bdag de la dpya 'jal pa'am /
translated: What is called “taken” is appropriated, and what is called “enjoyed” is used.

original: de'i bran g-yog dang phyugs la sogs par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽mtshams kyi nang nyid na gang zag gi gtsug lag khang ngam de'i rnyed pas 'tsho ba la ni dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa 'os so zhes bya ba ni /🔽gang zag gang dge 'dun gyi mtshams kyi nang na gang zag gi gtsug lag khang yod pa de'i 'tsho bas 'tsho ba'am /
analyzed: de'i bran g-yog dang phyugs la sogs par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mtshams kyi nang nyid na gang zag gi gtsug lag khang ngam de'i rnyed pas 'tsho ba la ni dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa 'os so zhes bya ba ni / gang zag gang dge 'dun gyi mtshams kyi nang na gang zag gi gtsug lag khang yod pa de'i 'tsho bas 'tsho ba'am /
translated: It is like a debt, meaning that in other lives, one is born as a debtor to that benefactor, or as his servant, cattle, and so on.🔽If a person’s temple or his gain is within the boundary, it is suitable for the Saṅgha’s gain.🔽If a person’s temple is within the boundary of the Saṅgha, it is suitable for the Saṅgha’s gain.

original: gang zag gi gtsug lag khang mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug pa de'i rnyed pas 'cho zhing mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa de la mtshams der gtogs pa'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa yang 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zag gi gtsug lag khang mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug pa de'i rnyed pas 'cho zhing mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa de la mtshams der gtogs pa'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa yang 'os pa yin te /
translated: If a person’s temple is outside the boundary, it is suitable for the Saṅgha’s gain if he lives within the boundary and uses the gain of that temple.

original: gang zag gis spyad pa'i rnyed pa dang dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gnyi ga dbang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang zag gis spyad pa'i rnyed pa dang dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gnyi ga dbang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that both the individual and the Saṅgha are entitled to the offerings.

original: nges pa'i gnas khang na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nges pa'i gnas khang na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, in a defined dwelling place.

original: sbyin bdag gis gnas khang 'di na su gnas pa de la rnyed pa 'di tsam zhig khud par dbul lo zhes nges par byas pa'i gnas khang de ni su gnas pa'i gang zag de la yang gnas khang de'i rnyed pa dang mtshams de'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa🔽gnyi ga 'os pa yin te /🔽de gnyi ga dbang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis gnas khang 'di na su gnas pa de la rnyed pa 'di tsam zhig khud par dbul lo zhes nges par byas pa'i gnas khang de ni su gnas pa'i gang zag de la yang gnas khang de'i rnyed pa dang mtshams de'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gnyi ga 'os pa yin te / de gnyi ga dbang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If a donor defines a dwelling place, saying, “I will give this much to whoever dwells in this dwelling place,” then both the individual who dwells there and the Saṅgha of that boundary are entitled to the offerings of that dwelling place.🔽It is said that both are entitled to it.

original: de re mor bsko'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de re mor bsko'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said that it should be distributed in turn.

original: rnyed pa nges pa'i gnas khang de dge slong rnams la re mor bsko bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa nges pa'i gnas khang de dge slong rnams la re mor bsko bar bya ba ste /
translated: That defined dwelling place should be distributed in turn to the monks.

original: de'i rnyed pa dge 'dun gyis kyang mi bskur la /
analyzed: de'i rnyed pa dge 'dun gyis kyang mi bskur la /
translated: The Saṅgha does not distribute its offerings to them,

original: dus thams cad du gang zag gcig pu la yang mi sbyin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad du gang zag gcig pu la yang mi sbyin no //
translated: but they are not given to a single individual at all times.

original: lcags las byas pa'i snod spyad dag las lhung bzed dang lhung bzed chung du dang tshva snod dang zo phor dang lde mig khyog po dang gri'u dang khab dang sen mo gcad pa dang nal ze dang thal phyags dang sta re dang slang dang phor bu dag ni
analyzed: lcags las byas pa'i snod spyad dag las lhung bzed dang lhung bzed chung du dang tshva snod dang zo phor dang lde mig khyog po dang gri'u dang khab dang sen mo gcad pa dang nal ze dang thal phyags dang sta re dang slang dang phor bu dag ni
translated: The iron objects that are to be distributed are the large and small begging bowls, the salt container, the plate, the key ring, the knife, the needle, the nail clipper, the tweezers, the broom, the axe, the pan, and the cup.

original: bgo bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bgo bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These are to be distributed.

original: lcags las byas pa'i snod spyad dag las de dag ni bgo bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: lcags las byas pa'i snod spyad dag las de dag ni bgo bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: These iron objects are to be distributed.

original: bong tshod chen po gzhan dag ni mi bgo bar phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi @198b nyid du gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bong tshod chen po gzhan dag ni mi bgo bar phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi @198b nyid du gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: The other large objects are not to be distributed, but are to be kept by the Saṅgha of the four directions.

original: lhung bzed chur du zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab tu mi rung ba chung du'o //🔽tshva snod ces bya ba ni /🔽lan tshva'i snod ngo //
analyzed: lhung bzed chur du zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab tu mi rung ba chung du'o // tshva snod ces bya ba ni / lan tshva'i snod ngo //
translated: The small begging bowl is too small to be consecrated.🔽The salt container is🔽the container for salt.

original: zo por ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: zo por ces bya ba ni /
translated: The plate is

original: kha zlum 'dra ba mthon po nang zabs ring ba'o //
analyzed: kha zlum 'dra ba mthon po nang zabs ring ba'o //
translated: like a round mouth, high, deep inside, and long.

original: thal phyags zhes bya ba ni me 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: thal phyags zhes bya ba ni me 'jog pa'o //
translated: The broom is for placing fire.

original: khri ni bgo bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: khri ni bgo bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: But the throne is not to be dyed.

original: tshon rtsi ni lnga las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshon rtsi ni lnga las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The dye is other than the five great dyes.

original: gur gum la sogs pa tshon chen po sna lnga las gzhan bdag bgo bar bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: gur gum la sogs pa tshon chen po sna lnga las gzhan bdag bgo bar bya ba nyid de /
translated: The dye is to be applied to what is to be dyed, other than the five great dyes such as saffron.

original: ci gnas skabs thams cad dam zhe na de'i phyir ma bskol pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci gnas skabs thams cad dam zhe na de'i phyir ma bskol pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Is it in all circumstances? Therefore it is said: “unboiled.”

original: gal te ma bskol na'o //🔽bskol ba ni kha bsgyur bar bya ba la sbyar bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te ma bskol na'o // bskol ba ni kha bsgyur bar bya ba la sbyar bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is unboiled.

original: tshon rtsi chen po bskol ba ni kha bsgyur bar 'os pa'i gos la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshon rtsi chen po bskol ba ni kha bsgyur bar 'os pa'i gos la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: The boiled great dye is to be applied to cloth, etc. that is fit to be dyed.

original: kha bsgyur bar bya ba gang la zhe na de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: kha bsgyur bar bya ba gang la zhe na de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is to be dyed? Therefore it is said: “of the Saṅgha.”

original: kha bsgyur bar bya ba gang yin pa de gal te dge 'dun gyi yin na de la sbyar bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: kha bsgyur bar bya ba gang yin pa de gal te dge 'dun gyi yin na de la sbyar bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: If what is to be dyed is of the Saṅgha, it is to be applied to it.

original: kun dga' ra pa dang gtsug lag khang dang de dag gi gzhi dang gnas mal dag ni btsor bar bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun dga' ra pa dang gtsug lag khang dang de dag gi gzhi dang gnas mal dag ni btsor bar bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A pleasure grove, a temple, their site, and a bed are not to be sold.

original: kun dga' ra ba zhes bya ba me tog gi ra ba la sogs pa dang gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba gnas khang la sogs dang de dag gi gzhi zhes bya ba kun dga' ra ba'i don dang gtsug lag khang gi don gyis gzhi dang gnas mal de
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba zhes bya ba me tog gi ra ba la sogs pa dang gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba gnas khang la sogs dang de dag gi gzhi zhes bya ba kun dga' ra ba'i don dang gtsug lag khang gi don gyis gzhi dang gnas mal de
translated: A pleasure grove is a flower garden, etc. A temple is a dwelling place, etc. Their site is the site of a pleasure grove and the site of a temple. A bed is a bed, a bench, a mattress, a pillow, etc.

original: dag ni btsong bar bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dag ni btsong bar bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: These are not to be sold.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bgo bar bya ba yang ma yin par bstan to //🔽gzhag par bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bgo bar bya ba yang ma yin par bstan to // gzhag par bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “also” indicates that they are not to be bartered.🔽They are not to be set aside.

original: de dag gtar gzhag par bya ba nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gtar gzhag par bya ba nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are not to be set aside for personal use.

original: byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid ma yin no @199a * //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid ma yin no @199a * //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are not to be consecrated.🔽This means that they are not to be consecrated for personal use.

original: tshon chen pos kha bsgyur ba ni gang zag gi nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshon chen pos kha bsgyur ba ni gang zag gi nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It should not be consecrated as belonging to a particular person.

original: pha ma la gos dang zas kyis bstabs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pha ma la gos dang zas kyis bstabs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should provide one’s parents with clothing and food” means

original: pha ma dag la zas dang gos kyis 'tsho ba'i mthud pa gtang bar bya pa'o //
analyzed: pha ma dag la zas dang gos kyis 'tsho ba'i mthud pa gtang bar bya pa'o //
translated: that one should give one’s parents the means of subsistence, such as food and clothing.

original: ji ltar gtang par bya zhe na de'i phyir gal te lhung bzed dang chos gos las lhag pa'i rnyed pa med na bslangs te'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar gtang par bya zhe na de'i phyir gal te lhung bzed dang chos gos las lhag pa'i rnyed pa med na bslangs te'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How should one give? Therefore it says, “If one does not have more than a begging-bowl and Dharma robes, one should beg for them.”

original: gal te rang la lhung bzed dang chos gos las lhag pa'i rnyed pa gzhan med na yon bdag gzhan la bslangs te gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rang la lhung bzed dang chos gos las lhag pa'i rnyed pa gzhan med na yon bdag gzhan la bslangs te gtang bar bya'o //
translated: If one does not have any other possessions besides a begging-bowl and Dharma robes, one should give by begging from other benefactors.

original: ma grub na zan gyi skal ba las phyed spyin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma grub na zan gyi skal ba las phyed spyin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one is not successful, one should give half of one’s food ration.

original: bslangs te ma grub na rang gi zan gyi skal ba las phyed sbyin no //
analyzed: bslangs te ma grub na rang gi zan gyi skal ba las phyed sbyin no //
translated: If one is not successful in begging, one should give half of one’s own food ration.

original: bye brag shes par bya pa'i phyir chos gos dag la thig le bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bye brag shes par bya pa'i phyir chos gos dag la thig le bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to know the difference, one should mark one’s Dharma robes.

original: gang zag phan tshun 'dra ba dag de dang mi nor bar bya ba'i phyir chos gos kyi mthar tshon gyi thig les mtshan ma gdab par bya pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag phan tshun 'dra ba dag de dang mi nor bar bya ba'i phyir chos gos kyi mthar tshon gyi thig les mtshan ma gdab par bya pa'o //
translated: In order to avoid confusion between similar individuals, one should mark the end of the robes with a drop of dye.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong mdzes dga'i chas gos dag la thig le byos shig dang 'di ni mdzes dga'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong mdzes dga'i chas gos dag la thig le byos shig dang 'di ni mdzes dga'o //
translated: Here the text says: “Monks, you should put a drop on the robes of the monk Sundarananda, so that it will be known that this is Sundarananda,

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das so zhes shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das so zhes shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and this is the Blessed One.”

original: de dag la mtshan ma gdab po zhes bya ba ni chos gos de dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la mtshan ma gdab po zhes bya ba ni chos gos de dag la'o //
translated: “One should put a mark on them” means on those robes.

original: snag tsha'i thig le ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snag tsha'i thig le ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A drop of ink” is called that.

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ste chos gos kyi grar snag tsha'i thig le gsum bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ste chos gos kyi grar snag tsha'i thig le gsum bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “A mark” is called that. It means one should put three drops of ink on the edge of the robe.

original: lung dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lung dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The scriptures also say” means

original: chos gos dag la gdags pa ste /
analyzed: chos gos dag la gdags pa ste /
translated: that it is to be applied to the robes.

original: 'di ni mi nor bar bya ba'i mtshan ma'i skabs ma yin gyi tshon gyi las bya ba na gzang thag la dbang bus mtha' 'byar bar bya'o zhes sngar bstan pa'i skabs te ;
analyzed: 'di ni mi nor bar bya ba'i mtshan ma'i skabs ma yin gyi tshon gyi las bya ba na gzang thag la dbang bus mtha' 'byar bar bya'o zhes sngar bstan pa'i skabs te ;
translated: The statement, “When the work of dying is done, the edge of the cloth should be sewn together with a string,” is from the earlier section.

original: gos gzar thag la gdags pa'i phyir gos kyi grva grvar thag gu gdags pa la lung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gos gzar thag la gdags pa'i phyir gos kyi grva grvar thag gu gdags pa la lung zhes bya'o //
translated: The statement, “The edge of the cloth is sewn together with a string in order to attach the robe to the edge of the cloth,” is the scriptural reference.

original: kha tshar dang phun tshar gyi mthar rang chag bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha tshar dang phun tshar gyi mthar rang chag bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement, “The edge should be sewn by hand” means

original: gos kha tshar dang phun tshar gcad pa'i 'phro rang chag bya ba ste /
analyzed: gos kha tshar dang phun tshar gcad pa'i 'phro rang chag bya ba ste /
translated: that the edge of the cloth that has been cut for the hem and the binding should be sewn by hand.

original: dper na gdong phyis kyi mthar byed pa bzhin du mtha' dril ste drubs pa ni rang chag zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na gdong phyis kyi mthar byed pa bzhin du mtha' dril ste drubs pa ni rang chag zhes bya'o //
translated: The statement, “The edge is sewn by hand, like the edge of a face-cloth,” means that the edge is sewn by hand, like the edge of a face-cloth.

original: snam sbyar ma yin pa dag la dras te byin gyis brlab par nges pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snam sbyar ma yin pa dag la dras te byin gyis brlab par nges pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement, “It is not definite that the other robes should be cut and consecrated” means

original: snam sbyar ma yin pa de las gzhan pa bla gos dang mthang gos dag la'o //
analyzed: snam sbyar ma yin pa de las gzhan pa bla gos dang mthang gos dag la'o //
translated: that the other robes, the upper robe and the lower robe, are not like the patched robe.

original: dras shing drubs pa chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya bas /
analyzed: dras shing drubs pa chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya bas /
translated: He should consecrate the patched and sewn robe as the robe itself.

original: dras pa la byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga nges @199b par mdzad pa de ni snam sbyar 'ba' zhig gi yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dras pa la byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga nges @199b par mdzad pa de ni snam sbyar 'ba' zhig gi yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This rite of consecration for the patched robe should be understood as definite.

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos gos dag la ni chog 'di nges pa med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos gos dag la ni chog 'di nges pa med do //
translated: But for other robes, this rite is not definite.

original: de bas na chos gos rlag pa nyid dam chos gos tshig pa nyid la sogs pa'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na snam spyar la yang dras shing drubs pa chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab po zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di nges pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na chos gos rlag pa nyid dam chos gos tshig pa nyid la sogs pa'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na snam spyar la yang dras shing drubs pa chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab po zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di nges pa med do //
translated: Therefore, if there are conditions such as the robe being lost or burned, then this rite of consecrating the patched robe as the robe itself is not definite.

original: rkyen de lta bu dag med na ni snam sbyar la dras shing drubs po chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab bo zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di nges pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rkyen de lta bu dag med na ni snam sbyar la dras shing drubs po chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab bo zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di nges pa kho na'o //
translated: But if there are no such conditions, then this rite of consecrating the patched robe as the robe itself is definite.

original: rkyen de lta bu dag yod na ni rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: rkyen de lta bu dag yod na ni rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no /

translated: Without such conditions, one should not enter or stay in a tīrthika’s dwelling wearing the patched robe that has not been cut.

analyzed: snam sbyar ma dras pas mu stegs can gyi 'dug gnas de na mu stegs can dag nye bar mi 'khod kyang 'jug pa dang 'dug par mi bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that even if the tīrthikas are not present in that dwelling, one should not enter or stay there wearing the patched robe that has not been cut.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /

original: rkyen de lta bu dag yod na ni bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen de lta bu dag yod na ni bya'o //

translated: If tirthikas are present in those tirthika dwelling places, even if such conditions exist, one should not enter or sit there without one's outer robe.

original: 'di ltar chos gos dras pa ni kun du rgyu la sogs pa mu stegs can rnams kyi gos dang 'dra ba bsten pas der zhugs pa dang @200b 'dug par 'gyur pa gang yin pa des de'i phyogs kyi nang du bsten pa yin par dogs par 'gyur bas de
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gos dras pa ni kun du rgyu la sogs pa mu stegs can rnams kyi gos dang 'dra ba bsten pas der zhugs pa dang @200b 'dug par 'gyur pa gang yin pa des de'i phyogs kyi nang du bsten pa yin par dogs par 'gyur bas de
translated: Because if one enters or sits there, one would be suspected of relying on the robes of tirthikas such as wandering mendicants, since the patched robe is similar to their robes.

original: bas na 'dir de dgag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: bas na 'dir de dgag pa mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, this is prohibited here.

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa kun du rgyu ba'i 'dug gnas su snam sbyar ma mchis pas mchir rung ngam /
translated: Here the text says: Venerable, is it proper to enter a dwelling place of wandering mendicants without one's outer robe?

original: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: Upali, it is not proper.

original: gal te kun du rgyu dag phyi rol du byung par gyur na ni rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te kun du rgyu dag phyi rol du byung par gyur na ni rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: If the wandering mendicants were to go outside, it would be all right.

original: de na mu stegs can dag mi 'khod na rkyen de lta bu'i dbang gis 'gror rung ba'i gzhung yin no //
analyzed: de na mu stegs can dag mi 'khod na rkyen de lta bu'i dbang gis 'gror rung ba'i gzhung yin no //
translated: Since there are no tirthikas there, it is a rule that they can go there if the conditions are right.

original: spu can chos gos gsum nyid du byin gyis mi brlab bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spu can chos gos gsum nyid du byin gyis mi brlab bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not consecrate the three robes as having animal hair.

analyzed: rkyen de lta bu dag med na'o // de bgo ba'i gos su mi bsten no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the conditions are not right.🔽One should not use it as a robe to wear.

original: spu can de mal cha ma yin pa'i gos su lus la bgo par mi bya ste /
analyzed: spu can de mal cha ma yin pa'i gos su lus la bgo par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not wear that animal hair as a robe on the body, which is not a bedding robe.

original: de yang rkyen de lta bu dag med na'o //🔽seng ba dag bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang rkyen de lta bu dag med na'o // seng ba dag bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: rung bar byas te bcang ba la 'dir bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgrar gsungs so // de ni rnam pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having made it suitable, one should keep it. Here the word “keep” is used for “make one’s own.”🔽It has four types.

original: seng ba de ni rnam pa bzhi yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: seng ba de ni rnam pa bzhi yod pa nyid do //
translated: That hair has four types.

original: bzhi gang zhen de'i phyir pa la las byas pa dang zar ma las byas pa dang du gu la las byas pa dang ras bal las byas pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhen de'i phyir pa la las byas pa dang zar ma las byas pa dang du gu la las byas pa dang ras bal las byas pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What are the four? They are: made of wool, made of cotton, made of silk, and made of flax.

analyzed: shan la sogs pa las byas pa'i seng ba yang mi rung ba ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: It is not that it is improper to use a robe made of wool, etc.

original: mi sdug pas 'dir gzhi las ma smos so //
analyzed: mi sdug pas 'dir gzhi las ma smos so //
translated: But because of its ugliness, it is not mentioned here as a basis.

analyzed: spu dma' ba la sogs pa ras kyi rnam pa yang gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang bdag gir byar rung ba'o //
translated: Other types of cloth, such as those with low nap, etc., are also suitable for personal use.

analyzed: spu dma' ba zhes bya ba ni slu thung du stug po phying de 'dug pa ste be'u ras la bya'o //

analyzed: spu can gzhan yang rnam pa de 'dra na bdag gir byar rung ngo //
translated: Other types of cloth with nap are also suitable for personal use if they are of that type.

original: la ba yang ngo zhes bya ba yang bdag gir byar rung ba ste /
analyzed: la ba yang ngo zhes bya ba yang bdag gir byar rung ba ste /
translated: Cloth without nap is also suitable for personal use.

original: de ni spu dma' bam yin pa'i phyir brtsams so //
analyzed: de ni spu dma' bam yin pa'i phyir brtsams so //
translated: This is because it is not low nap.

analyzed: gnod pa med na spu phyir bstan ste bgo bar mi bya ste gzhan du na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not damaged, one should not wear it with the fur on the outside, otherwise.

analyzed: la ba de dri ma dang shig la sogs pa'i gnod pa med na spu phyir bstan te phyi slong tu bgo bar mi bya ba'o //

original: gnod pa yod na ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gnod pa yod na ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is damaged, there is no offense.

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dri ma can dang shig can la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: gzhan du na'o zhes bya ba ni nang slog tu gyon pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: Otherwise means that there is no offense for one who wears it inside out.

original: de de bzhin du gyon pas bcag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de de bzhin du gyon pas bcag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not tear it while wearing it in that way.

original: la ba de phyi slog tu de bzhin du gyon pas bcag par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: la ba de phyi slog tu de bzhin du gyon pas bcag par mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not tear that robe while wearing it in that way with the fur on the outside.

original: 'dis ni gnod pa yod na zhes bya ba dmigs kyis bsal te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gnod pa yod na zhes bya ba dmigs kyis bsal te /
translated: This is an exception to the rule about wearing it when it is damaged.

original: gnod pa yod kyang @201a * //
analyzed: gnod pa yod kyang @201a * //
translated: Even if it is damaged,

original: de de bzhin du gyon pas bcag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de de bzhin du gyon pas bcag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: one should not tear it while wearing it in that way.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis la pa spu phyir bstan te bgo bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / dge slong dag gis ba lad rdzi'i khyim nas la ba'i gos dag rnyed nas dge slong de dag shig mang bas shig dag gis zos nas mos par ma gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol nas /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis la pa spu phyir bstan te bgo bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / dge slong dag gis ba lad rdzi'i khyim nas la ba'i gos dag rnyed nas dge slong de dag shig mang bas shig dag gis zos nas mos par ma gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol nas / bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks asked the Bhagavān about this.

analyzed: la ba spu phyir bstan ste gyon la 'dug par bya zhing nyal bar yang bya'o //
translated: He said, “Wear wool with the tips of the wool on the inside. Sit and sleep in that way.

analyzed: bcag par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: par sig gi la ba dang be'u phrug dang par thang khra bo gang zag gis bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: par sig gi la ba dang be'u phrug dang par thang khra bo gang zag gis bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: par sig gi yul nas byung ba'i la ba ni par sig gi la ba zhes bya ba ste /

original: ha cang rin che ba'i phyir dgag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ha cang rin che ba'i phyir dgag pa mdzad do //
translated: Because it is very expensive, it is prohibited.

original: be'u ras kyi rigs spu de por ring pa ni be'u phrug ces bya ste /
analyzed: be'u ras kyi rigs spu de por ring pa ni be'u phrug ces bya ste /
translated: The kind of wool that is long and hairy is called “wool of the young.”

original: de la me tog gi rnam pa lta bu'i ri mo snang bas dgag par mdzad do /
analyzed: de la me tog gi rnam pa lta bu'i ri mo snang bas dgag par mdzad do /
translated: It is prohibited because it has the appearance of a flower pattern.

original: par thang khra po ni bkra ba'i phyir bkag ste /
analyzed: par thang khra po ni bkra ba'i phyir bkag ste /
translated: The multicolored is prohibited because of its brightness.

original: de dag gang zag gis bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gang zag gis bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: One should not make it one’s own.

original: rnyed pa dang thob pa nyid la bye phrag med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang thob pa nyid la bye phrag med par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the same applies to the acquisition and the possession.

original: 'chag sar par thang ga ding ba nod par bya'o zhes bya ba yang gal te khra bo yin na bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'chag sar par thang ga ding ba nod par bya'o zhes bya ba yang gal te khra bo yin na bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: “One should carry a blanket on the path” means that if it is multicolored, one should not make it one’s own.

original: khra bo ma yin na ci dgar bya'o //🔽rtag tu mal gcig tu bcag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khra bo ma yin na ci dgar bya'o // rtag tu mal gcig tu bcag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not multicolored, one may do as one wishes.

original: bar thang gi phyogs gcig kho na'i steng du rtag tu bcag par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: bar thang gi phyogs gcig kho na'i steng du rtag tu bcag par mi bya ba'o //
translated: “One should not always sleep on the same bed” means that one should not always sleep on the same spot on the bed.

original: nus pa nyid yin na brtsem pa dang lhan pa ring po dag glang pas phyir bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nus pa nyid yin na brtsem pa dang lhan pa ring po dag glang pas phyir bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one is able, one should repair the torn and worn-out parts with leather” means that if one is able, one should repair the torn and worn-out parts with leather.

original: par thang de rnyings par gyur pa na gal te phyir bcos nus pa nyid yin na de'i tshe btsem pa dang lhan pa ring pos glan pa dag gis phyir bcos par bya ba'o //
analyzed: par thang de rnyings par gyur pa na gal te phyir bcos nus pa nyid yin na de'i tshe btsem pa dang lhan pa ring pos glan pa dag gis phyir bcos par bya ba'o //
translated: If the painting is old and can be repaired, then it should be repaired with patches and long strips.

original: mi nus pa nyid na 'chag sa de nyid du lci ba dang sas byug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi nus pa nyid na 'chag sa de nyid du lci ba dang sas byug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it cannot be repaired, then it should be smeared with cow dung and clay in that very place.

original: gal te par thang de phyir bcos mi nus pa nyid yin na de'i tshe 'chags de nyid du lci ba dang sa'i byug pa bsres pas byug par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te par thang de phyir bcos mi nus pa nyid yin na de'i tshe 'chags de nyid du lci ba dang sa'i byug pa bsres pas byug par bya'o //
translated: If the painting cannot be repaired, then it should be smeared with a mixture of cow dung and clay in that very place.

original: gzhan bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Another should be made.

original: spu can dang spu dma' ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa de dag las gzhan pa par sig gi la ba la sogs pa bcang ba'o //
analyzed: spu can dang spu dma' ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa de dag las gzhan pa par sig gi la ba la sogs pa bcang ba'o //
translated: Other than those previously mentioned, such as the hairy one and the low-haired one, a painting of Parsvikavarta and so on should be made.

original: ci bdag nyid kyi nyid du 'am ji ltar bcang bar bya zhe na de'i phyir sbyin bdag la yid brtan pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci bdag nyid kyi nyid du 'am ji ltar bcang bar bya zhe na de'i phyir sbyin bdag la yid brtan pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How should it be made? Should it be made by oneself or by someone else? Therefore it is said: with confidence in the donor.

original: de dbang ba'i bsam pas de la yid @201b brtan te bcang bang bya'o //
analyzed: de dbang ba'i bsam pas de la yid @201b brtan te bcang bang bya'o //
translated: One should keep them with a mind that is firm in the thought of being worthy of them.

original: snam sbyar dang bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / sham thabs dang / sham thabs kyi gzan dang rdul gzan dang rdul gzan gyi gzan dang gdong phyis dang rnag gzan dang g-yan pa dgab pa dang skra bzed dang gding ba dang dbyar gyi gos ras chen bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snam sbyar dang bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / sham thabs dang / sham thabs kyi gzan dang rdul gzan dang rdul gzan gyi gzan dang gdong phyis dang rnag gzan dang g-yan pa dgab pa dang skra bzed dang gding ba dang dbyar gyi gos ras chen bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should keep the patched robe, the upper robe, the lower robe, the under robe, the under robe for the rainy season, the dust cover, the cover for the dust cover, the face-cloth, the cloth for the nose, the cloth for the itch, the cloth for the head, the sitting mat, and the great cloth for the rainy season.

original: yo byad bcu gsum po de dag bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yo byad bcu gsum po de dag bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: These are the thirteen articles that one should keep.

original: chos gos gnang pa de nyid du byin gyis brlabs te bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gos gnang pa de nyid du byin gyis brlabs te bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should keep the patched robe, etc., having consecrated them as the patched robe, etc.

original: snam sbyar la sogs pa'i chos gos gnang pa dag snam sbyar la sogs pa de nyid kyi ming du byin gyis brlabs te bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: snam sbyar la sogs pa'i chos gos gnang pa dag snam sbyar la sogs pa de nyid kyi ming du byin gyis brlabs te bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One should keep the patched robe, etc., the robes of the patched robe, etc., having consecrated them with the name of the patched robe, etc.🔽The mantra for them is:

original: de dag gi sngags ni tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: de dag gi sngags ni tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable one, please pay attention!

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i chos gos bgyis lags pa rung ba spyad par 'os pa 'di chos gos snam spyar du byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i chos gos bgyis lags pa rung ba spyad par 'os pa 'di chos gos snam spyar du byin gyis brlab po //
translated: I, named so-and-so, consecrate this robe, which I have made, which is suitable, and which is fit to be used, as a robe of patched cloth.

original: lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: [Recite] three times.

original: thabs yin no //
analyzed: thabs yin no //
translated: It is a means.🔽Good!

original: legs so // de bzhin du bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / sham thabs dang / sham thabs kyi gzan dang rdul gzan dang rdul gzan gyi gzan dang gdong phyis dang / rnag gzan dang / g-yan pa dgab pa dang / skra bzed dang /🔽gding ba dang dbyar gyi gos ras chen la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: legs so // de bzhin du bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / sham thabs dang / sham thabs kyi gzan dang rdul gzan dang rdul gzan gyi gzan dang gdong phyis dang / rnag gzan dang / g-yan pa dgab pa dang / skra bzed dang / gding ba dang dbyar gyi gos ras chen la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, [recite] for the upper robe, the lower robe, the inner robe, the under-blanket, the dust-cloth, the under-blanket of the dust-cloth, the face-cloth, the nose-cloth, the itch-covering cloth, the hair-catching cloth,🔽and the sitting mat. For the rainy season robe and the large cloth, [recite] as well.

original: yo byad kyi gos kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang bcad bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yo byad kyi gos kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang bcad bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The robe for requisites is also to be cut.🔽The mantra for this is:

original: 'di'i sngags ni tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: 'di'i sngags ni tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
translated: Venerable ones, please listen!

original: gos 'di bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la mkho ba'i yo byad kyi gos su byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: gos 'di bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la mkho ba'i yo byad kyi gos su byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: I consecrate this robe as a robe for requisites for myself and for those who practice pure conduct together with me.

original: lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: lan gsum bzlas /
translated: [Recite] three times.

original: thabs yin no //
analyzed: thabs yin no //
translated: It is a means.

original: legs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: legs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is good.

original: de ni dkar po nyid dang kha tshar dang phun tshar dang bcas pa la yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni dkar po nyid dang kha tshar dang phun tshar dang bcas pa la yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no fault in wearing white, with fringe and border.

original: yo byad kyi gos 'chang ba de'o //
analyzed: yo byad kyi gos 'chang ba de'o //
translated: This refers to wearing robes that are monastic articles.

original: dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, of the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi yo byad kyi gos kyang dkar po nyid dang kha tshang dang phun tshar dang bcas pa 'chang ba la nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi yo byad kyi gos kyang dkar po nyid dang kha tshang dang phun tshar dang bcas pa 'chang ba la nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no fault in wearing white, with fringe and border, even with robes that are monastic articles.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge 'dun gyi gos dag ni sar pa dang kha tshar dang phun tshar ring po dag kyang bcang bar gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge 'dun gyi gos dag ni sar pa dang kha tshar dang phun tshar ring po dag kyang bcang bar gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “Therefore, it is permitted to wear robes of the Saṅgha that are new, with long fringe and border.”

original: gzhan du ma yang rung bar byas te bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yang rung bar byas te bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should wear it after making it into something else.

original: snam sbyar la sogs pa yo byad bcu gsum dang yo byad kyi gos las gzhan pa'i gos du ma yang rung bar byas te bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: snam sbyar la sogs pa yo byad bcu gsum dang yo byad kyi gos las gzhan pa'i gos du ma yang rung bar byas te bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should wear it after making it into something else, such as the thirteen monastic articles like the patched robe, or any other robe that is not a monastic article.

original: 'di'i sngags ni tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol//
analyzed: 'di'i sngags ni tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol//
translated: The mantra for this is: “Venerable one, please listen!

original: @202a * // bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gos lhag pa rung bar ma bgyi bar 'os pa 'di mkhan po la rung par bgyi'o //
analyzed: @202a * // bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gos lhag pa rung bar ma bgyi bar 'os pa 'di mkhan po la rung par bgyi'o //
translated: I, named so-and-so, will make this extra robe, which is suitable for me, suitable for the preceptor.

original: mkhan po la yid brtan te bcang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: mkhan po la yid brtan te bcang bar bgyi'o //
translated: I will keep it in trust with the preceptor.

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bgyi'o //
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bgyi'o //
translated: I will act according to the circumstances.

original: lan gsum dru bzlas /
analyzed: lan gsum dru bzlas /
translated: ” This is repeated three times.

original: thabs yin no //
analyzed: thabs yin no //
translated: “It is a means.

original: legs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: legs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ” “It is good” is what is said.

original: 'dir mkhan po zhes smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'dir mkhan po zhes smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: Here, the mention of “preceptor” is just an example.

original: mkhan po'am slob dpon rnams sam bsnyen par rdzogs pa gzhan yang rung ngo //
analyzed: mkhan po'am slob dpon rnams sam bsnyen par rdzogs pa gzhan yang rung ngo //
translated: It is also suitable for the preceptor, the teacher, or another fully ordained person.

original: sems mi brtan pa la rung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems mi brtan pa la rung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One with an unstable mind should not make it suitable” means

original: smyon pa la sogs pa'i ming gis chos gos dag rung bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: smyon pa la sogs pa'i ming gis chos gos dag rung bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: that one should not make the robes suitable with the names of a madman and so on.

original: smyon pa la sogs pa dag ni tha snyad du bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smyon pa la sogs pa dag ni tha snyad du bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because madmen and so on are not suitable for performing the ritual.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One who is not fully ordained should not do it” means🔽that one should not make the robes suitable with the names of novices and so on.

original: dge tshul la sogs pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i ming gis rung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge tshul la sogs pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i ming gis rung bar mi bya'o //
translated: It is not proper to make robes with the names of novices and so on who have not completed the novitiate.🔽Here is the text:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag dge tshul la gos dag rung bar byed pa na des gos kyi phred ba phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag dge tshul la gos dag rung bar byed pa na des gos kyi phred ba phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When monks were making robes with the names of novices, the novices offered garlands of cloth, and the Blessed One said,

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa la gos dag rung bar mi bya ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽mngon sum du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa la gos dag rung bar mi bya ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // mngon sum du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You should not make robes with the names of those who have completed the novitiate.🔽One should not make them present means

original: gang la rung bar bya ba de'i mngon sum du rung bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la rung bar bya ba de'i mngon sum du rung bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: one should not make them present to one who is making them.

original: yul gzhan du gnas par gyur pa nyid na yang rung ba mi nyams so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul gzhan du gnas par gyur pa nyid na yang rung ba mi nyams so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even if one goes to another country, the suitability does not lapse means

original: gang gi ming gis mi rung bar byas pa de yul gzhan du gnas par gyur kyang rung ba de mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi ming gis mi rung bar byas pa de yul gzhan du gnas par gyur kyang rung ba de mi nyams pa'o //
translated: even if one who has made something unsuitable goes to another country, that unsuitability does not lapse.

original: shin nyams so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin nyams so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one dies, it lapses means

original: gang la rung bar byas pa de shin rung bde nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gang la rung bar byas pa de shin rung bde nyams pa'o //
translated: if one who has made something suitable dies, that suitability lapses.

original: ci gang gi tshe shi ba de'i tshe kho na de nyams sam zhe na de'i phyir shes na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci gang gi tshe shi ba de'i tshe kho na de nyams sam zhe na de'i phyir shes na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one asks, “When does the object become unfit? At the time of death?”🔽The text says, “If one knows,”

original: gal te de shi bar shes na'o //🔽'di la rung bar byed pa bdag po nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de shi bar shes na'o // 'di la rung bar byed pa bdag po nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: meaning that it becomes unfit if one knows that the person has died.🔽The phrase “the owner is the one who makes it fit” means that the owner is the one who makes the object fit for use.

original: rung bar byas pa'i dngos po 'di la rung bar byed pa bdag po yin te de nyid dbang gi gang la rung bar byas pa de mi dbang ngo //🔽spangs pa bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rung bar byas pa'i dngos po 'di la rung bar byed pa bdag po yin te de nyid dbang gi gang la rung bar byas pa de mi dbang ngo // spangs pa bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The owner is the one who makes it fit for use, and the one who makes it fit for use is the one who has control over it.

original: dge 'dun gyis sam gang zag gis gzhan gyi rdzas spangs pa bdag gir mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis sam gang zag gis gzhan gyi rdzas spangs pa bdag gir mi bya ba ste /
translated: “One should not take possession of what has been abandoned” means that one should not take possession of an object that has been abandoned by an individual or the saṅgha.

original: 'di ltar de ni spang ba'i ltung byed phyir bcos pa'i phyir gzhag pa yin gyi sbyin pa'i phyir gzhag pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni spang ba'i ltung byed phyir bcos pa'i phyir gzhag pa yin gyi sbyin pa'i phyir gzhag pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is set aside for the purpose of confessing and purifying the downfall, not for the purpose of giving it away.

original: dge slong la spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong la spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It should be relinquished to a fully ordained monk” means

original: dge 'dun la yang mi spang la bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la yang mi spang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun la yang mi spang la bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la yang mi spang ngo //
translated: that it should not be relinquished to the saṅgha or to a novice.

original: mi gsal ba la yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gsal ba la yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Nor should one abandon one who is not clear,

original: glen pa la sogs pa la yang spang bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: glen pa la sogs pa la yang spang bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: nor should one abandon one who is stupid, etc.

original: tha snyad @202b mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad @202b mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not know the conventional.

original: ma byin na slang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma byin na slang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he does not give back, one should take it back by force.

original: spangs pa'i rdzas gang la spangs pa des phyir ma byin na spong bar byed pas phyir bslang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: spangs pa'i rdzas gang la spangs pa des phyir ma byin na spong bar byed pas phyir bslang bar bya ba'o //
translated: If the one who has abandoned does not give back the abandoned thing to the one who has been abandoned, then the one who has abandoned should take it back by force.

original: mthus kyang dgug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthus kyang dgug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should also summon him by force.

original: ma byin na zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyegs pa'i phyir kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: ma byin na zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyegs pa'i phyir kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word “also” is used because it is a continuation of “if he does not give back.”

original: gos dri dag gis gos pa ba gus te /
analyzed: gos dri dag gis gos pa ba gus te /
translated: If the robe is stained with perfume, one should wash it.

original: bgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should put it on.

original: gos ga bur la sogs pa'i dri dag gis gos pa bkrus te bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: gos ga bur la sogs pa'i dri dag gis gos pa bkrus te bgo bar bya'o //
translated: If the robe is stained with camphor, etc., one should wash it and put it on.

original: phye ma dag gis na sprugs te'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phye ma dag gis na sprugs te'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is stained with powder, one should beat it.

original: gos la sogs pa'i phye ma dag gis gos na sbrugs te bgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gos la sogs pa'i phye ma dag gis gos na sbrugs te bgo bar bya ba'o //
