translated: If the robe, etc., is stained with powder, one should beat it and put it on.

original: snum gyis na rtsub par byas te'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snum gyis na rtsub par byas te'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is stained with oil, one should roughen it.

original: gos snum gyis gos na thal chu la sogs pas snum phyung ste bgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gos snum gyis gos na thal chu la sogs pas snum phyung ste bgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: If the robe is soiled with oil, it should be washed with ashes and so forth and worn again.

original: de dag ni mi sdug pa'i phyir bsal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni mi sdug pa'i phyir bsal ba yin gyi /
translated: These are to be removed because they are ugly,

original: gsog 'jog tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gsog 'jog tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but not because they are hoarded.

original: gsog 'jog ni zas dang 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsog 'jog ni zas dang 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Hoarding is related to food.

original: char 'bab pa'i tshe bla gab med par dge 'dun gyi mi bgo'o zhes bya ba ni gos so //
analyzed: char 'bab pa'i tshe bla gab med par dge 'dun gyi mi bgo'o zhes bya ba ni gos so //
translated: When it rains, one should not wear the saṃghați outside without a covering.

original: bkru ba shal dang tshon dang lhung bzed kyi las dang shing 'cheg ba la sogs pa byed pa'i tshe mi bgo'o zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: bkru ba shal dang tshon dang lhung bzed kyi las dang shing 'cheg ba la sogs pa byed pa'i tshe mi bgo'o zhes bya ba yang /
translated: When washing, dyeing, or working on the saṃghați, or when cutting wood and so forth, one should not wear it.

original: bkru bshal la sogs pa'i las byed pa'i tshe yang dge 'dun gyi gos mi bsgo pa'o //
analyzed: bkru bshal la sogs pa'i las byed pa'i tshe yang dge 'dun gyi gos mi bsgo pa'o //
translated: Even when performing the activities of washing, dyeing, and so forth, one should not wear the saṃghați.

original: lhan cig pa nyid la zhes ma bgo na gcig dang dbral ba'i phyir 'doms pa la byin pa ni yang dag pa nyid kyi grangs yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhan cig pa nyid la zhes ma bgo na gcig dang dbral ba'i phyir 'doms pa la byin pa ni yang dag pa nyid kyi grangs yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not wear it, it is correct to give it to the attendant in order to remove it.

original: rdzas 'doms par byed pa gnyis sam mang po dag gis dge slong la rdzas shig gtams nas de dag gis deng lhan cig tshogs te len du 'ongs na byin cig ces ma bsgo na /🔽rdzas bdag gang yang rung ba cig len du 'ongs pa'i tshe gcig dang 'bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba grogs gzhan tshegs mi 'byung zhing gzhag pa'i phyir 'doms par byed pa gang yang rung ba len du 'ongs pa de la gtams pa'i dge slong gis rdzas de byin
analyzed: rdzas 'doms par byed pa gnyis sam mang po dag gis dge slong la rdzas shig gtams nas de dag gis deng lhan cig tshogs te len du 'ongs na byin cig ces ma bsgo na / rdzas bdag gang yang rung ba cig len du 'ongs pa'i tshe gcig dang 'bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba grogs gzhan tshegs mi 'byung zhing gzhag pa'i phyir 'doms par byed pa gang yang rung ba len du 'ongs pa de la gtams pa'i dge slong gis rdzas de byin
translated: If two or more people deposit goods with a monk, and they do not say, “Give them to us when we come together,”🔽then when any of the depositors comes to take their goods, the monk should give them to that person, because the monk is separated from one of the depositors.

original: na yang dag par byin pa'i grangs su gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: na yang dag par byin pa'i grangs su gtogs pa yin te /
translated: If the monk gives the goods to the depositor who comes to take them, it is considered proper to give them to that person.

original: rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “proper.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig skye bo bzhis gos gtams par gyur pa gcig gis len na bstsal bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig skye bo bzhis gos gtams par gyur pa gcig gis len na bstsal bar bgyi'am /
translated: Here the text says, “Venerable, if one of the four people who deposited goods comes to take them, should they be given or not?”

original: nye ba 'khor sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, they should be given.”

original: 'doms par byed pa dang bcas pa la mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'doms par byed pa dang bcas pa la mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not give to one who is accompanied by a thief.

original: 'doms par byed pa ma yin pa dang bcas te lhan cig tu len du 'ongs na bskur bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'doms par byed pa ma yin pa dang bcas te lhan cig tu len du 'ongs na bskur bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not give to one who is accompanied by one who is not a thief, if he comes to take it together.

original: dngos po de @203a * //
analyzed: dngos po de @203a * //
translated: Because that property

original: bdag po ma yin pa gzhan la yang sbyin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po ma yin pa gzhan la yang sbyin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: would be given to another who is not the owner.

original: smyon pas nye du ma yin pa dang de'i khyim nas blangs pa la blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smyon pas nye du ma yin pa dang de'i khyim nas blangs pa la blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not accept from a mad man, or from his house, if he is not a relative.

original: smyon pa las rdzas blang bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: smyon pa las rdzas blang bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not accept property from a mad man.

original: smyon pas rang gi nye du ma yin pa'i khyim nas blangs pa dang / smyon pa rang gi khyim nas blangs pa las rdzas dge slong gis blang bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: smyon pas rang gi nye du ma yin pa'i khyim nas blangs pa dang / smyon pa rang gi khyim nas blangs pa las rdzas dge slong gis blang bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: A monk should not accept property from a mad man, if he is not a relative, or if he is a relative, but he takes it from his house.

original: de ni smyon pa ni tha snyad byar mi rung ba yin pas brkus so zhes kha zer ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni smyon pa ni tha snyad byar mi rung ba yin pas brkus so zhes kha zer ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, since a mad man is not fit to communicate, it is said that he is a thief.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gang la pha'am ma'am phu nu'am bu srid mngon pa'i rang gi khyim nas spyin par byed pa de las ni blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gang la pha'am ma'am phu nu'am bu srid mngon pa'i rang gi khyim nas spyin par byed pa de las ni blang bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the text says, “One should take from one’s own house, from a father, mother, brother, sister, or son, who gives.

original: gang las blang bar mi bgyi ;
analyzed: gang las blang bar mi bgyi ;
translated: From whom should one not take?

original: gang na pha ma la sogs pa mi mngon pa nas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang na pha ma la sogs pa mi mngon pa nas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: From one who is not a father, mother, and so on.”

original: bu bskrad pa las blang bar bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bu bskrad pa las blang bar bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should take from one who has been expelled by his son.”

original: phas bu re zhig bskrad pa'i lag nas rdzas blang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: phas bu re zhig bskrad pa'i lag nas rdzas blang bar bya ba ste /
translated: One should take property from the hand of a father who has been expelled by his son for a time,

original: bu de pha'i khyim gyi bdag po las de mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu de pha'i khyim gyi bdag po las de mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that son is not the master of his father’s house.

original: dur khrod nas phyir bzlog pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dur khrod nas phyir bzlog pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Also from one who has been turned back from the charnel ground.”

original: dur khrod du ro bskyal nas de nas ro'i gos phyir bzlog pa dge slong la dbul na blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dur khrod du ro bskyal nas de nas ro'i gos phyir bzlog pa dge slong la dbul na blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: If one who has carried a corpse to the charnel ground turns back from there and offers the shroud to a monk, he should take it.

original: phyir 'gugs na sbyin par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyir 'gugs na sbyin par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one is sent to fetch it, one should give.”

original: dur khrod nas phyir bzlog pa'i gos dge slong la phul ba de dge slong las phyir 'gugs na phyir sbyin par bya ba ste /🔽ngan pa nor du mi che ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dur khrod nas phyir bzlog pa'i gos dge slong la phul ba de dge slong las phyir 'gugs na phyir sbyin par bya ba ste / ngan pa nor du mi che ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: If a monk returns a robe given to him by a nun, it should be returned to the nun.

original: / yang rnyed na blang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / yang rnyed na blang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is obtained again, it should be accepted.🔽If a monk returns a robe given to him by a nun, it should be returned to the nun.

original: dur khrod nas phyir bzlog pa dge slong la phul pa dge slong las phyir 'gugs pa de yang dge slong la 'bul na dge slong gis blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dur khrod nas phyir bzlog pa dge slong la phul pa dge slong las phyir 'gugs pa de yang dge slong la 'bul na dge slong gis blang bar bya ste /
translated: If it is offered to a monk, it should be accepted by a monk,

original: des ni des khro ba mi bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni des khro ba mi bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not proper for a monk to show anger toward a nun.

original: mchod rten gyi dkor dang 'byung khungs dang rtsa ba dang 'bras bu dang bur ma shing las gzhan pa'i zas kyi don dang / bsko bas nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba dang / na ba'i rung ba ni bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi dkor dang 'byung khungs dang rtsa ba dang 'bras bu dang bur ma shing las gzhan pa'i zas kyi don dang / bsko bas nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba dang / na ba'i rung ba ni bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The property of a stupa, the property of a spring, the property of a root, the property of a fruit, the property of a sugarcane field, the property of a vineyard, the property of a flower garden, the property of a vegetable garden, the property of a forest, the property of a tree, the property of a bird, the property of a bird’s nest, the property of a road, the property of a river, the property of a canal, the property of a bridge, the property of a ferry, the property of a boat, the property of a water-crossing, the property of a monastery, the property of a temple, the property of a dwelling, the property of a cell, the property of a cave, the property of a bed, the property of a seat, the property of a bed and seat, the property of a begging-bowl, the property of a robe, the property of a needle case, the property of a razor, the property of a mirror, the property of a knife, the property of a water-pot, the property of a staff, the property of a medicine-pouch, the property of a bathing-cloth, the property of a bathing-robe, the property of a bathing-place, the property of a bathing-house, the property of a bathing-pond, the property of a bathing-pool, the property of a bathing-tank, the property of a bathing-river, the property of a bathing-stream, the property of a bathing-waterfall, the property of a bathing-waterfall-pool, the property of a bathing-waterfall-river, the property of a bathing-waterfall-stream, the property of a bathing-waterfall-pool, the property of a bathing-waterfall-pool-river, the property of a bathing-waterfall-pool-stream, the property of a bathing-waterfall-pool-river-stream, the property of a bathing-waterfall-pool-river-stream-pool, the property of a bathing-waterfall-pool-

original: rnam pa de lda ni bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lda ni bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “should not be distributed” is applied to the phrase “for the sake of one’s own use.”

original: mchod rten gyi dkor zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi dkor zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “property of a stūpa” means

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyi dkor la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyi dkor la bya ste /
translated: the property of a stūpa of the Tathāgata.

original: de ni gang zag gis bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni gang zag gis bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: It should not be distributed for the sake of one’s own use.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten gyi dkor ni 'dir ma gtogs te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten gyi dkor ni 'dir ma gtogs te /
translated: The property of a stūpa of a śrāvaka or a pratyekabuddha is not included here,

original: de ni dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pas dge slong gis nor nyid du bgo bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de ni dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pas dge slong gis nor nyid du bgo bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because it is included in the property of the Saṅgha and therefore should be distributed by the monks as wealth.

original: @203b de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyis ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog nyid dge 'dun las tha dad pa yin pas de ni bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: @203b de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyis ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog nyid dge 'dun las tha dad pa yin pas de ni bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The property of a stūpa of the Tathāgata is not to be distributed because the Buddha Jewel is not separate from the Saṅgha Jewel.

original: 'byung khungs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'byung khungs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “a source of wealth” means

original: dge 'dun gyi 'du ba'i sgo ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi 'du ba'i sgo ste /
translated: a source of income for the Saṅgha.

original: 'di lta ste zhing dang lo thog dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa dang / 'du ba'i sgo mi zad pa nyid du nges par byas pa gzhan dag dang / ba lang dang / ma he la sogs pa dang / lha 'bangs dang rtse rgod la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhing dang lo thog dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa dang / 'du ba'i sgo mi zad pa nyid du nges par byas pa gzhan dag dang / ba lang dang / ma he la sogs pa dang / lha 'bangs dang rtse rgod la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: and other things that are determined to be inexhaustible sources of revenue, such as cattle, buffaloes, etc., and divine servants, such as the gandharvas, etc.

original: de dag kyang bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: These are not to be distributed in order to make them one’s own.

original: rtsa ba dang 'bras bu dang bu ram shing las gzhan pa'i zas kyi don du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang 'bras bu dang bu ram shing las gzhan pa'i zas kyi don du zhes bya ba la /
translated: “For the purpose of food other than roots, fruits, and sugarcane” means

original: rtsa ba la phug la sogs pa dang ; 'bras bu shing thog la sogs pa dang / bu ram shing dag gi pa gos kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rtsa ba la phug la sogs pa dang ; 'bras bu shing thog la sogs pa dang / bu ram shing dag gi pa gos kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: that there is no offense if it is roots other than onions, fruits other than grapes, and sugarcane other than sugarcane.

original: de dag las gzhan pa zas kyi don du sbyar ba gro nas la sogs pa gtsang bag dang / k'ar sh'a pa na la sogs pa dkor mdzod dang / mar la sogs pa she dang / sga tsha la sogs pa spod dag dang / de dag la sogs pa'i dngos po kha'i 'du ba'i sgo dag ni zas kyi don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa zas kyi don du sbyar ba gro nas la sogs pa gtsang bag dang / k'ar sh'a pa na la sogs pa dkor mdzod dang / mar la sogs pa she dang / sga tsha la sogs pa spod dag dang / de dag la sogs pa'i dngos po kha'i 'du ba'i sgo dag ni zas kyi don zhes bya'o //
translated: Other than those, the things that are applied for the sake of food, such as wheat, barley, etc., are the clean things; the things in the treasury, such as kārṣāpaṇa coins, etc., are the wealth; the things such as butter, etc., are the food; the things such as salt, etc., are the condiments.🔽Those things, etc., are called the things for the sake of food.

original: de ltar yang gtsug lag las kha'i 'du ba'i sgo 'phrog na zhes bya ba'i tshig yod de khar bza' ba'i don gyi rdzas rnams ni kha'i 'du ba'i sgo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang gtsug lag las kha'i 'du ba'i sgo 'phrog na zhes bya ba'i tshig yod de khar bza' ba'i don gyi rdzas rnams ni kha'i 'du ba'i sgo zhes bya ste /
translated: In the scriptures, there is the expression “to steal the door of the mouth.” The substances that are eaten by the mouth are called the door of the mouth.

original: de dag kyang bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Those are not to be distributed for the sake of personal property.

original: gal te gtsug lag khang na kha'i 'du ba'i sgo de dag dge 'dun gyis spyad pa las lhag pa'i mtheb yod na ni 'bru la sogs pa btsongs te gos kyi rin dag bgos pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te gtsug lag khang na kha'i 'du ba'i sgo de dag dge 'dun gyis spyad pa las lhag pa'i mtheb yod na ni 'bru la sogs pa btsongs te gos kyi rin dag bgos pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If in the monastery there is a surplus of those things for the mouth that are used by the Saṅgha, then there is no fault in selling the grain, etc., and distributing the price of the cloth.

original: rtag res 'khor dang nad gsos nyid du 'bras la sogs pa brim pa la yang nyes pa med pa kho na'o //🔽bsko bas nye bar 'tsho par bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtag res 'khor dang nad gsos nyid du 'bras la sogs pa brim pa la yang nyes pa med pa kho na'o // bsko bas nye bar 'tsho par bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no fault in distributing rice, etc. to those who are permanent or occasional visitors or to those who are sick.🔽“That which is to be used by appointment” means

original: bsko bas nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsko bas nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: that which is to be used by appointment.

original: gnas mal gtsug lag khang dang gnas khang dang khang khyim dang sa gzhi la sogs pa dang mal cha dang stan dang bgo ba dang gding g-yogs la sogs pa dang / snod spyad la sogs pa dge 'dun gyi spyi bungs gang zag la bsko zhing spyang bar bya ba dag ste /
analyzed: gnas mal gtsug lag khang dang gnas khang dang khang khyim dang sa gzhi la sogs pa dang mal cha dang stan dang bgo ba dang gding g-yogs la sogs pa dang / snod spyad la sogs pa dge 'dun gyi spyi bungs gang zag la bsko zhing spyang bar bya ba dag ste /
translated: That which is to be used by appointment is the general property of the Saṅgha, such as beds, temples, houses, rooms, land, etc., bedding, seats, clothing, coverings, etc., and vessels, etc.

original: de dag kyang bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: That should not be distributed for personal use.

original: na ba'i rung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: na ba'i rung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “That which is suitable for the sick” means

original: sman du gyur pa'i sman gang du gtogs pa'i aa ru ra la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: sman du gyur pa'i sman gang du gtogs pa'i aa ru ra la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: that which is included in the category of medicine, such as myrobalan, etc.

original: de dag kyang bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: That also should not be distributed for personal use.

original: de dag las lhag @204a * //
analyzed: de dag las lhag @204a * //
translated: If the thumb is extended, it is changed.

original: pa'i mtheb yod na ni bsgyur zhing dge 'dun mchod ston gsol ba la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: pa'i mtheb yod na ni bsgyur zhing dge 'dun mchod ston gsol ba la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one makes offerings to the Saṅgha.

original: bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should not be distributed for personal use.

original: mchod rten gyi dkor la sogs pa lnga po de dag gang zag sgo sgor bkur pa'i phyir bgo ba bkag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi dkor la sogs pa lnga po de dag gang zag sgo sgor bkur pa'i phyir bgo ba bkag pa yin gyi /
translated: The distribution of the five types of property of the saṅgha, such as property of the stūpa, is prohibited for the sake of individual monks.

original: zhal ta dang byi dor dang bsrung bskyab bya ba'i phyir las bgos te /
analyzed: zhal ta dang byi dor dang bsrung bskyab bya ba'i phyir las bgos te /
translated: However, it is not prohibited to distribute work for the sake of service, cleaning, and protection.

original: chang khyur len pa bkag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu lnga pa /
analyzed: chang khyur len pa bkag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / // / bam po lnga bcu lnga pa /
translated: This means that it is not prohibited to drink beer.

original: rnyed pa la ni dbyar gyi mtshams 'jug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnyed pa la ni dbyar gyi mtshams 'jug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The boundary is entered for the sake of gain.

original: rnyed pa 'di dge 'dun gyi'o zhes dge 'dun tsam gyi phyir dbul ba'i rnyed pa gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: rnyed pa 'di dge 'dun gyi'o zhes dge 'dun tsam gyi phyir dbul ba'i rnyed pa gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: The boundary is entered for the sake of gain that is offered to the saṅgha, thinking, “This gain is for the saṅgha.”

original: dbyar gyi dus su gyur pa'i mtshams 'jug pa ste de dbang ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: dbyar gyi dus su gyur pa'i mtshams 'jug pa ste de dbang ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is not entered for the sake of the rainy season.

original: rnyed pa'i dus su byung ba'i mtshams ni mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i dus su byung ba'i mtshams ni mi dbang ngo //
translated: The boundary of the time of acquisition is the boundary of the monks who are present.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽dbyar gyi dus su mtshams rnam par gzhag par gyur pa gang yin pa de bkrol nas mtshams der dge slong gang dag rnam par gzhag pa de dag la sbyin bdag des dge 'dun tsam la bsngo bas 'bul ba'i rnyed pa byung ba gang yin pa de ni dbyar
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / dbyar gyi dus su mtshams rnam par gzhag par gyur pa gang yin pa de bkrol nas mtshams der dge slong gang dag rnam par gzhag pa de dag la sbyin bdag des dge 'dun tsam la bsngo bas 'bul ba'i rnyed pa byung ba gang yin pa de ni dbyar
translated: This is explained as follows.🔽When the boundary is established in the summer, if the boundary is released and the offerings are made to the Saṅgha alone by the donor, the acquisition that arises is for those monks who are established in that boundary.

original: gyi mtshams su gtogs pa'i dge slong rnams nyi tshe dbang gi /
analyzed: gyi mtshams su gtogs pa'i dge slong rnams nyi tshe dbang gi /
translated: That is the acquisition belonging to the monks who are in the boundary of the summer.

original: de'i tshe'i mtshams rnam par gzhag pa'i dge slong rnams ni mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe'i mtshams rnam par gzhag pa'i dge slong rnams ni mi dbang ngo //
translated: The monks who are present at the time of establishing the boundary are not the owners.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gtan pa'i gzhi'i zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gtan pa'i gzhi'i zhu ba las /
translated: Here is the text from the Questions on the Basis of the Vinaya:

original: dge slong dag dbyar gnas par khas blangs nas spyod yul gyi grong gi nyen kor du mtshams bgyid cing de dag gis dgag dbye bgyis nas phyi rol gyi mtshams bgyis te /
analyzed: dge slong dag dbyar gnas par khas blangs nas spyod yul gyi grong gi nyen kor du mtshams bgyid cing de dag gis dgag dbye bgyis nas phyi rol gyi mtshams bgyis te /
translated: Monks, having accepted to stay in the rainy season, they make a boundary near the village of the area. Having done the invitation ceremony, they make an outer boundary.

original: der yang mis dge 'dun gzhan btsud nas dge 'dun la chos gos dag 'bul na gang gis thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: der yang mis dge 'dun gzhan btsud nas dge 'dun la chos gos dag 'bul na gang gis thob par 'gyur /
translated: If other monks are brought in and robes are offered to the Saṅgha, who receives them?

original: gang dag der dbyar gnas pa dag gis so //
analyzed: gang dag der dbyar gnas pa dag gis so //
translated: Those who stay there during the rains.

original: ci'i phyir zhen rnyed pa de gnas kyis bstabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen rnyed pa de gnas kyis bstabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Why? Because the acquisition is offered to the place.

original: 'o na dge slong gzhan de dag gnas der sbyin bdag gis btsang la /
analyzed: 'o na dge slong gzhan de dag gnas der sbyin bdag gis btsang la /
translated: But if other monks are brought in by the donor to that place,

original: rnyed pa yang sbyin bdag gi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin na ci'i phyir de dag mi dbang zhe na /
analyzed: rnyed pa yang sbyin bdag gi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin na ci'i phyir de dag mi dbang zhe na /
translated: and the acquisition is established by the power of the donor, why are they not entitled to it?

original: smras pa / sbyin bdag gis 'di snyam du kho bos dge 'dun tsam gyi phyir dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / sbyin bdag gis 'di snyam du kho bos dge 'dun tsam gyi phyir dbul bar bya ste /
translated: It is said: The donor thinks, “I offer this for the Saṅgha alone.

original: 'di dag rang gis dbang ba nyid du rnam par 'jog cing lan grang snyam pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di dag rang gis dbang ba nyid du rnam par 'jog cing lan grang snyam pa'i phyir te /
translated: I do not establish these as their own property and I will not receive anything in return.”

original: des ni sbyin bdag gis dge slong gzhan dag der btsud du zin kyang de dag mi dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: des ni sbyin bdag gis dge slong gzhan dag der btsud du zin kyang de dag mi dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the donor brings in other monks, they are not entitled to it.

original: gal te sbyin bdag gis dge slong @204b 'di dag dang gzhan dag la yang dbul lo zhes yongs su chad par byed na ni de'i tsho gzhan dag kyang dbang bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: gal te sbyin bdag gis dge slong @204b 'di dag dang gzhan dag la yang dbul lo zhes yongs su chad par byed na ni de'i tsho gzhan dag kyang dbang bar the tshom med do //
translated: If the donor were to say, “I will give to these monks and others as well,” then there is no doubt that others would also receive it.

original: rnyed pa de gnas kyis bstabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rnyed pa de gnas kyis bstabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: Because that gain is offered by the place.

original: 'dir gnas zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi gnas la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gnas zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi gnas la bya ste /
translated: Here, “place” refers to the rainy season residence.

original: dbyar gyi gnas des bsgrubs pa'i rnyed pa ni gnas kyis bstabs pa'i rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gnas des bsgrubs pa'i rnyed pa ni gnas kyis bstabs pa'i rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Gain that is accomplished by that rainy season residence is called “gain offered by the place.”

original: dbyar ral ba ni mi dbang ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbyar ral ba ni mi dbang ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One who has violated the rainy season retreat is not one who does not receive.

original: yun ring du gnas gnas pa nyid yin na dbyar dal yang dge slong de gnas kyis bstabs pa'i rnyed pa mi dbang ba nyid ma yin te dbang ba kho na'o //
analyzed: yun ring du gnas gnas pa nyid yin na dbyar dal yang dge slong de gnas kyis bstabs pa'i rnyed pa mi dbang ba nyid ma yin te dbang ba kho na'o //
translated: If one stays for a long time, even though one has violated the rainy season retreat, that monk is not one who does not receive gain offered by the place. He is one who receives it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gang las sbyin par bya zhen /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gang las sbyin par bya zhen /
translated: Here, the text asks, “From where is it to be given?”

original: dbyar snga ma'am phyi ma gang yod pa las te /
analyzed: dbyar snga ma'am phyi ma gang yod pa las te /
translated: It is given from the earlier or later rainy season retreat.

original: yun ring du gnas gnas pa las so zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽gnas nas phyung ba nyid na ni mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yun ring du gnas gnas pa las so zhes gsungs pa yin no // gnas nas phyung ba nyid na ni mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said that they are obtained from staying for a long time.🔽If one is expelled, one does not obtain the rainy season retreat.

original: gnas nas phyung ba nyid du gyur ba na dbyar gnas pa'i rnyed pa de mi dbang ba ste /
analyzed: gnas nas phyung ba nyid du gyur ba na dbyar gnas pa'i rnyed pa de mi dbang ba ste /
translated: If one is expelled, one does not obtain the rainy season retreat.

original: de ni dge 'dun las gnas dang longs spyod phyi rol du gyur bar byas pa'i phyir ro //🔽rdzas kyis mnan par gnas par khas blangs pa ni skal ba gcig kho na'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽mtshams du ma khri la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig gis mnan par dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa ni mtshams du ma mnan pa de dag nas rnyed pa'i cha bsdus te /
analyzed: de ni dge 'dun las gnas dang longs spyod phyi rol du gyur bar byas pa'i phyir ro // rdzas kyis mnan par gnas par khas blangs pa ni skal ba gcig kho na'o zhes bya ba ni / mtshams du ma khri la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig gis mnan par dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa ni mtshams du ma mnan pa de dag nas rnyed pa'i cha bsdus te /
translated: Because one is expelled from the saṅgha and from the enjoyment of the rainy season retreat.🔽If one pledges to stay in a place covered by a substance, one obtains a share of the rainy season retreat.🔽If one pledges to stay in the rainy season in a place covered by a single substance such as a mat, one obtains a share of the rainy season retreat.

original: spyir mi gcig gis skal ba gcig dbang ba kho na sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: spyir mi gcig gis skal ba gcig dbang ba kho na sbyin pa'o //
translated: One obtains a share of the rainy season retreat in all the boundaries that are covered by that substance.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: mtshams ji snyed mnan pa de snyed kyi rnyed pa mi dbang gi /
analyzed: mtshams ji snyed mnan pa de snyed kyi rnyed pa mi dbang gi /
translated: One does not obtain the rainy season retreat in all the boundaries that are covered by that substance.

original: mtshams du ma mnan pa de dag nas cha bsdus te /
analyzed: mtshams du ma mnan pa de dag nas cha bsdus te /
translated: and the parts of the other sections that are not suppressed are added together.

original: skal ba gcig kho na dbang ngo //
analyzed: skal ba gcig kho na dbang ngo //
translated: Only one part is given to each.🔽The phrase “only one part” indicates that only one part is given to each.

original: skal pa gcig kho na'o zhes smos pa des gang nas skal ba gcig kho na de la sbyin par bya zhe na de'i phyir de la mnan pa rnams su bdag nyid bgrang ba'i cha nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skal pa gcig kho na'o zhes smos pa des gang nas skal ba gcig kho na de la sbyin par bya zhe na de'i phyir de la mnan pa rnams su bdag nyid bgrang ba'i cha nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one asks, “From which part is it given?” then the response is: “It is the part of the individual that is suppressed in the sections.”

original: mtshams du ma khri la sogs pas mnan te gnas par khas blangs pa'i gang zag de la mtshams ji snyed mnan pa rnams su bdag nyid gtogs par bgrang ba'i mtshams de dag thams cad nas cha re re nyid dbang ste /
analyzed: mtshams du ma khri la sogs pas mnan te gnas par khas blangs pa'i gang zag de la mtshams ji snyed mnan pa rnams su bdag nyid gtogs par bgrang ba'i mtshams de dag thams cad nas cha re re nyid dbang ste /
translated: For the person who accepts that the sections are suppressed by the thousands and so forth, in all the sections that are suppressed by the individual, each part is given to each.

original: de dag gi cha spyir bsdoms pa las mi gcig gi skal ba gcig kho na sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi cha spyir bsdoms pa las mi gcig gi skal ba gcig kho na sbyin pa'o //
translated: The parts of all of them are added together and only one part is given to each individual.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: mtshams gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi la sogs pa ji snyed mnan pa'i mtshams de dag nas phyed dam sum cha'am bzhi cha la sogs pa'i cha re re dbang ste /
analyzed: mtshams gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi la sogs pa ji snyed mnan pa'i mtshams de dag nas phyed dam sum cha'am bzhi cha la sogs pa'i cha re re dbang ste /
translated: The portion of the share is the half, one third, or one fourth of the share of the monk who has died, and so on, from the two, three, or four monks who have died.

original: de dag spyir bsdus pa las @205a * //
analyzed: de dag spyir bsdus pa las @205a * //
translated: The share is the total of the portions.

original: skal ba rangs pa gcig kho na sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: skal ba rangs pa gcig kho na sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The share of the deceased is given to one who has the same status as the deceased.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gtsug lag khang gcig gi rnyed ba'i thar gang yin pa de des gnas ji snyed mnan pa de snyed nas cha bsdus te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gtsug lag khang gcig gi rnyed ba'i thar gang yin pa de des gnas ji snyed mnan pa de snyed nas cha bsdus te /
translated: The text says: The share of the deceased is the total of the portions from the number of residences that the deceased monk occupied.

original: de las skal pa gcig sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las skal pa gcig sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: From that, the share of the deceased is given to one who has the same status as the deceased.

original: gzhan pa gcig tu gnas par khas blangs pa la ni yun ring ba nyid kyis rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan pa gcig tu gnas par khas blangs pa la ni yun ring ba nyid kyis rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The length of time is determined by the length of time that the deceased monk occupied the residence.

original: mtshams du ma khri la sogs pas mnan te gnas par khas blangs pa sngar bstan pa de las gzhan pa gcig tu gnas par khas blangs pa zhes bya ba dbyar gnas par khas len pa'i dus de nyid kyi tshe dang bor gnas gcig tu gnas par khas blangs
analyzed: mtshams du ma khri la sogs pas mnan te gnas par khas blangs pa sngar bstan pa de las gzhan pa gcig tu gnas par khas blangs pa zhes bya ba dbyar gnas par khas len pa'i dus de nyid kyi tshe dang bor gnas gcig tu gnas par khas blangs
translated: One who promises to stay in one place is one who promises to stay in one place after first promising to stay in another place.

original: nas de ma thag tu yang gnas gzhan gcig tu gnas par khas blangs shing /🔽de'i 'og tu yang gnas gzhan gcig tu gnas par khas blangs te /
analyzed: nas de ma thag tu yang gnas gzhan gcig tu gnas par khas blangs shing / de'i 'og tu yang gnas gzhan gcig tu gnas par khas blangs te /
translated: One who promises to stay in one place is one who promises to stay in one place after promising to stay in another place.

original: de nas yang gnas gzhan gcig tu gnas par khas blangs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang gnas gzhan gcig tu gnas par khas blangs pa ste /
translated: One who promises to stay in one place is one who promises to stay in one place after promising to stay in another place.

original: de ltar gnas tha dad pa du mang gnas par khas blangs pa la ni /🔽gnas de dag gang du dbyar yun ring du gnas gnas pa nyid kyis de'i rnyed pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ltar gnas tha dad pa du mang gnas par khas blangs pa la ni / gnas de dag gang du dbyar yun ring du gnas gnas pa nyid kyis de'i rnyed pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: One who promises to stay in many different places is one who promises to stay in many different places.🔽The benefits of the rainy season retreat are determined by the length of time one stays in a particular place.

original: gang du yun ring du gnas gnas pa'i gnas de gcig bu nas de'i rnyed pa'i skal pa rangs pa gcig sbyin par bya'i /
analyzed: gang du yun ring du gnas gnas pa'i gnas de gcig bu nas de'i rnyed pa'i skal pa rangs pa gcig sbyin par bya'i /
translated: One who stays for a long time in a particular place receives the full benefits of the rainy season retreat.

original: gnas de dag thams cad nas skal ba re re yang mi sbyin la /
analyzed: gnas de dag thams cad nas skal ba re re yang mi sbyin la /
translated: One should not accept any portion from all of those places.

original: de dag nas cha bsdu par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nas cha bsdu par yang mi bya'o //
translated: One should not collect portions from those places.

original: 'dir gzhung ni tshe dang ldan pa nye dags rnyed pa 'dod pas gtsug lag khang gnyis su tshul shing dang gnas mal blangs te gnas par khas blangs pa na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni tshe dang ldan pa nye dags rnyed pa 'dod pas gtsug lag khang gnyis su tshul shing dang gnas mal blangs te gnas par khas blangs pa na /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: The venerable Upāli, desiring gain, accepted a voting ticket and a bed in two monasteries.

original: des gtsug lag khang gcig nas chos gos kyi rin thob la cig shos nas ma thob nas de nas kyang rnyed pa bsgrub pa na /
analyzed: des gtsug lag khang gcig nas chos gos kyi rin thob la cig shos nas ma thob nas de nas kyang rnyed pa bsgrub pa na /
translated: When he obtained the price of a robe from one monastery but not from the other, he again sought gain.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: gang du gso sbyong lan mang du byas pa de nas rnyed ba blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du gso sbyong lan mang du byas pa de nas rnyed ba blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “One should accept gain from the place where one performs the poṣadha many times.”🔽Novices and female novices should subtract one third of their gain.

original: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag ni rnyed pa la sum cha dbri ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni de gnyis ni gos kyi rin rnyed pa la sum cha dbri zhing sum gnyis dbang ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag ni rnyed pa la sum cha dbri ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni de gnyis ni gos kyi rin rnyed pa la sum cha dbri zhing sum gnyis dbang ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: They should subtract one third of the price of robes they obtain and keep two thirds.

original: dbyar gnas pa la sogs pa dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa la sum cha dbri'o //
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa la sogs pa dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa la sum cha dbri'o //
translated: One should subtract one third of the gain of robes of the Saṅgha, such as the rainy season practice.

original: yon bdag gis mngon sum du spyir phul ba'i rnyed pa la ni mi dbri'o //
analyzed: yon bdag gis mngon sum du spyir phul ba'i rnyed pa la ni mi dbri'o //
translated: One should not subtract the gain that is offered in general by a patron in the presence of the Saṅgha.

original: zas la ni mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zas la ni mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for food, it is equal.

original: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag zas kyi rnyed pa la ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang mnyam par dbang ba yin no //
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag zas kyi rnyed pa la ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang mnyam par dbang ba yin no //
translated: As for the gain of food, novices and female novices are equal to those fully ordained.

original: gos la @205b sogs pa la ni mi mnyam mo //
analyzed: gos la @205b sogs pa la ni mi mnyam mo //
translated: As for robes, etc., it is not equal.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa la 'dod pa dang dge slong ma dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa la 'dod pa dang dge slong ma dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who desire full ordination and the fully ordained monks and nuns.

original: de gnyis kyang bsnyen par rdzogs pa dag dang rnyed pa mnyam pa nyid yin pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang bsnyen par rdzogs pa dag dang rnyed pa mnyam pa nyid yin pa ste /
translated: Those two are equal to those fully ordained in the gain.

original: 'dir ni zas kyi rnyed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rnyed pa thams cad mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zas kyi rnyed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rnyed pa thams cad mnyam pa'o //
translated: Here, it is not only the gain of food, but all gain is equal.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who desire full ordination.

original: dge tshul dang dge slob ma la bya ste /
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge slob ma la bya ste /
translated: This refers to novices and female novices.

original: dge tshul ma la ni dge slob mar ma byas kyi bar du bsnyen par rdzogs par byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge tshul ma la ni dge slob mar ma byas kyi bar du bsnyen par rdzogs par byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unsuitable to fully ordain a novice nun until she has become a probationary nun.

original: 'dir dge slob ma yang dngos su smos pas dge tshul nyi tshe bzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir dge slob ma yang dngos su smos pas dge tshul nyi tshe bzung ste /
translated: Since probationary nuns are directly mentioned here, novice monks are implicitly included.

original: dge tshul lo yang tshang la bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang 'dod pa rnams la bya'i ;
analyzed: dge tshul lo yang tshang la bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang 'dod pa rnams la bya'i ;
translated: If a novice monk is fully ordained when he is twenty, he should be given full ordination.

original: lo mtshang pa dang lo tshang yang bsnyen par rdzogs par mi 'dod pa rnams ni sum cha dbri ba sngar bstan pa nyid kyi khongs su gtogs so //
analyzed: lo mtshang pa dang lo tshang yang bsnyen par rdzogs par mi 'dod pa rnams ni sum cha dbri ba sngar bstan pa nyid kyi khongs su gtogs so //
translated: If he is less than twenty or if he is twenty but not suitable for full ordination, he should be included in the previously mentioned group of those whose vows are reduced by one third.

original: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las /
translated: The texts state:

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma dag ni skal pa mnyam par sbyin no //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma dag ni skal pa mnyam par sbyin no //
translated: Monks and nuns are given equal shares.

original: dge tshul dang dge tshul mdag la ni sum gnyis sbyin no //
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge tshul mdag la ni sum gnyis sbyin no //
translated: Novice monks and nuns are given two thirds.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang dge slob ma dag kyang mnyam par sbyin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang dge slob ma dag kyang mnyam par sbyin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those who wish to be fully ordained and probationary nuns are given equal shares.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams kyi skal ba bgo ba ni gang zag las yin gyi dge 'dun las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams kyi skal ba bgo ba ni gang zag las yin gyi dge 'dun las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The distribution of shares for monks and nuns is from the individual, not from the Sangha.

original: 'di las 'di snyed ni dge slong gi dge 'dun la dbul lo //
analyzed: 'di las 'di snyed ni dge slong gi dge 'dun la dbul lo //
translated: This much is given to the Sangha of monks.🔽This much is given to the Sangha of nuns.

original: 'di snyed ni dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la dbul lo zhes de ltar bye brag tu ma byas pa'i rnyed pa ni dge slong gi dge 'dun la dang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gnyis gang zag gi grangs las bgo bar bya'i //
analyzed: 'di snyed ni dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la dbul lo zhes de ltar bye brag tu ma byas pa'i rnyed pa ni dge slong gi dge 'dun la dang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gnyis gang zag gi grangs las bgo bar bya'i //
translated: Thus, if the gift is not specified, the gift is distributed according to the number of individuals in the Sangha of monks and the Sangha of nuns.

original: dge 'dun gyi grangs las phyed phyed du mi bgo ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi grangs las phyed phyed du mi bgo ba'o //
translated: It is not distributed in half to the Sangha of monks and half to the Sangha of nuns.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma'i rang bzhin gyi gang zag ji snyed de la skal ba dang ba de snyed la mnyam par bya'i /
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma'i rang bzhin gyi gang zag ji snyed de la skal ba dang ba de snyed la mnyam par bya'i /
translated: The gift is distributed equally to all the individuals who are monks and nuns.

original: phyed dge slong gi dge 'dun la sbyin zhing phyed dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la sbyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyed dge slong gi dge 'dun la sbyin zhing phyed dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la sbyin pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that half is given to the Sangha of monks and half is given to the Sangha of nuns.

original: 'dir gzhung ni mgo'i shas kyis bgo bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni mgo'i shas kyis bgo bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text is to be analyzed according to the portion of the head.

original: zas kyi mjug thog kyi rnyed pa bye brag tu ma bcad pa de las dge slong ma zos pa nyid dag kyang mi 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zas kyi mjug thog kyi rnyed pa bye brag tu ma bcad pa de las dge slong ma zos pa nyid dag kyang mi 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The food-residue offering is not restricted, so even nuns who have not eaten may partake.

original: zas kyi mjug thogs kyi rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zas kyi mjug thogs kyi rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The food-residue offering is

original: zas sngar zar bcug nas de'i 'og tu zas kyi rjes la dbul ba'i rnyed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zas sngar zar bcug nas de'i 'og tu zas kyi rjes la dbul ba'i rnyed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: what is offered after the meal, after the meal has been served.

original: bye brag tu ma bcad pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽'di dge slong rnams kho na la dbul lo zhes @206a * //
analyzed: bye brag tu ma bcad pa zhes bya ba ni / 'di dge slong rnams kho na la dbul lo zhes @206a * //
translated: Not restricted means🔽the donor has not restricted it to only monks,

original: sbyin bdag gis bye brag tu ma bcad pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis bye brag tu ma bcad pa'o //
translated: saying, “This is for monks only.”

original: de lta bu'i rnyed pa de la ni der zan zos pa'i dge slong ma rnams kyang mi dbang ba ma yin te dbang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnyed pa de la ni der zan zos pa'i dge slong ma rnams kyang mi dbang ba ma yin te dbang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In such a case, nuns who have eaten there may partake, so it is said they are allowed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong drug cu ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na ri brags gzhan zhig tu phyin nas de na khyim bdag dad pa can zhig 'dug pa des de dag khyim gzhan du zan la mgron du bos nas dge slong re re la ras yug chen bskon
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong drug cu ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na ri brags gzhan zhig tu phyin nas de na khyim bdag dad pa can zhig 'dug pa des de dag khyim gzhan du zan la mgron du bos nas dge slong re re la ras yug chen bskon
translated: When sixty monks were traveling through the countryside, they went to another village where a faithful householder lived. He invited them to his house for a meal and offered a woolen shawl to each monk.

original: no snyam du bsams shing de dag kyang zan bza' ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / dge slong ma drug cu yang ri brags de nyid du lhags nas de dag gis kyang der zan zos so //
analyzed: no snyam du bsams shing de dag kyang zan bza' ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / dge slong ma drug cu yang ri brags de nyid du lhags nas de dag gis kyang der zan zos so //
translated: The monks thought, “We will eat and then leave,” and they entered to eat. Sixty nuns also arrived in that village and they too ate there.

original: de nas khyim bdag des ras yug chen drug cu rgan pa'i mthar gzhag pa dang dge slong dag gis ji ltar bgo bar bya ba mi shes nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des ras yug chen drug cu rgan pa'i mthar gzhag pa dang dge slong dag gis ji ltar bgo bar bya ba mi shes nas /
translated: Then the householder placed sixty woolen shawls at the end of the row of monks. The monks did not know how to distribute them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said,

original: rnyed pa 'di gnyi ga'i dge 'dun gyi yin pas gnyi ga'i dge 'dun gyis mnyam par bgo bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa 'di gnyi ga'i dge 'dun gyi yin pas gnyi ga'i dge 'dun gyis mnyam par bgo bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Since the saṅgha of both communities is the owner of these two types of property, the saṅgha of both communities should distribute them equally.”

original: stan dang chu dang bsod snyoms dag la dge slong dge slong ma dag pas gtso bo nyid ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stan dang chu dang bsod snyoms dag la dge slong dge slong ma dag pas gtso bo nyid ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that the monks are not the most important in regard to seats, water, and alms.

original: stan la sogs bdag la dge slong ni dge slong ma dag pas gtso bo nyid yin pa'o //🔽dge slong ma rnams kyi tshogs pa na rgan pa'i mthar stan dag gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stan la sogs bdag la dge slong ni dge slong ma dag pas gtso bo nyid yin pa'o // dge slong ma rnams kyi tshogs pa na rgan pa'i mthar stan dag gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In regard to seats, etc., the monks are the most important, not the nuns.🔽In the assembly of nuns, seats should be arranged at the end for the elder nuns.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyi tshogs pa'i dus na rgan pa'i mtha' logs su gral gyi stan dag la gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyi tshogs pa'i dus na rgan pa'i mtha' logs su gral gyi stan dag la gzhag par bya ste /
translated: In the assembly of nuns, seats should be arranged at the end for the elder nuns.

original: 'di ni brgya la dge slong ni 'ga' 'ong bar 'gyur srid pas de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni brgya la dge slong ni 'ga' 'ong bar 'gyur srid pas de'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is possible that a monk might come there.

original: dge slong dang bcas pa nyid na de dag gis mi nus na dge slong mas yon bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dang bcas pa nyid na de dag gis mi nus na dge slong mas yon bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If they are unable to do so because of the presence of monks, the nuns should explain the merit.

original: mchod ston la sogs pa dag la dge slong dang bcas pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: mchod ston la sogs pa dag la dge slong dang bcas pa nyid yin la /
translated: In the case of a feast, etc., if monks are present,

original: dge slong de dag gis yon bshad par byed mi nus na dge slong mas yon bshad par byar rung ba'o /
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis yon bshad par byed mi nus na dge slong mas yon bshad par byar rung ba'o /
translated: If those monks are unable to explain the gift, it is suitable for a nun to explain the gift.

original: 'drim par byed pas sbyin pa'i phyir zas nye bar gzhag pa na dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis dang por snyoms par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: 'drim par byed pas sbyin pa'i phyir zas nye bar gzhag pa na dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis dang por snyoms par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
translated: When the food is set out for the sake of giving, the most senior monk in the saṅgha should say, “First distribute it equally.”

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zas 'drim par byed pa'i gang zag gis dge 'dun la zas sbyin pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi mdun du zas nye bar gzhag pa na de la dang por thams cad la snyoms par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zas 'drim par byed pa'i gang zag gis dge 'dun la zas sbyin pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi mdun du zas nye bar gzhag pa na de la dang por thams cad la snyoms par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: When the person who distributes the food sets out the food in front of the saṅgha for the sake of giving food to the saṅgha, the most senior monk in the saṅgha should say, “First distribute it equally to everyone.”

original: dang por zas len pa'i dang por de la de skad ma bsgo na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dang por zas len pa'i dang por de la de skad ma bsgo na nyes byas so //
translated: If he does not say that at the beginning, it is a minor infraction.

original: dang pos ma @206b smras na yang de'i 'og tu smra par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dang pos ma @206b smras na yang de'i 'og tu smra par bya ba yin te /
translated: If the first one does not say it, the next one should say it.

original: de'i tshe yang ma smras na nyes byas gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang ma smras na nyes byas gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he also does not say it, it becomes another minor infraction.

original: 'khor la bltas te mang la zas nyung ba nyid yin na de'i tshe snga ma brjod cing khyad par shes so zhes bya ba ni /🔽dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis 'khor la bltas te 'khor mang la zas nyung ba nyid yin na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zas 'drim pas sbyin pa'i phyir zas nye bar gzhag pa na /
analyzed: 'khor la bltas te mang la zas nyung ba nyid yin na de'i tshe snga ma brjod cing khyad par shes so zhes bya ba ni / dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis 'khor la bltas te 'khor mang la zas nyung ba nyid yin na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zas 'drim pas sbyin pa'i phyir zas nye bar gzhag pa na /
translated: If the assembly is large and the food is small, then at that time the former should be mentioned and the difference should be known.

original: de la dang por snga ma brjod cing khyed par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la dang por snga ma brjod cing khyed par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If the assembly is large and the food is small, then at that time the elder of the Saṅgha should order the distribution of the food by the distributor of food, saying, “First mention the former and distribute equally.”

original: snga ma brjod cing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snga ma brjod cing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “First mention the former” means

original: 'khor mang la zas nyung ba nyid yin na zhes sngar bstan ma thag pa de nyid brjod cing ste /
analyzed: 'khor mang la zas nyung ba nyid yin na zhes sngar bstan ma thag pa de nyid brjod cing ste /
translated: mention just that which was taught previously, namely, “If the assembly is large and the food is small.”

original: dge slong dag mang la zas nyung gis khyed par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag mang la zas nyung gis khyed par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: “Distribute equally” means order the distribution of food by the distributor of food, saying, “Distribute equally because the monks are many and the food is small.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: 'khor la bltas te 'khor gyi rdzas dag mang la zas nyung ba nyid yin na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zas 'drim pa'i gang zag gis sbyin pa'i phyir zas nye bar gzhag pa na de la snga ma brjod cing zhes bya ba 'khor gyi rdzas
analyzed: 'khor la bltas te 'khor gyi rdzas dag mang la zas nyung ba nyid yin na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zas 'drim pa'i gang zag gis sbyin pa'i phyir zas nye bar gzhag pa na de la snga ma brjod cing zhes bya ba 'khor gyi rdzas
translated: If the assembly is observed to have many resources but little food, then at that time the saṅgha’s most senior monk should say, “Announce the previous,” and so forth.🔽The resources of the assembly

original: dag mang la zas nyung ba nyid ces sngar bstan pa de brjod cing khyed par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dag mang la zas nyung ba nyid ces sngar bstan pa de brjod cing khyed par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: are many but the food is little.

original: gzhan nyid yin na ci 'byor pa zhes so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na ci 'byor pa zhes so zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is someone else, say, “Whatever is available.”

original: gzhan nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni 'khor gyi rdzas dag ni nyung la zas ni mang ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni 'khor gyi rdzas dag ni nyung la zas ni mang ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: If it is someone else, the resources of the assembly are few but the food is much.

original: ci 'byor pa zhes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci 'byor pa zhes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Whatever is available.

original: 'khor la bltas te 'khor nyung la zas mang pa nyid yin na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zas 'drim pas sbyin pa'i phyir zas nye bar gzhag pa na /
analyzed: 'khor la bltas te 'khor nyung la zas mang pa nyid yin na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zas 'drim pas sbyin pa'i phyir zas nye bar gzhag pa na /
translated: If the assembly is observed to have few resources but much food, then at that time the saṅgha’s most senior monk should say, “Announce the previous,” and so forth.

original: de la dang po'i 'khor nyung la zas mang ba nyid yin no zhes brjod cing ci 'byor pa brims shig ces bsgo bar bya ba'o //🔽rgan pa'i mthar sam prapta zhes ma brjod par dang por blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dang po'i 'khor nyung la zas mang ba nyid yin no zhes brjod cing ci 'byor pa brims shig ces bsgo bar bya ba'o // rgan pa'i mthar sam prapta zhes ma brjod par dang por blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The food should be distributed according to what is available.

original: 'drim par byed pas dge 'dun gyi rgan pa'i mtha' logs su sam prapta zhes bya ba'i sngags ma brjod kyi bar du dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis dang por zas blang bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'drim par byed pas dge 'dun gyi rgan pa'i mtha' logs su sam prapta zhes bya ba'i sngags ma brjod kyi bar du dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis dang por zas blang bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: The elder of the saṃgha should not take the food first, until the person who is distributing the food has said “sampravrāji” at the end of the row of elders.

original: sam prapta zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni mnyam par gyur cig ces bya ste /
analyzed: sam prapta zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni mnyam par gyur cig ces bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the word sampravrāji is “may it be equal.”

original: bi sham prapta zhes bya ba ni mi mnyam par gyur ces bya ste /
analyzed: bi sham prapta zhes bya ba ni mi mnyam par gyur ces bya ste /
translated: Viśaṃpravrāji means “may it be unequal.”

original: dug tu gyur ces bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: dug tu gyur ces bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: It means “may it be poison.”

original: dug med par gyur pa ni mnyam par gyur pa ste sam prapta zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dug med par gyur pa ni mnyam par gyur pa ste sam prapta zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The absence of poison is equality, which is sampravrāji.

original: de bas na zas 'drim par byed pa'i gang zag @207a * //
analyzed: de bas na zas 'drim par byed pa'i gang zag @207a * //
translated: Therefore, the person who is distributing the food

original: gis dge slong gi mngon sum du sam prapta zhes bya ba'i sngags 'di brjod na /
analyzed: gis dge slong gi mngon sum du sam prapta zhes bya ba'i sngags 'di brjod na /
translated: If a monk recites this mantra called “The Attainment of Samprāpta,”

original: zas dug can yang dug med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas dug can yang dug med par 'gyur ro //
translated: even poisoned food will become free of poison.

original: zas bsngogs pa na bskos pa dag las gzhan pa dag lhags na de la sbran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zas bsngogs pa na bskos pa dag las gzhan pa dag lhags na de la sbran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If those invited to a meal are unable to attend, the substitute monks should be informed.

original: sbyin bdag gis zan drang la rag par bsngogs pa na /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis zan drang la rag par bsngogs pa na /
translated: When the host is ready to serve the meal,

original: mgron du bskos pa'i dge slong dag las gzhan pa'i dge slong mgron dum bskos pa dag lhags na de'i tshem gron du bskos pa'i dge slong dag gis sbyin bdag de la sbran par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mgron du bskos pa'i dge slong dag las gzhan pa'i dge slong mgron dum bskos pa dag lhags na de'i tshem gron du bskos pa'i dge slong dag gis sbyin bdag de la sbran par bya ba'o //
translated: if monks who were not invited to the meal, but who are monks invited to other meals, arrive, the monks who were invited to the meal should inform the host.

original: de ni phongs pa spangs pa'i phyir dang skyangs pa spang pa'i phyir ro //🔽dge slong chos gos gsum sbyin du gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni phongs pa spangs pa'i phyir dang skyangs pa spang pa'i phyir ro // dge slong chos gos gsum sbyin du gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is to avoid the problem of scarcity and to avoid the problem of overabundance.🔽Monks should not be made to give away their three robes.

original: dge slong gis dge slong chos gos gsum sbyin du mi gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong chos gos gsum sbyin du mi gzhug pa'o //
translated: Monks should not be made to give away their three robes.

original: dge 'dun gyis sos par gyur pa nyid na 'di phyir sbyin no snyam pa de las gzhan pa'i yid kyis blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis sos par gyur pa nyid na 'di phyir sbyin no snyam pa de las gzhan pa'i yid kyis blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When the Saṅgha has been restored, he should not take it back with a different intention.

original: dge slong nad pas dge 'dun la chos gos gsum yon du phul ba ni dge 'dun gyis gal te nad pa sos par gyur na chos gos 'di phyir sbyin no snyam pa'i sems kyis blang par bya'i /
analyzed: dge slong nad pas dge 'dun la chos gos gsum yon du phul ba ni dge 'dun gyis gal te nad pa sos par gyur na chos gos 'di phyir sbyin no snyam pa'i sems kyis blang par bya'i /
translated: When a sick monk has given his three robes as a gift to the Saṅgha, the Saṅgha should take them with the intention that they will be returned to him if he recovers.

original: de las gzhan pa'i yid kyis blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yid kyis blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not take them with a different intention.

original: gang zag la phul ba yang de bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag la phul ba yang de bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The same should be done when a gift is given to an individual.

original: stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyis ro dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyis ro dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The corpse should be covered with the upper robe and the lower robe.

original: shi ba'i ro ni stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyis g-yogs te dor bar bya'i sgren mor mi dor ba ste /
analyzed: shi ba'i ro ni stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyis g-yogs te dor bar bya'i sgren mor mi dor ba ste /
translated: The corpse of a monk should be covered with the upper robe and the lower robe and then carried out. It should not be carried out naked.

original: de ni mgon med par thal bar gyur pa'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mgon med par thal bar gyur pa'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to avoid the fault of leaving it without a protector.

original: 'bring gis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bring gis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The middle one should be given to the one in the middle.

original: stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs ngan pa yang ma yin pa bzang po yang ma yin pa 'bring gis dor bar bya'o //🔽lhags mas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs ngan pa yang ma yin pa bzang po yang ma yin pa 'bring gis dor bar bya'o // lhags mas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small tear, nor because of a large tear.🔽One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small hole, nor because of a large hole.🔽One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small burn mark, nor because of a large burn mark.

original: stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs las gzhan pa'i rdzas lhag mas ro dor bar mi bya ba'o //🔽sham thabs ma bcings par grong du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽ske rags kyis so //
analyzed: stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs las gzhan pa'i rdzas lhag mas ro dor bar mi bya ba'o // sham thabs ma bcings par grong du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni / ske rags kyis so //
translated: One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small stain, nor because of a large stain.🔽One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small patch, nor because of a large patch.🔽One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small moth hole, nor because of a large moth hole.

original: khris gcig gis kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khris gcig gis kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small tear, nor because of a large tear.

original: ske rags khris gcig gis bcings pas kyang grong du 'jug par mi bya ba'o //🔽gos kyi gzhi phran tshegs la sogs pa zhu ba dang bcas pa'i skabs so zhes bya ba gos kyi gzhi de dag gi skabs nas 'byung bde bshad do //
analyzed: ske rags khris gcig gis bcings pas kyang grong du 'jug par mi bya ba'o // gos kyi gzhi phran tshegs la sogs pa zhu ba dang bcas pa'i skabs so zhes bya ba gos kyi gzhi de dag gi skabs nas 'byung bde bshad do //
translated: One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small hole, nor because of a large hole.🔽One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small burn mark, nor because of a large burn mark.🔽One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small stain, nor because of a large stain.

original: gos kyi gzhi rdzogs so zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: gos kyi gzhi rdzogs so zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small patch, nor because of a large patch.

original: // / da ni ko lpags kyi gzhi bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni ko lpags kyi gzhi bshad par bya ste /
translated: One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small moth hole, nor because of a large moth hole.🔽One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small tear, nor because of a large tear.🔽One should not discard the upper robe or the lower robe because of a small hole, nor because of a large hole.

original: de la dang por mtha' 'khob nges @207b par shes par bya ba'i phyir yul dbus bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por mtha' 'khob nges @207b par shes par bya ba'i phyir yul dbus bstan par bya ste /
translated: In order to know the border of the border region, the center of the country should be taught.

original: de'i phyir yul dbus kyi mtshams so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul dbus kyi mtshams so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the text says, “The border of the center is taught.”

original: bstan par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bstan par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word “taught” is supplied.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i phyir shar du ni li khar shing 'phel gyi mdun gyi nags li kha ra'i shing tshad tshing can zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shar du ni li khar shing 'phel gyi mdun gyi nags li kha ra'i shing tshad tshing can zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the text says, “In the east, the forest in front of Likhita’s mango grove is called the thicket of Likhita’s mango grove.”

original: shar phyogs na yul li khar shing 'phel zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: shar phyogs na yul li khar shing 'phel zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: In the east there is a country called Likhita’s mango grove.

original: de'i mdun na nags li kha ra'i shing tshang tshing can zhes bya ba yod pa'i nub kyi cha tshun chad ni yul dbus kyi shar phyogs kyi mtshams yin no //
analyzed: de'i mdun na nags li kha ra'i shing tshang tshing can zhes bya ba yod pa'i nub kyi cha tshun chad ni yul dbus kyi shar phyogs kyi mtshams yin no //
translated: The western side of the forest called the thicket of Likhita’s mango grove, which is in front of it, is the eastern border of the center.

original: de phan chad ni yul mtha' 'khob yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad ni yul mtha' 'khob yin no //
translated: Beyond that is the border region.

original: nags zhes bya ba ni 'dir rtsva dang gel pa dang bcas pa'i sa'i phyogs kyi gtos chen po'o //
analyzed: nags zhes bya ba ni 'dir rtsva dang gel pa dang bcas pa'i sa'i phyogs kyi gtos chen po'o //
translated: “Forest” here means a large area of land with grass and shrubs.

original: lhor ni 'dam bu can gyi lho na chu klung de zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhor ni 'dam bu can gyi lho na chu klung de zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the south, the river called Yamunā is south of Mathurā.

original: lho phyogs na grong khyer 'dam bu can zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: lho phyogs na grong khyer 'dam bu can zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: In the south, there is a city called Mathurā.

original: de'i lho na chu klung 'dam bu can zhes bya ba yod pa'i byang phyogs kyi cha tshun chad ni yul gyi dbus kyi lho phyogs kyi mtshams yin no //
analyzed: de'i lho na chu klung 'dam bu can zhes bya ba yod pa'i byang phyogs kyi cha tshun chad ni yul gyi dbus kyi lho phyogs kyi mtshams yin no //
translated: South of that, there is a river called Yamunā. The northern part of that river is the southern border of the central country.

original: de phan chad ni yul mtha' 'khob yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad ni yul mtha' 'khob yin no //
translated: Beyond that is the border region.

original: nub tu ni bram ze'i grong ka ba dang nye ba'i ka ba zhes bya ba gnyis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nub tu ni bram ze'i grong ka ba dang nye ba'i ka ba zhes bya ba gnyis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the west, there are two brahmin villages called Kāliṅga and Oḍra.

original: nub phyogs na bram ze'i grong ka ba dang nye ba'i ka ba zhes bya ba gnyis yod de /
analyzed: nub phyogs na bram ze'i grong ka ba dang nye ba'i ka ba zhes bya ba gnyis yod de /
translated: In the west, there are two brahmin villages called Kāliṅga and Oḍra.

original: de'i shar gyi cha tshun chad ni yul dbus kyi nub phyogs kyi mtshams yin no //
analyzed: de'i shar gyi cha tshun chad ni yul dbus kyi nub phyogs kyi mtshams yin no //
translated: The eastern part of that is the western border of the central country.

original: de phan chad ni yul mtha' 'khob yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad ni yul mtha' 'khob yin no //
translated: Beyond that is the border region.

original: byang du ni au shi ra'i ri zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang du ni au shi ra'i ri zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the north, there is the mountain called Uśīra.

original: byang phyogs na ri au shi ra'i ri zhes bya ba yod de /🔽de'i lho'i cha tshun chad ni yul dbus kyi byang phyogs kyi mtshams yin no //
analyzed: byang phyogs na ri au shi ra'i ri zhes bya ba yod de / de'i lho'i cha tshun chad ni yul dbus kyi byang phyogs kyi mtshams yin no //
translated: In the north, there is the Ushira mountain.🔽To the south of that mountain is the border of the northern region.

original: de phan chad ni yul mtha' 'khob yin no //🔽mtha' khob tu mchil lham dag bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de phan chad ni yul mtha' 'khob yin no // mtha' khob tu mchil lham dag bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Beyond that is the border region.🔽One should wear shoes in the border region.

original: yul mtha' khob tu rkang pa dag bskyab pa'i phyir mchil lham dag bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul mtha' khob tu rkang pa dag bskyab pa'i phyir mchil lham dag bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should wear shoes in the border region in order to protect one's feet.

original: gnas mal bskyang ba'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas mal bskyang ba'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, in order to protect one's bedding.

original: yul dbus su yang gnas mal bskyang ba'i phyir mchil lham ngag bcang bar bya ba'o /
analyzed: yul dbus su yang gnas mal bskyang ba'i phyir mchil lham ngag bcang bar bya ba'o /
translated: One should wear shoes in the central region in order to protect one's bedding.

original: gnas ma la zhes smos pas ni khri la sogs pa yang bzung ba nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas ma la zhes smos pas ni khri la sogs pa yang bzung ba nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: Since it says bedding, one should understand that it refers to beds and so on,

original: khri la sogs pa de la yang rkang pa dag gis brdzi ba'i gnas skabs srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khri la sogs pa de la yang rkang pa dag gis brdzi ba'i gnas skabs srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that one might step on a bed and so on with one's shoes on.

original: gnas gzhan du sod bas gnas mal bskyang ba'i phyir rkang pa gnyis la de dag bgo bar rigs par snang ngo //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du sod bas gnas mal bskyang ba'i phyir rkang pa gnyis la de dag bgo bar rigs par snang ngo //
translated: It is proper to carry them on one's feet in order to preserve the bedding in another place.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bsod snyoms pa zhig mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la @208a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bsod snyoms pa zhig mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la @208a * //
translated: Here is the text: A monk who was a panhandler entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: zhugs pa na de mchil lham med pas rkang pa dag sar ka byung ba khyim bdag des mthong nas /
analyzed: zhugs pa na de mchil lham med pas rkang pa dag sar ka byung ba khyim bdag des mthong nas /
translated: Since he had no sandals, his feet became cracked. The householder saw this.

original: des de la smras pa /
analyzed: des de la smras pa /
translated: He said to him,

original: 'phags pa khyod la mchil lham dag yod dam /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod la mchil lham dag yod dam /
translated: Noble one, do you have sandals?

original: med do // tshur shog dang sbyin du gzhug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: med do // tshur shog dang sbyin du gzhug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: No. Come, I will give you some.

original: mchil lham ji lta bu dag bcang bar bya zhen nga'i phyir chag rim mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mchil lham ji lta bu dag bcang bar bya zhen nga'i phyir chag rim mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What kind of sandals should one wear? He said, For me, they should be made of leather.

original: mchil lham tshig rim can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rdog pa gzhug pas bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchil lham tshig rim can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rdog pa gzhug pas bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that they should be made of leather strips.🔽They should be repaired by inserting a patch.

original: rdol pa nyid na rdog pa gzhug cing bcos su rung ba'o //
analyzed: rdol pa nyid na rdog pa gzhug cing bcos su rung ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that when they are worn out, they should be repaired by inserting a patch.

original: rim pa gzhan ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rim pa gzhan ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not proper to have another layer.

original: mthil rim pa gzhan gdags shing bcos su ni ma rung pa'o //
analyzed: mthil rim pa gzhan gdags shing bcos su ni ma rung pa'o //
translated: It is not proper to add another layer to the sole or to repair it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te rdo lan rdog pa bcug ste bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te rdo lan rdog pa bcug ste bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says, “If a hole appears, it should be patched.”

original: rdol na zhes bya ba ni bu gu byung na'o //🔽khyim pas tha na gom pa bdun du bgos na rim pa mang yang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdol na zhes bya ba ni bu gu byung na'o // khyim pas tha na gom pa bdun du bgos na rim pa mang yang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a hole appears means if a hole develops.🔽Even if there are many layers, a householder may use sandals with up to seven layers.

original: mchil lham rim pa mang po gal te khyim pas tha na gom pa bdun du bgos na rim pa mang yang bcang du rung ba'o //
analyzed: mchil lham rim pa mang po gal te khyim pas tha na gom pa bdun du bgos na rim pa mang yang bcang du rung ba'o //
translated: Even if there are many layers, a householder may use sandals with up to seven layers.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor khyim pas tha na gom pa bdun du bgos par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor khyim pas tha na gom pa bdun du bgos par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says, “Upāli, a householder may use sandals with up to seven layers.”

original: rung ba tsam gyis don nyid du de dang sbyar pa'i dbang du len pa na mi rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /🔽rung ba tsam gyi don nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rung ba tsam gyis don nyid du de dang sbyar pa'i dbang du len pa na mi rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /🔽rung ba tsam gyi don nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one uses sandals that are proper, it is not a downfall to use sandals that are not proper.🔽If one uses sandals that are proper, it is not a downfall to use sandals that are not proper.
