original: rung pa tsam gyis mthil dang po la la sogs pa'i don du len pa gang yin pa de ni rung ba tsam gyi don len pa ste /
analyzed: rung pa tsam gyis mthil dang po la la sogs pa'i don du len pa gang yin pa de ni rung ba tsam gyi don len pa ste /
translated: That which is taken for the sake of mere suitability, such as the first of the three robes, is the taking of the meaning of mere suitability.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de der ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de der ro //
translated: Its substance is just that, and it is taken for that.

original: de dang sbyar ba'i dbang du len pa zhas bya ba ni rung ba tsam de dang bdag nyid du sbyar zhing phrad par bya ba'i phyir len pa'o //
analyzed: de dang sbyar ba'i dbang du len pa zhas bya ba ni rung ba tsam de dang bdag nyid du sbyar zhing phrad par bya ba'i phyir len pa'o //
translated: The taking that is connected with that is called the taking that is connected with mere suitability. It is the taking in order to connect with, and unite, oneself with that mere suitability.

original: mi rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not the taking of what is unsuitable.

original: de ltar len pa de ni mi rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin no /
analyzed: de ltar len pa de ni mi rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin no /
translated: That taking is not the taking of what is unsuitable.

original: rung ba kho na blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rung ba kho na blangs pa yin no //
translated: It is the taking of what is suitable.

original: 'dis ni chig rim du byas te bcang bar bya'o snyam pas rim pa mang po dag slong gis bdag gir byas na mi rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes gsungs pa bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni chig rim du byas te bcang bar bya'o snyam pas rim pa mang po dag slong gis bdag gir byas na mi rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes gsungs pa bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is a summary of what is said: “If one appropriates many robes by begging, thinking ‘I will keep them in order,’ it is not the taking of what is unsuitable.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: 'di la mthil dang bal la sogs pa rung ba yod pa gang yin pa de bdag gis 'di las blang ngo snyam pa'i bsam pas rung ba dang 'dres pa'i mi rung ba len pa gang yin pa la ni bdag gir bya ba mi 'byung bas des ni mi
analyzed: 'di la mthil dang bal la sogs pa rung ba yod pa gang yin pa de bdag gis 'di las blang ngo snyam pa'i bsam pas rung ba dang 'dres pa'i mi rung ba len pa gang yin pa la ni bdag gir bya ba mi 'byung bas des ni mi
translated: If one thinks, I will take from this what is suitable, such as wool or cotton, then if one takes what is unsuitable mixed with what is suitable, one does not obtain ownership of it.

original: rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, one does not take what is unsuitable.

original: rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po la bdag gir bya ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po la bdag gir bya ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not obtain ownership of an unsuitable object.

original: 'dir @208b gzhung ni bsod snyoms pa mchil lham med pa zhig mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: 'dir @208b gzhung ni bsod snyoms pa mchil lham med pa zhig mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
translated: Here is the story. A monk who was an alms collector and did not wear sandals entered Śrāvastī to collect alms.

original: de khyim bdag cig gis khyim du khrid de zas bsod pas tshim par byas na /
analyzed: de khyim bdag cig gis khyim du khrid de zas bsod pas tshim par byas na /
translated: A householder led him to his house and satisfied him with excellent food.

original: mchil lham rim pa mang po dag byin pa dang / dge slong des smras pa /
analyzed: mchil lham rim pa mang po dag byin pa dang / dge slong des smras pa /
translated: He gave him many pairs of sandals, but the monk said,

original: khyim bdag bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: khyim bdag bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su ma gnang ngo //
translated: Householder, the Bhagavat did not permit that.

original: nges smras pa 'phags pa song la rim gcig par byas te bcang par gyis shig / des blangs te gtsug lag khang du song ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges smras pa 'phags pa song la rim gcig par byas te bcang par gyis shig / des blangs te gtsug lag khang du song ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He took it and went to the monastery.

original: 'di la rim pa gcig par byas te bcang bar bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pas dge slong gis mchil lham rim pa mang po dag bdag gir byas pa gang yin pa de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la rim pa gcig par byas te bcang bar bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pas dge slong gis mchil lham rim pa mang po dag bdag gir byas pa gang yin pa de la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense for a monk who thinks, I will keep it in one layer, to keep many layers of sandals.

original: khra bo bkra ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /🔽mchil lha dag ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: khra bo bkra ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni / mchil lha dag ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: One should not keep variegated sandals.

original: 'di man chad nas /
analyzed: 'di man chad nas /
translated: This is connected with sandals.

original: 'og gi mdo las sgeg rdzas su 'gyur ba gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes 'byung ba yan chad mchil lham dag ces bya bar sbyar ro //🔽lug ru lta bu dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'og gi mdo las sgeg rdzas su 'gyur ba gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes 'byung ba yan chad mchil lham dag ces bya bar sbyar ro // lug ru lta bu dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From here onward, up to and other ornaments mentioned in the lower sutra, is connected with sandals.🔽One should not keep sandals shaped like a sheep's hoof.

original: mchil lham rma bya'i gshog pa la sogs pas lug ru'i rnam pa ltar gnyer ma mthon dman can du byas ba dag bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchil lham rma bya'i gshog pa la sogs pas lug ru'i rnam pa ltar gnyer ma mthon dman can du byas ba dag bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not keep sandals made with the pattern of a sheep's hoof, with high and low folds like a peacock's feathers, and so on.

original: aa shva ta tha dang ka ra b'i ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: aa shva ta tha dang ka ra b'i ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not use sandals like the leaves of the ashvakarna and karavira trees.

original: mchil lham shing aa shva ta tha dang ka ra b'i ra'i 'dab ma lta bu'i dbyar 'dab can dag bcang bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchil lham shing aa shva ta tha dang ka ra b'i ra'i 'dab ma lta bu'i dbyar 'dab can dag bcang bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not use sandals made of the leaves of the ashvakarna and karavira trees, which are used in the summer.

original: gser dang dngul gyis spras pa dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gser dang dngul gyis spras pa dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not use sandals decorated with gold and silver.

original: mchil lham gser dang dngul gyis brgyan ba dag mi bcang ba'o //🔽khrig khrig zer ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchil lham gser dang dngul gyis brgyan ba dag mi bcang ba'o // khrig khrig zer ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not use sandals decorated with gold and silver.🔽One should not use sandals that make a “kri” sound.

original: mchil lham sgra khrig khrig zer ba dag mi bcang ba'o //🔽krog krog zer ba dag kyang mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchil lham sgra khrig khrig zer ba dag mi bcang ba'o // krog krog zer ba dag kyang mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not use sandals that make a “kri” sound.🔽One should not use sandals that make a “kro” sound.

original: mchil lham sgra krog krog zer ba dag mi bcang ba'o //🔽tug tug zer ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /🔽mchil lham sgra thrig thrig zer ba dag mi bcang ba'o //
analyzed: mchil lham sgra krog krog zer ba dag mi bcang ba'o // tug tug zer ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni / mchil lham sgra thrig thrig zer ba dag mi bcang ba'o //
translated: One should not use sandals that make a “kro” sound.🔽One should not use sandals that make a “tik” sound.🔽One should not use sandals that make a “tik” sound.

original: thrig thrig zer ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thrig thrig zer ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not use sandals that make a “thik” sound.

original: mchil lham sgra thrig thrig zer ba dag mi bcang ba'o //
analyzed: mchil lham sgra thrig thrig zer ba dag mi bcang ba'o //
translated: He should not wear shoes that make a swishing sound.

original: sgeg rdzas su 'gyur ba gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgeg rdzas su 'gyur ba gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And other things that are used as ornaments.

original: sgeg rdzas thams cad dgag pa'i phyir tshig 'di smos so //
analyzed: sgeg rdzas thams cad dgag pa'i phyir tshig 'di smos so //
translated: This verse is stated to prohibit all ornaments.

original: bol ko ba can ni mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bol ko ba can ni mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not improper to wear shoes made of felt.

original: de ni sgeg rdzas su rtogs pa ma yin par shes par bya'o //🔽sna dang rting pa'i sbubs can bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni sgeg rdzas su rtogs pa ma yin par shes par bya'o // sna dang rting pa'i sbubs can bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be understood that these are not considered to be ornaments.🔽He should wear shoes with a covering for the heel and toes.

original: mchil lham sna'i sbubs can dang rting pa'i sbubs can bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchil lham sna'i sbubs can dang rting pa'i sbubs can bcang bar bya'o //
translated: He should wear shoes that cover the heel and toes.

original: 'dir gzhung ni @209a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni @209a * //
translated: Here is the story.

original: dge slong rnams bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la 'dzeg pa na rkang ba'i sna dag 'drud nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la 'dzeg pa na rkang ba'i sna dag 'drud nas /
translated: When the monks were climbing Vulture Peak Mountain, their toes dragged on the ground.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Monks, you should wear shoes.”

original: sna sbubs can bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'babs pa na rting pa dag 'dud nas rting sbubs can bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sna sbubs can bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'babs pa na rting pa dag 'dud nas rting sbubs can bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: When walking, one should lower one’s heels and wear shoes with a covering for the heel.

original: kha chu chus byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha chu chus byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Shoes that are called ‘water of the mouth of the nāgas’ ”

original: lham gyi ming kha chu chus byung zhes bya ba de bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: lham gyi ming kha chu chus byung zhes bya ba de bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: means that one should wear shoes that are called “water of the mouth of the nāgas.”

original: de'i ming ni don las btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i ming ni don las btags pa yin te /
translated: The name of these shoes is given according to their meaning.

original: klu'i kha chu'i chu las rtsva dag dug can du gyur nas rtsva de'i gnod pa bsal ba'i phyir 'jig rten du lham de byung bas lham de'i ming kha chu chus byung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i kha chu'i chu las rtsva dag dug can du gyur nas rtsva de'i gnod pa bsal ba'i phyir 'jig rten du lham de byung bas lham de'i ming kha chu chus byung zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the grass in the water of the mouth of the nāgas becomes poisonous, and in order to remove the harm of that grass, these shoes were created in the world. Therefore, the name of these shoes is “water of the mouth of the nāgas.”

original: lham de ni rkang pa thams cad phal cher g-yogs la bol gyi snar mthangs phyung ba ste /
analyzed: lham de ni rkang pa thams cad phal cher g-yogs la bol gyi snar mthangs phyung ba ste /
translated: These shoes cover most of the foot, and the toes are exposed.

original: sbubs mthangs can zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbubs mthangs can zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that these are called “shoes with an opening for the toes.”

original: lham yu chad kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang bcang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lham yu chad kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang bcang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Shoes with a strap” also means that one should wear shoes with a strap.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gang gi tshe klu'i rgyal po sogs ma med kyis ser ba'i char phab pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gang gi tshe klu'i rgyal po sogs ma med kyis ser ba'i char phab pa de'i tshe /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: When the nāga king Anavatapta and so on caused a hail storm,

original: rtsva dag kyang dug can du gyur nas deng dge slong dag 'chag ba'i rkang pa dag la rmad ga byung zhing rma dag byer bar 'gyur nas /
analyzed: rtsva dag kyang dug can du gyur nas deng dge slong dag 'chag ba'i rkang pa dag la rmad ga byung zhing rma dag byer bar 'gyur nas /
translated: the grass became poisonous. Today, blisters arose on the feet of the monks and the blisters burst.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: kha chu chus byung ba bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha chu chus byung ba bcang bar bya'o //
translated: “You should wear shoes.

original: lham yu chad bcad bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lham yu chad bcad bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: You should cut the tips of the shoes.”🔽In a country where the water is frozen, you should wear boots and shoes with straps.

original: chul chab brom 'chags pa'i yul du ni zhva dang lham sgrog gu can yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yul gang du chu la chab brom 'chags pa'i yul der ni zhva dang lham sgrog gu can dag bcang par bya'o //
analyzed: chul chab brom 'chags pa'i yul du ni zhva dang lham sgrog gu can yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yul gang du chu la chab brom 'chags pa'i yul der ni zhva dang lham sgrog gu can dag bcang par bya'o //
translated: In a country where the water is frozen, you should wear boots and shoes with straps.

original: de gnyis na lhags pa bskyab pa'i phyir bcang bar gsungs pa yin pas /
analyzed: de gnyis na lhags pa bskyab pa'i phyir bcang bar gsungs pa yin pas /
translated: Since it is said that these two are worn to protect against the cold,

original: lhags pa dang bral na dbyar gyi gos ras chen bzhin du gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhags pa dang bral na dbyar gyi gos ras chen bzhin du gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: when you are free from the cold, you should know that they are to be put aside like the rainy season robe.

original: nad gso ba'i don du ni dus thams cad du yang bcang du rung ste /
analyzed: nad gso ba'i don du ni dus thams cad du yang bcang du rung ste /
translated: It is suitable to wear at all times for the purpose of curing illness,

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a natural offense.

original: bla ma'i drung du mchil lham bgo par bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bla ma'i drung du mchil lham bgo par bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not wear shoes in the presence of a guru.

original: ston pa dang mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pa'i drung du mchil lham bgo bar bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pa'i drung du mchil lham bgo bar bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not wear shoes in the presence of a teacher, preceptor, master, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi spyan sngar mchil lham gyon zhing 'chag pa'i dge slong smad pas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi spyan sngar mchil lham gyon zhing 'chag pa'i dge slong smad pas na /
translated: The Blessed One himself criticized a monk who walked about in his presence wearing shoes.

original: dge slong dag la yang tshul de nyid smad pa yin pas de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: dge slong dag la yang tshul de nyid smad pa yin pas de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
translated: Since he criticized monks in the same way, this sutra was composed.

original: seng ge dang stag dang gung dang glang po che cang shes dang rta cad shes kyi yan lag cung zad kyang lus la gdags par mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: seng ge dang stag dang gung dang glang po che cang shes dang rta cad shes kyi yan lag cung zad kyang lus la gdags par mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not wear even a small part of a lion, tiger, leopard, elephant, or horse on one’s body.

original: de @209b dag gi lpags pa dang rgyus pa la sogs pa cung zad kyang dge slong gi lus la gdags pa bsten par ma bya ba'o /
analyzed: de @209b dag gi lpags pa dang rgyus pa la sogs pa cung zad kyang dge slong gi lus la gdags pa bsten par ma bya ba'o /
translated: The monk should not use even a little of their skin, sinew, etc.

original: de dag gis glang po cho phal pa dang rta dmu rgod dang de las gzhan pa'i gcan gzan dag kyang 'bangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gis glang po cho phal pa dang rta dmu rgod dang de las gzhan pa'i gcan gzan dag kyang 'bangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They also tame ordinary elephants, wild horses, and other beasts.

original: seng ge la sogs pa de dag gis glang po che phal pa la sogs pa dag kyang bsdus par rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: seng ge la sogs pa de dag gis glang po che phal pa la sogs pa dag kyang bsdus par rig par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be understood that lions, etc. also include ordinary elephants, etc.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gis rung ba ma yin pa lnga po dag gi mchil lham dag bcang bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gis rung ba ma yin pa lnga po dag gi mchil lham dag bcang bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: Here the text says: Therefore, a monk should not use shoes made of the five improper things,

original: glang po che cang shes kyi dang rta cang shes kyi dang seng ge'i dang stag gi dang gung gi'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po che cang shes kyi dang rta cang shes kyi dang seng ge'i dang stag gi dang gung gi'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: namely, the skin of an elephant, a horse, a lion, a tiger, or a leopard.

original: mchil lham dag brdab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchil lham dag brdab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not beat his shoes.

original: rdul la sogs pa sprug pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa la brdab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rdul la sogs pa sprug pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa la brdab par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not beat them on the ground, etc. in order to shake off dust, etc.

original: ras ma gsher ba dag gis de dag gi rdul med par bya ba'i phyir phyi bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ras ma gsher ba dag gis de dag gi rdul med par bya ba'i phyir phyi bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should wipe them with damp cloth in order to remove the dust.

original: mchil lham de dag gi rdul med par bya ba'i phyir ras ma chus gsher bar byas pa dag gis phyi bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchil lham de dag gi rdul med par bya ba'i phyir ras ma chus gsher bar byas pa dag gis phyi bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should wipe the sandals with damp cloth in order to remove the dust.

original: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽phyi ba'i ras ma de'o //🔽de dag brgyu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni / phyi ba'i ras ma de'o // de dag brgyu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should carry them.🔽One should carry the cloth for wiping the sandals.🔽One should string them.

original: mchil lham de dag go //
analyzed: mchil lham de dag go //
translated: One should string the sandals.

original: mi mdzes pa'i dngos po dben pa'i phyogs su bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi mdzes pa'i dngos po dben pa'i phyogs su bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should do the unattractive things in a secluded place.

original: mchil lham brgyus pa dang ltung bzed glan pa la sogs pa mi mdzes pa'i dngos po thams cad dben pa'i phyogs su las bya ba'o//
analyzed: mchil lham brgyus pa dang ltung bzed glan pa la sogs pa mi mdzes pa'i dngos po thams cad dben pa'i phyogs su las bya ba'o//
translated: One should do all unattractive things, such as stringing the sandals and washing the begging-bowl, in a secluded place.

original: de'i ched du bsnyung bu dag ko ba bcang bar bya ste nga gri ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i ched du bsnyung bu dag ko ba bcang bar bya ste nga gri ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For that purpose, one should carry a knife and a piece of leather, but not a sword.

original: mchil lham de brgyu ba'i don du bsnyung bu dang ko ba bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchil lham de brgyu ba'i don du bsnyung bu dang ko ba bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should carry a knife and a piece of leather for the purpose of stringing the sandals.

original: dra gri ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dra gri ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The knife is not the net.

original: ko ba dra ba'i gri chen po ni rkyen ma yin pas gzhan gyis mthong bar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa spang pa'i phyir bkag go //
analyzed: ko ba dra ba'i gri chen po ni rkyen ma yin pas gzhan gyis mthong bar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa spang pa'i phyir bkag go //
translated: The leather net is not a condition, so it is prohibited in order to avoid the fault of being seen by others.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bsnyung bu dang ko ba bcang pa rang zhing dra gri ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bsnyung bu dang ko ba bcang pa rang zhing dra gri ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “The needle case and leather are light, but the knife is not.”

original: khyim gzhan dang chab kung sa las gzhan par shing gi mchil lham bgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim gzhan dang chab kung sa las gzhan par shing gi mchil lham bgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not wear wooden shoes except in the house, on the road, or in the field.

original: de gnyis ma gtogs pa'i gnas gzhan du bgo bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ma gtogs pa'i gnas gzhan du bgo bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not wear them in places other than those two.

original: smyug ma'i glegs bu dang mun dza dang si ri dang dar bha dag gi yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: smyug ma'i glegs bu dang mun dza dang si ri dang dar bha dag gi yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang /
translated: One should not make them from bamboo, muñja grass, sirigāla, or darbha grass.

original: mchil lham bgo bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchil lham bgo bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not wear shoes.

original: thag gu'i yang ngo zhes bya ba yang mchil lham bgo bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: thag gu'i yang ngo zhes bya ba yang mchil lham bgo bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not wear shoes made of string.

original: rlung khrag can ma yin pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rlung khrag can ma yin pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is not windy blood.

original: gang zag rlung khrag can ma yin pas thag gu'i mchil lham bgo bar mi bya'o //🔽rlung khrag can @210a * //
analyzed: gang zag rlung khrag can ma yin pas thag gu'i mchil lham bgo bar mi bya'o // rlung khrag can @210a * //
translated: One who is not a person with wind or blood disorders should not wear a leather belt.

original: gyi nad pas ni mi 'drul bar bya ba'i phyir thag gu'i mchil lham bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gyi nad pas ni mi 'drul bar bya ba'i phyir thag gu'i mchil lham bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: One who has a wind or blood disorder should wear a leather belt in order to prevent it from becoming loose.

original: khyim gzhan med na ko lpags la 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim gzhan med na ko lpags la 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is no other house, one should sit on a leather mat.

original: khyim pa'i khyim gzhan du stan gzhan med na ko lpags kyi steng du 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i khyim gzhan du stan gzhan med na ko lpags kyi steng du 'dug par bya'o //
translated: If there is no other seat in the house of a layperson, one should sit on a leather mat.

original: der yang rkyen de lta bu dag med na nyal bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der yang rkyen de lta bu dag med na nyal bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there are no such conditions there, one should not lie down.

original: khyim gzhan der yang khri la sogs pa'i ma la cha gzhan mi 'byor ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag med na ko lpags de'i steng du nyal bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyim gzhan der yang khri la sogs pa'i ma la cha gzhan mi 'byor ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag med na ko lpags de'i steng du nyal bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there are no such conditions there, such as the unavailability of other seats like a bed, one should not lie down on that leather mat.

original: ko lpags kyi thags ma yang ko lpags ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ko lpags kyi thags ma yang ko lpags ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: A leather mat is not not leather.

original: ko lpags khon yin pas de'i phyir ko lpags kyis brgyus pa'i khri dang khri rul sogs pa la yang 'dug par mi bya'o //🔽mig la phan par bya ba'i phyir dom lpags bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ko lpags khon yin pas de'i phyir ko lpags kyis brgyus pa'i khri dang khri rul sogs pa la yang 'dug par mi bya'o // mig la phan par bya ba'i phyir dom lpags bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since he wears leather, he should not sit on a couch or a chair that is bound with leather.🔽He should carry a bear skin for the sake of his eyes.

original: mig la phan par bya ba'i phyir dom lpags bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig la phan par bya ba'i phyir dom lpags bcang bar bya'o //
translated: He should carry a bear skin for the sake of his eyes.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dom lpags blang bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dom lpags blang bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here reads: “The carrying of a bear skin is permitted.”

original: rkang pa'i gnas su gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkang pa'i gnas su gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should spread it out under his feet.

original: dom lpags blangs pa de stan dang rkang pa'i 'og dang lham gyi nang la sogs par gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dom lpags blangs pa de stan dang rkang pa'i 'og dang lham gyi nang la sogs par gzhug par bya'o //
translated: He should put the carried bear skin under his seat, under his feet, in his shoes, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni dri gtsang khang gi sgor ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni dri gtsang khang gi sgor ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Buddha’s is at the door of the fragrant chamber.

original: sangs rgyas mnga' ba'i dom lpags ni dri gtsang khang gi sgor gding bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mnga' ba'i dom lpags ni dri gtsang khang gi sgor gding bar bya ba'o //
translated: The bear skin of the Buddha should be spread out at the door of the fragrant chamber.

original: mchil lham dag tu bgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchil lham dag tu bgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should put it in his shoes.

original: mig la phan par bya ba'i phyir dom lpags de'o //🔽rlung nad can gyis ni 'dug pa dang nyal bar yang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mig la phan par bya ba'i phyir dom lpags de'o // rlung nad can gyis ni 'dug pa dang nyal bar yang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The bear skin is for the sake of benefiting the eyes.🔽One who has a wind disease should also sit and lie down on it.

original: gang zag rlung nad can gyis ni dom lpags de'i steng du 'dug pa dang nyal bar yang bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag rlung nad can gyis ni dom lpags de'i steng du 'dug pa dang nyal bar yang bya ba'o //
translated: One who has a wind disease should also sit and lie down on that bear skin.

original: gzhang 'brum can thams cad kyis kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhang 'brum can thams cad kyis kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All who have hemorrhoids should do the same.

original: gzhang 'brum gyi nad can thams cad kyis kyang ngom lpags de sngar bstan pa bzhin du rkang pa'i gnas su gding ba dang mchil lham dag tu bgo ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: gzhang 'brum gyi nad can thams cad kyis kyang ngom lpags de sngar bstan pa bzhin du rkang pa'i gnas su gding ba dang mchil lham dag tu bgo ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal bar yang bya'o //
translated: All who have the disease of hemorrhoids should spread that bear skin on the place where they walk, wear it as shoes, and sit and lie down on it, as previously explained.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gzhang 'brum na bas ngom lpags kyi mchil lham dag bcang bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gzhang 'brum na bas ngom lpags kyi mchil lham dag bcang bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here states, “Therefore, I allow monks who have the disease of hemorrhoids to wear bear-skin shoes.”

original: de'i rjes su 'brang bas rkang pa'i gnas su gding ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal bar rigs te phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang bas rkang pa'i gnas su gding ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal bar rigs te phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is used in that way, it is suitable to spread it on the feet, to sit on it, and to lie down on it, because it is beneficial.

original: de la de ltar sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la de ltar sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should apply it in that way to that means

original: dom lpags de la rnam pa de ltar nan tan du sbyar bar bya'o //🔽spu la reg pas phan par byed pa nyid du rig go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dom lpags de la rnam pa de ltar nan tan du sbyar bar bya'o // spu la reg pas phan par byed pa nyid du rig go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: one should apply the bear skin in that way.🔽One should know that touching the hair is beneficial means

original: dom lpags @210b kyi spu la reg pas phan par byed pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: dom lpags @210b kyi spu la reg pas phan par byed pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: one should know that touching the hair of the bear skin is beneficial.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag dom lpags kyi spu dag 'og tu ston par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag dom lpags kyi spu dag 'og tu ston par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here the text is that the monks spread out the bear skin hair side down, and the Blessed One said:

original: spu dag gyen du bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: spu dag gyen du bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The hair should be turned up.🔽One should know that even many layers of shoes are beneficial means

original: mchil lham dag rim pa mang po nyid kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang pan pa byed pa nyid du rig go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mchil lham dag rim pa mang po nyid kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang pan pa byed pa nyid du rig go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: one should know that even many layers of shoes are beneficial.

original: dom lpags chig rim pa yang phan pa byed pa nyid yin pas rim pa mang po nyid ces smos pa ni mchog tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dom lpags chig rim pa yang phan pa byed pa nyid yin pas rim pa mang po nyid ces smos pa ni mchog tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since a single layer of bear skin also serves to keep warm, the plural particle in the expression “many layers” is used to indicate the best.

original: du ma'i steng du gzhag pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: du ma'i steng du gzhag pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also understood that many layers are placed on top of other skins.

original: ko lpags gzhan rim pa du ma'i steng du dom lpags rim pa gcig gzhag pas kyang phan pa byed pa nyid du rig go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ko lpags gzhan rim pa du ma'i steng du dom lpags rim pa gcig gzhag pas kyang phan pa byed pa nyid du rig go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: It is understood that a single layer of bear skin placed on top of many layers of other skins also serves to keep warm.

original: gal te rim pa mang po nyid mi 'byor na /
analyzed: gal te rim pa mang po nyid mi 'byor na /
translated: If many layers are not available,

original: de'i tshe rim pa gzhan dag gi steng du rim pa gcig kho na la bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rim pa gzhan dag gi steng du rim pa gcig kho na la bsten par bya'o //
translated: then one should rely on a single layer on top of other layers.🔽Here, the text states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni rim pa mang po dag rnyed pa med nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rim pa mang po dag rnyed pa med nas /
translated: “Since many layers were not available,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Bhagavān said,

original: steng du gcig rim gzhug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: steng du gcig rim gzhug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‘Place one on top.’”

original: aa shma pa ran ta dag tu ni ko lpags mi bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: aa shma pa ran ta dag tu ni ko lpags mi bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Bear skin should not be discarded in the aśvapatī region.”

original: yul aashma pa ran ta dag tu ni ko lpags ci dga' mgur bcad du gnang bas /
analyzed: yul aashma pa ran ta dag tu ni ko lpags ci dga' mgur bcad du gnang bas /
translated: In the country of Aśmaparanta, the monks were permitted to cut up the skins as they wished.

original: de la gzhan pa bkag pa 'di dag gsungs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la gzhan pa bkag pa 'di dag gsungs par sbyar ro //
translated: The Buddha prohibited the other practices.

original: 'dir gzhung ni be'u gsod pa'i gleng gzhi las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni be'u gsod pa'i gleng gzhi las /
translated: Here the treatise declares:

original: de lta bas na dge slong gis ko lpags bcang bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gis ko lpags bcang bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Therefore, monks should not use skins.”

original: seng ge la sogs pa'i mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: seng ge la sogs pa'i mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: “One should not use lion skins, etc.”

original: ko lpags zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ko lpags zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The word “skins” is supplied.

original: seng ge dang stag la sogs pa nas glang po che phal pa la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa'i par dag gi ko lpags nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //🔽gang gi ko lpags mi rung ba nyid yin pa de'i rgyus pa dang rus pa dang so dang sha la sogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: seng ge dang stag la sogs pa nas glang po che phal pa la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa'i par dag gi ko lpags nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o // gang gi ko lpags mi rung ba nyid yin pa de'i rgyus pa dang rus pa dang so dang sha la sogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: One should not use skins of lions, tigers, etc., up to the skins of ordinary elephants.🔽“The bones, teeth, and flesh of those whose skins are prohibited are also prohibited.”

original: srog chags gang gi ko lpags mi rung ba de'i rgyus pa la sogs pa yang mi rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: srog chags gang gi ko lpags mi rung ba de'i rgyus pa la sogs pa yang mi rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: The bones, etc., of those whose skins are prohibited are also prohibited.

original: rkyal pa bska ba bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkyal pa bska ba bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should carry a water strainer.

original: chu la rkyal pas rkyal pa bska bas zhen par byas pa bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu la rkyal pas rkyal pa bska bas zhen par byas pa bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One should carry a water strainer made of wood, in order to strain the water.

original: yang na rkyal skya'o zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: yang na rkyal skya'o zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Or, a water strainer is a water filter.
