original: chus ma btab pa nyid la sogs pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: chus ma btab pa nyid la sogs pa'i tshe'o //
translated: at the time of not watering and so on.

original: de'i tshe bcos pa'i tshva la sogs pa de dag la bsnyen par rdzogs pa mtshan mthun pas reg tu mi rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcos pa'i tshva la sogs pa de dag la bsnyen par rdzogs pa mtshan mthun pas reg tu mi rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: At that time, it is not suitable for those who are fully ordained to touch those who are in the process of being made, such as a substitute for a monk.

original: 'di ltar reg pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar reg pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, there are two types of contact:

original: byin len byas pa sngon du btang ba dang / byin len byas pa sngon du ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: byin len byas pa sngon du btang ba dang / byin len byas pa sngon du ma btang ba'o //
translated: that preceded by the ritual of receiving and that not preceded by the ritual of receiving.

original: de la byin len byas pa sngon du ma btang ba la reg pa la ni lag nyar blangs pa'i nyes pas gos par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de la byin len byas pa sngon du ma btang ba la reg pa la ni lag nyar blangs pa'i nyes pas gos par 'gyur bas /
translated: As for contact that is not preceded by the ritual of receiving, one is defiled by the fault of holding it in one's hand.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ni byin len byas pa sngon du btang ba'i reg pa 'gog par byang do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ni byin len byas pa sngon du btang ba'i reg pa 'gog par byang do //
translated: Therefore, here contact that is preceded by the ritual of receiving is prohibited.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: btung ba ji srid du chus ma btab cing chags kyis ma btsags pa btung du rung bar ma gyur cing /
analyzed: btung ba ji srid du chus ma btab cing chags kyis ma btsags pa btung du rung bar ma gyur cing /
translated: Until the water is poured out, the water is not fit to drink and the water is not fit to be drunk until the water is poured out.

original: sham thang bye bar ma gyur pa de srid du bsnyen par rdzogs pa mtshan mthun pas sngar byin len mi bya'o //
analyzed: sham thang bye bar ma gyur pa de srid du bsnyen par rdzogs pa mtshan mthun pas sngar byin len mi bya'o //
translated: Until the water is poured out, the water is not fit to drink and the water is not fit to be drunk until the water is poured out.

original: aa ru ra la sogs pa lnga yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: aa ru ra la sogs pa lnga yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The five, myrobalan and so on, are also.

original: aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra dang / na le sham dang / pi pi ling zhes bya ba lnga po dag kyang thams cad du rung ba ste /
analyzed: aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra dang / na le sham dang / pi pi ling zhes bya ba lnga po dag kyang thams cad du rung ba ste /
translated: The five, myrobalan, sour fruit, black plum, long pepper and white piper, are also suitable for all times.

original: dang po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po nyid ma yin no //
translated: But they are not the first.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /🔽'bras bu lnga ni dus sam dus ma yin par yang na ba'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las / 'bras bu lnga ni dus sam dus ma yin par yang na ba'am /
translated: Here the text of the Ksudraka Collection states:

original: min pas kyang bza' bar bya ba dag yin te /
analyzed: min pas kyang bza' bar bya ba dag yin te /
translated: The five fruits are to be eaten at the proper time or the improper time, whether one is sick or not.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra dang / na le sham dang / pi pi ling ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra dang / na le sham dang / pi pi ling ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Myrobalan, sour fruit, black plum, long pepper and white piper.

original: bu ram yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bu ram yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also molasses.

original: bu ram byin gyis ma brlabs pa yang thams cad du rung ba ste /
analyzed: bu ram byin gyis ma brlabs pa yang thams cad du rung ba ste /
translated: Also, unblessed molasses is suitable in all cases.

original: dang po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po nyid ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the first.

original: de byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba la lam du zhugs pa dang dge skos dang lag gi bla rnams ni nad pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba la lam du zhugs pa dang dge skos dang lag gi bla rnams ni nad pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Blessed molasses is like medicine for those on a journey, for the assigner of meals, and for the attendant.

original: bu ram de zhag bdun pa la sogs par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba la ji ltar nad pas dus dang dus ma yin pa thams cad du bzar rung ba de bzhin du lam du zhugs pa dang dge skos dang lag gi bla dag gis kyang bzar rung
analyzed: bu ram de zhag bdun pa la sogs par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba la ji ltar nad pas dus dang dus ma yin pa thams cad du bzar rung ba de bzhin du lam du zhugs pa dang dge skos dang lag gi bla dag gis kyang bzar rung
translated: Just as a sick person can eat blessed molasses for seven days and so on, at any time, whether it is the proper time or not, so too those on a journey, the assigner of meals and the attendant can eat it.

original: ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: zan chad pas kyang de dang dus su rung ba ma yin par bzar rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zan chad pas kyang de dang dus su rung ba ma yin par bzar rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, it is suitable to eat when fasting, but not at the proper time.

original: dge slong zan chad pas kyang bu ram byin gyis brlabs pa de yang nad pa dang 'dra ba nyid du bzar rung la /
analyzed: dge slong zan chad pas kyang bu ram byin gyis brlabs pa de yang nad pa dang 'dra ba nyid du bzar rung la /
translated: Also, a monk who is fasting can eat blessed molasses, just like a sick person.

original: gzhan yang dus su rung ba mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa yang dus ma yin par bzar rung zhing zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba thams cad @213a * //🔽kyang bzang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dus su rung ba mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa yang dus ma yin par bzar rung zhing zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba thams cad @213a * // kyang bzang rung ba'o //
translated: Also, what is suitable for a time, such as ghee and oil, is suitable for a time not suitable for eating, and all that is to be kept for seven days and for life are suitable for eating.

original: bu ram dang 'dra bar sbrang rtsi yang dus ma yin par yang bzang rung ste /
analyzed: bu ram dang 'dra bar sbrang rtsi yang dus ma yin par yang bzang rung ste /
translated: Honey is also suitable for eating at a time not suitable for eating, like molasses.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis spre'u las sbrang rtsi bzhes zhing rung bar byas so snyam du dgongs pa'i khyer te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis spre'u las sbrang rtsi bzhes zhing rung bar byas so snyam du dgongs pa'i khyer te /
translated: The Blessed One accepted honey from a monkey and made it suitable for eating, thinking that it was suitable for eating.

original: des na btung ba dang 'dra bar phyed yol phan chad kyang sbrang rtsi rung bar bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: des na btung ba dang 'dra bar phyed yol phan chad kyang sbrang rtsi rung bar bya bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is suitable to make honey suitable for eating after noon, like a drink.

original: da ni rnam pa bzhi po dag brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rnam pa bzhi po dag brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the four types should be mentioned.

original: de la dus su rung ba zhes bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba thams cad dus su bzar rung ba nyid yin pas logs shig tu mi brjod de bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dus su rung ba zhes bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba thams cad dus su bzar rung ba nyid yin pas logs shig tu mi brjod de bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is called suitable for a time is all that is to be eaten, which is suitable for eating at a time. It is not mentioned separately because there is no distinction.

original: thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag brjod par bya ste /
translated: The proper time, the seven day period, and the life-long should be mentioned.

original: de'i phyir thun tshod du rung ba ni btung ba dag go zhes bya ba smras te /🔽'dir thun tshod du rung ba nad pas byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i gzhung ni khyim ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir thun tshod du rung ba ni btung ba dag go zhes bya ba smras te / 'dir thun tshod du rung ba nad pas byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i gzhung ni khyim ba'am /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “The proper time is for drinks.”🔽Here, the proper time is the text for the consecration of the sick.

original: dge tshul gyis sbyar ba tshags kyis btsags pa dag ni thun tshod du rung ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge tshul gyis sbyar ba tshags kyis btsags pa dag ni thun tshod du rung ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The proper time is for drinks prepared by a householder or novice monk, and strained with a cloth.🔽The text for the proper time is all drinks not consecrated.

original: thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba byin gyis ma brlabs pa thams cad la rung ba'i gzhung ni 'bras bu brgyad po khyim pa'am /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba byin gyis ma brlabs pa thams cad la rung ba'i gzhung ni 'bras bu brgyad po khyim pa'am /
translated: The text for the proper time is the eight fruits prepared by a householder or novice monk, and strained with a cloth.

original: dge tshul gyis sbyar ba tshags kyis btsags pa 'di dag ni dus sam dus ma yin par yang na ba'am na bam yin pas kyang btung bar bya ba dag yin te /
analyzed: dge tshul gyis sbyar ba tshags kyis btsags pa 'di dag ni dus sam dus ma yin par yang na ba'am na bam yin pas kyang btung bar bya ba dag yin te /
translated: These are to be drunk at the proper time or at the improper time, whether one is sick or not sick.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should not regret this.

original: shin tu sla ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu sla ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Very easy means:

original: thun tshod du rung ba ni btung ba dag go zhes smos pa de'i ska ba nyid stsal to //
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba ni btung ba dag go zhes smos pa de'i ska ba nyid stsal to //
translated: That which is suitable for a period of time is drink. The suitability of that is stated.

original: de'i rdzas de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir gal te dus su rung ba yin na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas sbyar zhing tshags kyis kyang btsag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i rdzas de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir gal te dus su rung ba yin na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas sbyar zhing tshags kyis kyang btsag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is suitable for a period of time, but not the same substance, then it should be prepared by one not fully ordained, and also filtered by a strainer.

original: de'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni btung ba de'i rdzas so //
analyzed: de'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni btung ba de'i rdzas so //
translated: Here, that substance means the substance of that drink.

original: de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni btung ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni btung ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the same, means because it is not drink.

original: gal te dus su rung ba yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dus su rung ba yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is suitable for a period of time, means:

original: rdzas gang las btung bar bya ba'i rdzas de gal te dus su rung ba yin na ste /
analyzed: rdzas gang las btung bar bya ba'i rdzas de gal te dus su rung ba yin na ste /
translated: if the substance from which one drinks is suitable for a period of time,

original: de'i tshe rdzas de bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas bskol ba la sogs pa sbyar zhing tshags kyis kyang btsag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rdzas de bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas bskol ba la sogs pa sbyar zhing tshags kyis kyang btsag par bya'o //
translated: then at that time, that substance should be prepared by one not fully ordained, and also filtered by a strainer.

original: dus ma yin par rung ba nyid yin na ni bsnyen par rdzogs pas sbyar zhing btsags pa la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dus ma yin par rung ba nyid yin na ni bsnyen par rdzogs pas sbyar zhing btsags pa la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is suitable at an improper time, there is no offense in using it after mixing it with the nectar of full ordination.

original: de dag tu gzhan bal po se'u dang ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag tu gzhan bal po se'u dang ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In those, substances such as pomegranate and madhuka are other.

original: thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba de dag tu tso tsha la sogs pa'i btung ba dag las gzhan pa /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba de dag tu tso tsha la sogs pa'i btung ba dag las gzhan pa /
translated: In those, substances such as pomegranate and madhuka are other than the drinks suitable for one day.

original: bal po se'u @213b dang ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas dag gis sbyor bar byed na 'di ltar der bal po se'u dang ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi zas nyid kyis khyab par byed du zin kyang nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bal po se'u @213b dang ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas dag gis sbyor bar byed na 'di ltar der bal po se'u dang ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi zas nyid kyis khyab par byed du zin kyang nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: If one mixes them with drinks such as sugarcane juice, then even though the substances of pomegranate and madhuka are pervaded by food there, there is no offense.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The term etc. should be understood to include those that pervade for the purpose of food such as roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: tso tsa la sogs pa'i btung ba dag las gzhan pa'i btung ba bal po se'u dang ma du lung ga la sogs pas sbyor bar byed na /
analyzed: tso tsa la sogs pa'i btung ba dag las gzhan pa'i btung ba bal po se'u dang ma du lung ga la sogs pas sbyor bar byed na /
translated: If one mixes other beverages such as citron with beverages such as grape juice,

original: 'di ltar der bal po se'u dang ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi zas nyid kyis khyab par byed du zin kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar der bal po se'u dang ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi zas nyid kyis khyab par byed du zin kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: then even though the substance of the food such as grapes and raisins pervades it, there is no fault.🔽Here the text states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gis bu ram zos pa dang / de dag la skom pa'i gnod pa byung nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gis bu ram zos pa dang / de dag la skom pa'i gnod pa byung nas /
translated: Monks ate molasses and they were harmed by thirst.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: bu ram chu byas te btung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bu ram chu byas te btung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “You should drink molasses mixed with water.”

original: de dus su rung ba nyid yin na thun tshod kyi mtha' mtha' yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dus su rung ba nyid yin na thun tshod kyi mtha' mtha' yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is suitable at that time, it is the end of the period.

original: btung ba'i rdzas de rgun chu la sogs pa dus su rung ba nyid yin na mtshan mo'i thun tshod kyi cha'i tshad kyi mtha' gang yin pa de btung ba de btung ba'i mtha' yang yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: btung ba'i rdzas de rgun chu la sogs pa dus su rung ba nyid yin na mtshan mo'i thun tshod kyi cha'i tshad kyi mtha' gang yin pa de btung ba de btung ba'i mtha' yang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If that drink is suitable at the proper time, such as grape juice, then the limit of that drink should be understood as the limit of the period of time.

original: gzhan nyid yin na de'i gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na de'i gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is different, then it is that.

original: btung pa'i rdzas de la dus su rung ba las gzhan pa dus ma yin par rung ba nyid yin na rdzas de bza' ba'i dus kyi mtha' zhag bdun pa'am 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba'i mtha' gang yin pa de nyid btung ba de'i mtha' yang yin pa ste
analyzed: btung pa'i rdzas de la dus su rung ba las gzhan pa dus ma yin par rung ba nyid yin na rdzas de bza' ba'i dus kyi mtha' zhag bdun pa'am 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba'i mtha' gang yin pa de nyid btung ba de'i mtha' yang yin pa ste
translated: If that drink is suitable at the improper time, different from suitable at the proper time, then the limit of that substance is the limit of that drink, whether it is the limit of the period of seven days for food or the limit of keeping it as long as one lives.

original: / thun tshod kyi mtha' dang lhan cig 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: / thun tshod kyi mtha' dang lhan cig 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction with the limit of the period of time.

original: gang gi phyir zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho'i bar bcang ba'i rdzas thun chod kyi mtha' las thal bar bzar rung ba nyid yin na dus thams cad du nyes pa med pa'i phyir nam yang bzar mi rung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir dus su rung ba
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho'i bar bcang ba'i rdzas thun chod kyi mtha' las thal bar bzar rung ba nyid yin na dus thams cad du nyes pa med pa'i phyir nam yang bzar mi rung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir dus su rung ba
translated: Therefore, it is not unsuitable to eat at any time.

original: ma yin pa'i rdzas las byas pa'i btung ba de btung ba nyid kyi phyir ni dus thams cad pa nyid yin par shes par bya zhing byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ni thun tshod du rung ba nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i rdzas las byas pa'i btung ba de btung ba nyid kyi phyir ni dus thams cad pa nyid yin par shes par bya zhing byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ni thun tshod du rung ba nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Because it is drunk, it is known to be suitable at all times. Because it is consecrated, it is known to be suitable for the period.

original: da ni 'dir lugs gzhan dgag par bya bar 'dod nas gzhan gyi lugs bstan pa'i phyir kha cig na re ma gyur na de yin gyi gyur na gang tshun chad de yin pa'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /🔽'dir 'dul ba 'dzin pa @214a * //
analyzed: da ni 'dir lugs gzhan dgag par bya bar 'dod nas gzhan gyi lugs bstan pa'i phyir kha cig na re ma gyur na de yin gyi gyur na gang tshun chad de yin pa'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te / 'dir 'dul ba 'dzin pa @214a * //
translated: Now, in order to refute another system here, wishing to teach another system, he says, “Some say: If it has not changed, it is that. If it has changed, it is that up to the point it has not changed.”🔽Here, some

original: kha cig na re 'di la gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di la gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: vinaya masters say: “Here, that which is called ‘changed’🔽means

original: btung ba bzhin snang ba nyid kyis mtshan nyid shin tu sla ba dang / myos par mi 'gyur ba nyid las gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: btung ba bzhin snang ba nyid kyis mtshan nyid shin tu sla ba dang / myos par mi 'gyur ba nyid las gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is very easy to understand that it is like a drink, and it is called “other than that which is intoxicating” because it is not intoxicating.

original: myos par 'gyur bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: myos par 'gyur bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called “that which becomes intoxicating.”🔽Therefore, in the sutra, it is said that if it is other, then it is the end of the substance that is drunk, and that is also the end of that drink.

original: des na sngar mdo las gzhan nyid yin na de'i gang yin pa'o zhas smos pas btung pa'i rdzas kyi mtha' gang yin pa de nyid btung ba de'i mtha' yang yin no zhes gang bstan bde gcig tu nges par rnam par gnas pa ma yin par shes par bya
analyzed: des na sngar mdo las gzhan nyid yin na de'i gang yin pa'o zhas smos pas btung pa'i rdzas kyi mtha' gang yin pa de nyid btung ba de'i mtha' yang yin no zhes gang bstan bde gcig tu nges par rnam par gnas pa ma yin par shes par bya
translated: It is taught that it is not definitely established as one thing, but should be understood as🔽not being definitely established as another.

original: ste / 'di ltar ngo bo nyid ma gyur na di btung ba'i mtha' yin gyi /
analyzed: ste / 'di ltar ngo bo nyid ma gyur na di btung ba'i mtha' yin gyi /
translated: If the nature does not change, it is the end of the drink.

original: gyur pa skad cig gang tshun chad kyi 'og tu ngo bo nyid de gyur pa'i skad cig de nyid btung ba'i mtha' yin par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gyur pa skad cig gang tshun chad kyi 'og tu ngo bo nyid de gyur pa'i skad cig de nyid btung ba'i mtha' yin par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: If it changes, it should be understood that the nature that changes in the moment after is the end of the drink.

original: de ni ma yin te dus lhag pa la brten na mi 'chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang de 'byung bar 'gyur ba phal pa rnams kyi bgrod pa ma yin pa'i phyir byin gyis brla bas par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba🔽ni / gyur na gang tshun chad de yin pa'o zhes zer ba de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te dus lhag pa la brten na mi 'chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang de 'byung bar 'gyur ba phal pa rnams kyi bgrod pa ma yin pa'i phyir byin gyis brla bas par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni / gyur na gang tshun chad de yin pa'o zhes zer ba de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because if one relies on a remainder of the day, it would not be relinquished and because it would not be a consecration that is not traversed by ordinary beings.

original: dus lhag pa la brten na mi 'chags par 'gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus lhag pa la brten na mi 'chags par 'gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is not so, because if one relies on a remainder of the day, it would not be relinquished.

original: gang nas btung bar gyur par 'gyur ba de las lhag par dus la byin gyis brlabs pa brten na byin gyis brlab pa de mi 'chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang nas btung bar gyur par 'gyur ba de las lhag par dus la byin gyis brlabs pa brten na byin gyis brlab pa de mi 'chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one relies on a consecration that is more than the time from which one should drink, that consecration would not be relinquished.

original: 'di ltar byin gyis brlab pa ni re zhig bza' ba'i phyir yin pas bzar rung ba nyid yin na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byin gyis brlab pa ni re zhig bza' ba'i phyir yin pas bzar rung ba nyid yin na yin no //
translated: Consecration is for the purpose of eating, so if it is suitable to eat, it is suitable to consecrate.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe bzar rung ba nyid rnam par log pa de'i tshe byin gyis brlabs kyang rnam par ldog par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe bzar rung ba nyid rnam par log pa de'i tshe byin gyis brlabs kyang rnam par ldog par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, when the state of being suitable to drink is reversed, would not the consecration also be reversed?

original: des na skad cig gang tshun chad kyi 'og tu btung ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur par 'gyur ba'i skad cig de las gzhan pa'i dus lhag ma de la ni byin gyis brlab par rjes su ma gnang bas /
analyzed: des na skad cig gang tshun chad kyi 'og tu btung ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur par 'gyur ba'i skad cig de las gzhan pa'i dus lhag ma de la ni byin gyis brlab par rjes su ma gnang bas /
translated: Thus, since the time of the consecration is not permitted for the remaining time other than the moment when it becomes the entity of a drink,

original: des na 'dir dus de tsam zhig tu 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na 'dir dus de tsam zhig tu 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is for that reason that it becomes that for only that much time.

original: gal te 'di snyam du dus gang la btung ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur par 'gyur pa'i dus de tsam tshun chad la byin gyis brlabs pa rten par byed pas des na nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du dus gang la btung ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur par 'gyur pa'i dus de tsam tshun chad la byin gyis brlabs pa rten par byed pas des na nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na de'i phyir /
translated: But if you think that the consecration is maintained for only that much time as the time when it becomes the entity of a drink, and that for that reason this fault does not arise, then to respond to that, it is said,

original: de 'byung bar 'gyur ba phal pa rnams kyi bgrod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de 'byung bar 'gyur ba phal pa rnams kyi bgrod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is not the domain of ordinary beings.

original: gang gi phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po de /🔽phal pa tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi bgrod pa @214b ma yin zhing yul gyi dngos por mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir byin gyis rlob pa'i dus na 'gyur ba'i dus yongs su mi shes pas byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i dus gang yin
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po de / phal pa tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi bgrod pa @214b ma yin zhing yul gyi dngos por mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir byin gyis rlob pa'i dus na 'gyur ba'i dus yongs su mi shes pas byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i dus gang yin
translated: Because that future thing which will arise

original: pa de mi shes so //
analyzed: pa de mi shes so //
translated: is not the object of the domain of ordinary people who see only the near side, it is not an object of the present. Therefore, when the time of consecration is not known, the time of consecration is not known.

original: de mi shes pa'i phyir gdon mi za ba kho nar dus lhag pa la brten par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de mi shes pa'i phyir gdon mi za ba kho nar dus lhag pa la brten par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Because that is not known, one must certainly rely on the remaining time.

original: / des na byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / des na byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be consecrated.

original: 'dir ro dang phye ma dang sbyar ba'i btung bdag 'dus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: 'dir ro dang phye ma dang sbyar ba'i btung bdag 'dus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Here, the combination of the taste, the powder, and the drink is the combination.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni thun tshod du rung ba dag ste /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni thun tshod du rung ba dag ste /
translated: Here means in the proper time.

original: der bu ram shing la sogs pa'i ro dag kyang 'dus pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: der bu ram shing la sogs pa'i ro dag kyang 'dus pa nyid yin la /
translated: There, the tastes of sugarcane and so on are combined.

original: phye ma dang sbyar ba'i btung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phye ma dang sbyar ba'i btung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A drink mixed with flour is

original: phye ma chang gi snod kyi nang du spangs pa la chang gi dris gos par gyur pa dag las btung bar byas pa de yang der 'dus pa nyid yin no /
analyzed: phye ma chang gi snod kyi nang du spangs pa la chang gi dris gos par gyur pa dag las btung bar byas pa de yang der 'dus pa nyid yin no /
translated: a drink mixed with flour that is placed in a vessel containing alcohol and becomes tainted by the smell of alcohol. That is also included in the above.

original: mdo 'di dang mdo 'og ma gnyis ni sngar thun tshod du rung ba ni btung ba dag go zhes smos pa'i mdo de'i spros pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo 'di dang mdo 'og ma gnyis ni sngar thun tshod du rung ba ni btung ba dag go zhes smos pa'i mdo de'i spros pa yin no //
translated: These two sūtras are elaborations of the sūtra that states, “Drinks that are suitable for one period are drinks.”

original: sman rtsa bas shin tu sla ba yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: sman rtsa bas shin tu sla ba yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Also, a drink that is very weak with roots is

original: thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba dag tu 'dus pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba dag tu 'dus pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: also included in drinks that are suitable for one period.🔽What is a drink that is very weak with roots?

original: sman rtsabs zhis bya ba de ji lta bu zhig yin zhen de'i phyir de ni rtsa ba la sogs pa'i sman bkus pa skyur po'i zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sman rtsabs zhis bya ba de ji lta bu zhig yin zhen de'i phyir de ni rtsa ba la sogs pa'i sman bkus pa skyur po'i zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “It is a drink that is sour from the fermentation of medicinal roots and so on.”

original: sman rtsa bas zhes bya ba de ni rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i sman chus spangs shing bkus pa'i khu ba skyur bag can gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sman rtsa bas zhes bya ba de ni rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i sman chus spangs shing bkus pa'i khu ba skyur bag can gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The term medicinal roots should be understood to mean the juice of medicinal roots, stalks, leaves, flowers, and fruits, which has been strained and boiled down to a sour consistency.

original: thun tshod du rung ba bstan nas /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba bstan nas /
translated: Having explained what is suitable for one day,

original: da ni zhag bdun pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni zhag bdun pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the seven-day period should be explained.

original: de'i phyir zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi dbu ba dag ni zhag bdun pa'o zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi dbu ba dag ni zhag bdun pa'o zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: Therefore it is said, Ghee, oil, honey, and molasses are for seven days.

original: bu ram dang hvags dang li khar la sogs pa thams cad ni bu ram gyi dbu ba nyid kyis 'phangs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bu ram dang hvags dang li khar la sogs pa thams cad ni bu ram gyi dbu ba nyid kyis 'phangs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All molasses, sugar cane, and pomegranate, etc. are included in molasses itself.

original: bu ram gyi dbu ba zhes bya ba nyid de dag las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu ram gyi dbu ba zhes bya ba nyid de dag las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said molasses, it is understood that they are included in molasses itself, because they arise from those.

original: khyim bdag glang bu lta bus dge slong zan chad pa rnams kyis dus ma lags par ci zhig 'tshal du rung ba zhes zhus ba na ;
analyzed: khyim bdag glang bu lta bus dge slong zan chad pa rnams kyis dus ma lags par ci zhig 'tshal du rung ba zhes zhus ba na ;
translated: When the householder Vatsa asked, What is suitable to eat at inappropriate times for monks who have run out of food?

original: bu ram dang zhun mar dang hvags dang li khar dang btung ba dag go zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de las ni 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bu ram dang zhun mar dang hvags dang li khar dang btung ba dag go zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de las ni 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: The passage from the sutra that states, “honey, oil, molasses, meat, and drinks” should be understood as follows.

original: de dag las btung ba dag skabs gzhan du thun tshod du rung ba nyid du gsungs pas /🔽lhag ma zhun mar dang bu ram la sogs pa de dag ni zhag bdun @215a * //
analyzed: de dag las btung ba dag skabs gzhan du thun tshod du rung ba nyid du gsungs pas / lhag ma zhun mar dang bu ram la sogs pa de dag ni zhag bdun @215a * //
translated: Since it is stated elsewhere that drinks are permissible for seven days,

original: pa nyid yin par gnas sa //
analyzed: pa nyid yin par gnas sa //
translated: the remaining substances, oil, molasses, and so on, are established as being permissible for seven days.

original: bdud rtsi ni zhun mar dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdud rtsi ni zhun mar dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nectar is similar to oil.

original: bza' bar bya ba nyid dang zhag bdun pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba nyid dang zhag bdun pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: This is because it is something to be eaten and because it is permissible for seven days.

original: bdud rtsi ni zhu na mar dang ngo bo nyid dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsi ni zhu na mar dang ngo bo nyid dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nectar is similar to oil in nature.

original: zhag bskol zhing btsags pa dag ni 'bru mar dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba yang //
analyzed: zhag bskol zhing btsags pa dag ni 'bru mar dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba yang //
translated: The boiled and strained grain water is similar to oil.

original: bza' bar bya ba nyid dang zhag bdun pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba nyid dang zhag bdun pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: This is because it is something to be eaten and because it is permissible for seven days.

original: gang gi tshe zhag dag bskol zhing btsags pa de'i tshe gnas bag med pa na 'bru mar dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhag dag bskol zhing btsags pa de'i tshe gnas bag med pa na 'bru mar dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is boiled and strained for more than one day, it becomes like oil in a careless person’s house.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhag rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni dus ma yin par bskol /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhag rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni dus ma yin par bskol /
translated: Here is the text: “These five types of oil should not be consumed if they are boiled at the wrong time,

original: dus ma yin par btsags /
analyzed: dus ma yin par btsags /
translated: strained at the wrong time,

original: dus ma yin par byin len byas /🔽dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //🔽dus su bskol zhing dus ma yin par btsags dus ma yin par byin len byas dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yang yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin par byin len byas / dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o // dus su bskol zhing dus ma yin par btsags dus ma yin par byin len byas dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yang yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: received at the wrong time,🔽or consecrated at the wrong time.🔽If they are boiled at the right time, but strained, received, or consecrated at the wrong time, they should not be consumed.🔽If they are boiled and strained at the right time, but received or consecrated at the wrong time, they should not be consumed.

original: dus su bskol dus su btsags shing dus ma yin par byin len byas dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yang yongs su longs spyad bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dus su bskol dus su btsags shing dus ma yin par byin len byas dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yang yongs su longs spyad bar mi bya'o //
translated: If they are boiled and strained at the right time, but received at the right time and consecrated at the wrong time, they should not be consumed.”

original: dus su bskol dus su btsags dus su byin len byas shing dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yang yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dus su bskol dus su btsags dus su byin len byas shing dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yang yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: If it is boiled, strained and received in alms-bowl at the proper time, but consecrated at the improper time, it should not be used.

original: dus su bskol dus su btsags dus su byin len byas dus su byin gyis brlabs na 'bru mar nyid du longs spyod pas zhag bdun par yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dus su bskol dus su btsags dus su byin len byas dus su byin gyis brlabs na 'bru mar nyid du longs spyod pas zhag bdun par yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If it is boiled, strained and received in alms-bowl at the proper time, and consecrated at the proper time, it should be used as oil for seven days.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽bskol ba dang btsags pa gnyis ni dus su byas kyang rung /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / bskol ba dang btsags pa gnyis ni dus su byas kyang rung /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: ma byas kyang rung /🔽dus ma yin par byas kyang rung la ;
analyzed: ma byas kyang rung / dus ma yin par byas kyang rung la ;
translated: Both boiling and straining may be done at the proper time or not.

original: byin len byas pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa ni dus kho nar bya dgos te /
analyzed: byin len byas pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa ni dus kho nar bya dgos te /
translated: But consecration and receiving in alms-bowl must be done at the proper time.

original: gang gi phyir dus ma yin par byin len byas pa dang dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs pa yongs su longs spyad par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dus ma yin par byin len byas pa dang dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs pa yongs su longs spyad par mi bya zhing /
translated: Because if consecration and receiving in alms-bowl are done at the improper time, they should not be used.

original: dus su byin len byas pa dang dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs pa yang yongs su longs spyod par mi bya ba de'i phyir byin len dang byin gyis brlabs pa gnyis ni dus kho nar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dus su byin len byas pa dang dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs pa yang yongs su longs spyod par mi bya ba de'i phyir byin len dang byin gyis brlabs pa gnyis ni dus kho nar bya ba yin no //
translated: One should not consume what has been made permissible by the medicine ritual at the wrong time, nor should one consume what has been received at the proper time. Therefore, both the medicine ritual and receiving are to be done only at the proper time.

original: chu btsags pa la ni dus nges pa med do //
analyzed: chu btsags pa la ni dus nges pa med do //
translated: There is no fixed time for straining water.

original: zhag rnam pa lnga zhes gsungs pa de dag ni gang yin /
analyzed: zhag rnam pa lnga zhes gsungs pa de dag ni gang yin /
translated: What are the five types of days?🔽Are they like oil?

original: ci de dag 'bru mar dang 'dra ba nyid yin nam 'on te 'dra ba nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci de dag 'bru mar dang 'dra ba nyid yin nam 'on te 'dra ba nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: Or are they not like oil?

original: de'i phyir @215b nya'i dang ri bong gi dang chu srin byis pa gsod kyi dang dom gyi dang phag gi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir @215b nya'i dang ri bong gi dang chu srin byis pa gsod kyi dang dom gyi dang phag gi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the days of the hare, the tortoise, the crocodile, the bear, and the pig.”

original: de lnga'i zhag ni 'bru mar dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lnga'i zhag ni 'bru mar dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: The days of those five are like oil.

original: de dag ni nad pa la phal cher sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ni nad pa la phal cher sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are mostly used for the sick.

original: zhag rnam pa lnga po sngar bstan pa de dag ni 'jig rten na nad pa la phal cher lan mang du sbyor zhing ldud par byed pas /
analyzed: zhag rnam pa lnga po sngar bstan pa de dag ni 'jig rten na nad pa la phal cher lan mang du sbyor zhing ldud par byed pas /
translated: These five types of medicine are called “medicines” because they are used to treat the sick in the world.

original: de'i phyir zhag rnam pa lnga zhes gsungs kyi 'di la des pa ni med do //🔽sos pa nyid ni de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhag rnam pa lnga zhes gsungs kyi 'di la des pa ni med do // sos pa nyid ni de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But they are not medicines for the sick in the monastic community.

original: nad pa gang gis byin gyis brlabs pa de nyid nad sos pa nyid na zhag rnam pa lnga po de dag gzhan dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin bar bya ba'o ;🔽/ de med na sman khang du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nad pa gang gis byin gyis brlabs pa de nyid nad sos pa nyid na zhag rnam pa lnga po de dag gzhan dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin bar bya ba'o ; / de med na sman khang du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The sick may take them when they are cured” means that when the sick have been consecrated with these medicines, they may give the five types of medicine to others who are sick.

original: slong ba de med na dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: slong ba de med na dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag bar bya ba'o //
translated: “If they are not available, in the infirmary” means that if the sick do not have these medicines, they should be placed in the monastic community’s infirmary.

original: sman khu dang mig sman dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: sman khu dang mig sman dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: “Medicinal powders and eye medicine” means that

original: sos ba nyid na de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no zhes bya ba dang / de med na sman khang du bzhag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu drug pa /
analyzed: sos ba nyid na de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no zhes bya ba dang / de med na sman khang du bzhag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro / // / bam po lnga bcu drug pa /
translated: If they are not cured, they should be placed in the infirmary.

original: zhag bdun pa bstan nas /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the seven-day medicine,

original: da ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the medicine that may be kept for life should be explained.

original: de'i phyir 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba ni rtsa ba dab sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba ni rtsa ba dab sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: Medicine that may be kept for life is the root, stem, leaf, flower, and fruit of plants that are not used as food.

original: gang dag zas gyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa de dag 'tsho ba'i bar du bcad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang dag zas gyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa de dag 'tsho ba'i bar du bcad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those that are not used as food are to be kept for life.

original: de la rtsa ba dag gang zhen 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba dag gang zhen 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the roots? They are:

original: gla sgang dang shu dag dang yung nga dang sge'u gsher dang bod dang dkar po dag go zhes byab smras te /
analyzed: gla sgang dang shu dag dang yung nga dang sge'u gsher dang bod dang dkar po dag go zhes byab smras te /
translated: ginger, black pepper, long pepper, turmeric, white turmeric, and white piper.

original: de dag ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: These are just examples.

original: rtsa ba'i sman zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sman zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //
translated: Other roots are included that are not used for medicine or food.

original: sdong bu dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdong bu dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the stems?

original: tsan dan dang / spyi mo dang / shug pa dang / sle tres dang / thang shing dang / skyer pa dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tsan dan dang / spyi mo dang / shug pa dang / sle tres dang / thang shing dang / skyer pa dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They are sandalwood, spīma, juniper, eggplant, pine, and buckthorn.

analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dper bstan pa'i phyir ro // shing ma zho zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “for example” is used to indicate an illustration.🔽The wood of the Indian beech tree is

analyzed: rgya skyegs las gzhan pa'i shing dag gi shing sa zho ste /
translated: a wood that is astringent, other than lac, and is

analyzed: 'gyur byed kyi sde tshan ston to //
translated: The word “astringent” indicates the astringent class.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste /

translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,🔽“For example, the following are astringents:

analyzed: lan tshva'i sde tshan ston to //
translated: The word “saline” indicates the saline class.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rgyam tsha dang kha ru tsha dang tshad mar dang rgya mtsho'i tsha dang pa tsha'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The five salts are: rock salt, black salt, white borax, sea salt, and black salt.

original: sman khu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sman khu'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: shing aa mra dang / ni ma ba dang / ko sham pa dang / shi ri sha dang / 'dzam bu dag go zhes bya ba smras so //

original: ji tsam gyis chog ba bsten to zhes bya ba ni sman khu'o ;
analyzed: ji tsam gyis chog ba bsten to zhes bya ba ni sman khu'o ;

original: / bkrus nas yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /

original: ji tsam gyis chog pa kho na bsten pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis chog pa kho na bsten pa'o //
translated: As much as is necessary is a medicinal decoction.

original: mi mnye ba la lan cig bkru'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi mnye ba la lan cig bkru'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: gang la reg bas mnye bar me bya ba de ni mi ma nye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang la reg bas mnye bar me bya ba de ni mi ma nye ba zhes bya ste /

original: de la ni lan cig bkrus te nyin gcig la lan cig bkru ba'o //
analyzed: de la ni lan cig bkrus te nyin gcig la lan cig bkru ba'o //
translated: For that, wash once, that is, wash once a day.

analyzed: ngal ba la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir lan du ma bkru ba bkag go //

original: sman khu de ltar bsten no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sman khu de ltar bsten no zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: rnam pa de ltar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /

analyzed: 'di ni skam rdo la sogs bal @216b yang de bzhin no //

analyzed: sman smos pas dug sman ma bsdus pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'dir sman zhes smos pas dug sman yang bsdus par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: dug sman de ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba nyid yin pa'o // nye ba 'khor bu ram shing ni dus su rung ba'o //
translated: That poison is to be kept as long as one lives.🔽Upāli, sugarcane is to be used at the proper time.

original: khu ba ni dus tshod du rung pa'o //
analyzed: khu ba ni dus tshod du rung pa'o //
translated: The juice is to be used at the proper time.

original: bu ram ni zhag bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bu ram ni zhag bdun pa'o //
translated: Sugar is to be used for seven days.

original: bu ram shing dang bu ram gnyis bsregs pa'i thal ba ni 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba'o zhes gsungs pa der /
analyzed: bu ram shing dang bu ram gnyis bsregs pa'i thal ba ni 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba'o zhes gsungs pa der /

original: thal ba 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba nyid du gsungs pas /
analyzed: thal ba 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba nyid du gsungs pas /
translated: and ashes are prescribed for the duration of life.

analyzed: thal ba yang dug sman gyi khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, ashes are included among the medicines for poison.🔽And since it is stated that earth and so on are not used for food, they are included among the medicines for poison.

original: sa la sogs pa zas kyi don du khyab par mi byed pa dag kyang 'tsho ba'i bar du bcad ba nyid du rnam par gnas so zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir gzhung de ni 'dir khungs nyid yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa zas kyi don du khyab par mi byed pa dag kyang 'tsho ba'i bar du bcad ba nyid du rnam par gnas so zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir gzhung de ni 'dir khungs nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, that passage is the source for this topic.

analyzed: nu zhos 'tsho ba'i be'u rnams kyi lce ba dang gcin dag ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: dug sman zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
translated: The word “that” refers to medicines for poison.

analyzed: /'og nas thal ba dang sa zhes 'byung ba dag kyang dug sman zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The words “ashes and earth” that occur below are also called medicines for poison.

original: de dag ni dug la phan no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ni dug la phan no zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: lci ba dang gcin la sogs pa dug sman zhes bya ba ji skad bstan pa de dag ni dug zos pa la phan no //🔽thal ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The tongue, urine, and so on, that are called medicines for poison are beneficial for those who have ingested poison.🔽Ashes are beneficial for poison.

original: thal ba'i sde tshan ston te /
analyzed: thal ba'i sde tshan ston te /
translated: The section on ashes is taught.

original: 'di yang dug sman zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang dug sman zhes bya'o //

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir shing kan tsan dang k'a p'i ta la dang / aa shva da tha dang / au dum b'a ra dang / n+ya gro dha rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir shing kan tsan dang k'a p'i ta la dang / aa shva da tha dang / au dum b'a ra dang / n+ya gro dha rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says, “of the kankana, kapeṭala, aśvattha, udumbara, and nyagrodha trees.”

original: de rnams kyi thal ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi thal ba'o //
translated: It is the ashes of those.

original: de'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “That” refers to

original: thal ba de dug la phan pa'o //
analyzed: thal ba de dug la phan pa'o //
translated: the ashes that are the antidote to poison.

original: sa ni sor bzhi'i 'og gis bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa ni sor bzhi'i 'og gis bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The earth is good up to four fingerbreadths below.”

original: dug la phan pa'i sa ni sar bzhi'i 'og gis bzang ste /
analyzed: dug la phan pa'i sa ni sar bzhi'i 'og gis bzang ste /
translated: The earth that is the antidote to poison is good up to four fingerbreadths below.

original: rlung dang nyi ma la sogs pas ma nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung dang nyi ma la sogs pas ma nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not damaged by wind, sun, and so forth.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag / dug sman zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag / dug sman zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here the text says, “Monks, the so-called antidote to poison

original: lci ba dang gcin dang thal ba dang sa ste /
analyzed: lci ba dang gcin dang thal ba dang sa ste /
translated: is feces, urine, ashes, and earth.

analyzed: de la lci ba ni be'u 'brangs nas ring po ma lon pa'i ma'i nu zhos 'tsho ba gang dag yin pa dag gi ste /
translated: Among those, feces is that of calves that have not long been weaned and are nourished by their mother’s milk.

original: gcin yang de dag nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gcin yang de dag nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and urine is also theirs.

original: de dge bsnyen dad pa can las blang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dge bsnyen dad pa can las blang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should take it from a faithful lay practitioner.

original: dug sman de dge bsnyen dad pa can las blang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: dug sman de dge bsnyen dad pa can las blang bar bya ba ste /
translated: One should take that poison medicine from a faithful lay practitioner.

original: dge bsnyen la dad pa bri yang srid pas des na 'dir dad pa can zhes smos te /🔽dug sman de dag ni rkyen du 'bab pa @217a * //
analyzed: dge bsnyen la dad pa bri yang srid pas des na 'dir dad pa can zhes smos te / dug sman de dag ni rkyen du 'bab pa @217a * //
translated: Since it is possible that faith in the lay practitioner might decline, here it is said that he is faithful.

analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyir gsang ste bya ba yin par rigs pas de'i phyir dge bsnyen dad pa can las blang ba dang byin len yang des bstabs par gsungs so //
translated: Since that poison medicine is not suitable to be taken as a condition, it is proper that it be taken secretly. Therefore, it is said that one should take it from a faithful lay practitioner and that he should also give the vows.

original: 'og nas sha dang nas kyi sbyor ba 'byung ba dag kyang de kho na bzhin du bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og nas sha dang nas kyi sbyor ba 'byung ba dag kyang de kho na bzhin du bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the following preparation of meat and barley should be done in just the same way.

original: des byin len bstabs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des byin len bstabs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should give the vows.

original: dge bsnyen dad pa can des dug sman de'i byin len bstabs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dad pa can des dug sman de'i byin len bstabs par bya ba'o //
translated: That faithful lay practitioner should give the vows of that poison medicine.

original: sha'i bdag nyid kyi sman de yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: sha'i bdag nyid kyi sman de yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: And that medicine which is of the nature of flesh is also that.

original: dge bsnyen dad pa can des byin len bstabs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dad pa can des byin len bstabs par bya ba'o //
translated: That faithful lay man should give it to him.

original: gal te dge bsnyen dad pa can yang med la /
analyzed: gal te dge bsnyen dad pa can yang med la /
translated: If there is no faithful lay man,

original: nad pa yang nad la bar gyur na de'i tshe gzhan las kyang blang ba dang byin len bya ste /
analyzed: nad pa yang nad la bar gyur na de'i tshe gzhan las kyang blang ba dang byin len bya ste /
translated: and the sick monk is in a critical condition, then he should take it from another and give it to him.

original: gso ba'i don ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa'i chog las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gso ba'i don ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa'i chog las rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the rule that says, “Except for the purpose of healing.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong sa ril dug sman sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong sa ril dug sman sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: Here is the text: “Venerable Transcendent Victor, the Transcendent Victor has said, ‘Monks should take medicine.’

original: btsun pa gang gis bstsal bar bgyi /
analyzed: btsun pa gang gis bstsal bar bgyi /
translated: Venerable, who should give it?”

original: nye ba 'khor dge bsnyen dad pa can gyis so //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor dge bsnyen dad pa can gyis so //
translated: “Upāli, a faithful lay man should give it.”

original: btsun pa ci lags de yang byin len bgyid du stsal tam /
analyzed: btsun pa ci lags de yang byin len bgyid du stsal tam /
translated: “Venerable, should he also give it after taking it?”

original: nye ba 'khor de yang byin len byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor de yang byin len byed du gzhug go //
translated: “Upāli, he should also give it after taking it.”

original: btsun pa sus byin len bgyid du stsal /
analyzed: btsun pa sus byin len bgyid du stsal /
translated: “Venerable, who should give it after taking it?”

original: nye ba 'khor dge bsnyen dad pa can gyis so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor dge bsnyen dad pa can gyis so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha said, Upali, a lay vow-holder with faith should do it.

original: thams cad shan pa'i gnas nas blang ngo zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: thams cad shan pa'i gnas nas blang ngo zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: All meat should be taken from the butcher's place means

original: sha rlon pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sha rlon pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: not only fresh meat,

original: sha'i sman thams cad dge bsnyen dad pa can gyis shan pa'i gnas nas blang ba'o //
analyzed: sha'i sman thams cad dge bsnyen dad pa can gyis shan pa'i gnas nas blang ba'o //
translated: but all meat medicines should be taken by a lay vow-holder with faith from the butcher's place.

original: de ni bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is indeed an action means

original: dge bsnyen dad pa can gyis shan pa'i gnas nas sha'i sman blang ba de ni bya ba ma yin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dge bsnyen dad pa can gyis shan pa'i gnas nas sha'i sman blang ba de ni bya ba ma yin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: that taking meat medicine from the butcher's place by a lay vow-holder with faith is not a non-action,

original: bya ba nyid yin te de la bya ba'i cha ma yin par dogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba nyid yin te de la bya ba'i cha ma yin par dogs par mi bya'o //
translated: but is indeed an action, so one should not doubt that it is not a part of the action.

original: gal te dus ma yin par nas las byas pa'i sman dgos pa nyid yin na de'i don du ba lang rgan pa'i lci ba'i nas kyis chog par bya'i gzhan bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dus ma yin par nas las byas pa'i sman dgos pa nyid yin na de'i don du ba lang rgan pa'i lci ba'i nas kyis chog par bya'i gzhan bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is necessary to make medicine from barley at the wrong time, for that purpose barley flour from an old cow's dung is sufficient, but one should not eat anything else.

original: gal te dus ma yin par nas las byas pa'i sman dgos pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te dus ma yin par nas las byas pa'i sman dgos pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it is necessary to make medicine from barley at the wrong time,

original: nas las byas pa'i sman de'i don du ba lang rgan rgon gyi lci ba'i nang nas byung ba'i nas kyis chog par bya'i /

analyzed: gzhan dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /

translated: that which is suitable for a period of time is accompanied by that which is suitable for a day and a night, that which is suitable for a day and a night is accompanied by that which is suitable for seven days, and that which is suitable for seven days is accompanied by that which is suitable for life.

original: de lhag par spyad pa yod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lhag par spyad pa yod do zhes bya ba ni /

original: thun tshod du rung ba'i de la dus su rung ba'i zas de lhag par spyad pa yod pa dang / zhag bdun pa la thun tshod du rung ba'i zas de lhag par spyad pa yod pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba la zhag bdun pa'i zas de lhag par spyad pa yod pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba'i de la dus su rung ba'i zas de lhag par spyad pa yod pa dang / zhag bdun pa la thun tshod du rung ba'i zas de lhag par spyad pa yod pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba la zhag bdun pa'i zas de lhag par spyad pa yod pa nyid yin pa'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir de dang bcas pa la cho ga snga mas 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
