translated: Because there is the consumption of that together with another, therefore one should engage in the latter together with that other by means of the former rite.

original: de dang bcas la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang bcas la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Together with that means

original: dus su rung ba de dang bcas pa'i thun tshod du rung ba dang / thun tshod du rung ba de dang bcas pa'i zhag bdun pa dang / zhag bdun pa de dang bcas pa'i 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba la'o //
analyzed: dus su rung ba de dang bcas pa'i thun tshod du rung ba dang / thun tshod du rung ba de dang bcas pa'i zhag bdun pa dang / zhag bdun pa de dang bcas pa'i 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba la'o //
translated: The medicine that is suitable for a period of time is to be taken with the medicine that is suitable for a day and night, and that is to be taken with the medicine that is suitable for seven days, and that is to be taken with the medicine that is suitable for life.

original: cho ga snga mas 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cho ga snga mas 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is to be taken with the previous rite.

original: thun tshad du rung ba la ni dus su rung ba'i cho gas 'jug par bya zhing dus su bza' bar bya'i /
analyzed: thun tshad du rung ba la ni dus su rung ba'i cho gas 'jug par bya zhing dus su bza' bar bya'i /
translated: The medicine that is suitable for a day and night is to be taken with the rite of the medicine that is suitable for a period of time and is to be taken at the proper time.🔽It is not to be taken at the time of a day and night.

original: thun tshod du bza' bar mi bya ba dang / zhag bdun pa la ni thun tshod du rung ba'i cho gas 'jug par bya zhing /🔽thun tshod du bza' bar bya'i /
analyzed: thun tshod du bza' bar mi bya ba dang / zhag bdun pa la ni thun tshod du rung ba'i cho gas 'jug par bya zhing / thun tshod du bza' bar bya'i /
translated: The medicine that is suitable for seven days is to be taken with the rite of the medicine that is suitable for a day and night and is to be taken at the time of a day and night.🔽It is not to be taken for seven days.

original: zhag bdun par bza' bar mi bya ba dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcad ba la ni zhag bdun pa'i cho gas 'jug par bya zhing zhag bdun par bza' bar bya'i /
analyzed: zhag bdun par bza' bar mi bya ba dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcad ba la ni zhag bdun pa'i cho gas 'jug par bya zhing zhag bdun par bza' bar bya'i /
translated: The medicine that is suitable for life is to be taken with the rite of the medicine that is suitable for seven days and is to be taken for seven days.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcad bar bza' bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcad bar bza' bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: It is not to be taken for life.

original: 'dir gzhung ni thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dus su rung ba dang 'dres pa dag ni dus kho nar yongs su longs spyad par bya'i dus ma yin par yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dus su rung ba dang 'dres pa dag ni dus kho nar yongs su longs spyad par bya'i dus ma yin par yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should consume at the proper time those that are suitable for a period of time, those that are suitable for seven days, and those that are suitable for life, but not at the improper time.

original: zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba thun tshod du rung ba dang 'dres pa dag ni thun tshod kho nar yongs su longs spyad par bya'i /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba thun tshod du rung ba dang 'dres pa dag ni thun tshod kho nar yongs su longs spyad par bya'i /
translated: Those that are suitable for seven days and those that are suitable for life, when mixed with those that are suitable for a period of time, should be consumed within the period of time.

original: thun tshod kyi mtha' las yol bar yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: thun tshod kyi mtha' las yol bar yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not consume them beyond the end of the period of time.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba zhag bdun pa dang 'dres pa ni zhag bdun pa kho nar yongs su longs spyad par bya'i /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba zhag bdun pa dang 'dres pa ni zhag bdun pa kho nar yongs su longs spyad par bya'i /
translated: Those that are suitable for seven days, when mixed with those that are suitable for life, should be consumed within seven days.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should not consume them beyond the end of the period of time.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du ma gyur pa ni sngon gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du ma gyur pa ni sngon gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nature does not transform into something else, because it is not non-previous.🔽Even though it is mixed with other medicines, its own nature does not transform into something else.

original: de sman gzhan dang lhan cig 'dres kyang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa las gzhan du ma gyur pa ni sngon gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de sman gzhan dang lhan cig 'dres kyang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa las gzhan du ma gyur pa ni sngon gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-previous.

original: sngon gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the same as before.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dang ma 'dres pa la ni rang gi cho gas rung bar bya ba mi 'grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dang ma 'dres pa la ni rang gi cho gas rung bar bya ba mi 'grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is not suitable to be mixed with other things.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gzhan du ma gyur pa ni sngon gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir sman de sman gzhan dang reg cing phrad par gyur du zin kyang gzhan dang ma 'dres shing rang bzhin tha dad par gnas pa la ni
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gzhan du ma gyur pa ni sngon gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir sman de sman gzhan dang reg cing phrad par gyur du zin kyang gzhan dang ma 'dres shing rang bzhin tha dad par gnas pa la ni
translated: Because the nature does not transform into something else, it is not non-previous. Therefore, even though that medicine comes into contact with and mixes with other medicines, it remains distinct from others and does not lose its own nature.

original: rang gi cho gas rung bar bya ba mi 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi cho gas rung bar bya ba mi 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one cannot accomplish the proper time through one’s own rite.

original: 'grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is definitely accomplished.

original: 'di @218b skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di @218b skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: dus su rung pa'i nang na 'dug pa'i thun tshod du rung ba dus su rung ba dang ma 'dres pa ni thun tshod du rung ba nyid du yongs su longs spyad du rung la /
analyzed: dus su rung pa'i nang na 'dug pa'i thun tshod du rung ba dus su rung ba dang ma 'dres pa ni thun tshod du rung ba nyid du yongs su longs spyad du rung la /
translated: If the proper time is mixed with the proper time for one day, then the proper time for one day is suitable to be consumed as the proper time for one day.🔽Similarly, if the seven day medicine is mixed with the proper time for one day, then the seven day medicine is suitable to be consumed as the seven day medicine.

original: de bzhin du zun tshod du rung ba'i nad na 'dug pa'i zhag bdun pa thun tshod du rung ba dang ma 'dres pa ni zhag bdun pa nyid du yongs su longs spyod par rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa'i nang na 'dug pa'i 'tsho ba'i bar du bcad bzhag bdun pa dang ma 'dres pa ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba nyid du yongs su longs spyad par rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zun tshod du rung ba'i nad na 'dug pa'i zhag bdun pa thun tshod du rung ba dang ma 'dres pa ni zhag bdun pa nyid du yongs su longs spyod par rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa'i nang na 'dug pa'i 'tsho ba'i bar du bcad bzhag bdun pa dang ma 'dres pa ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba nyid du yongs su longs spyad par rung ste /
translated: If the medicine to be kept until one is cured is mixed with the seven day medicine, then the medicine to be kept until one is cured is suitable to be consumed as the medicine to be kept until one is cured.

original: rang rang gi cho gas 'jug par byar rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang rang gi cho gas 'jug par byar rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is suitable to be used through one’s own rite. This is the meaning of the text.

original: bu ram bsgong ba'i phyir 'bras phye'i nang du gzhag pa ni bkru bas rang kho na'i grangs nyid du 'grub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bu ram bsgong ba'i phyir 'bras phye'i nang du gzhag pa ni bkru bas rang kho na'i grangs nyid du 'grub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Sugar is placed in flour in order to make a lump. It is established as lasting only seven days by washing it.

original: bu ram gong bur bya ba'i phyir 'bras phye'i nang du gzhag ste gong bur gyur pa na 'bras phye'i bag chags pa ni chus bkrus pas zhag bdun pa zhes bya ba rang kho na'i grangs nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bu ram gong bur bya ba'i phyir 'bras phye'i nang du gzhag ste gong bur gyur pa na 'bras phye'i bag chags pa ni chus bkrus pas zhag bdun pa zhes bya ba rang kho na'i grangs nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Sugar is placed in flour in order to make a lump. When it becomes a lump, the flour is removed by washing it with water. It is established as lasting only seven days by washing it.

original: 'gor gyi gzungs ni bu ram nyid du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gor gyi gzungs ni bu ram nyid du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The lump should be understood as sugar.

original: gal te bu ram bskol ba'i dus na 'gor dang ling nyid du mi btub pa 'gor dang ling nyid du bya ba'i phyir 'bras kyi bag phye la sogs pa ldugs pa de ni bu ram nyid yin pas zhag bdun pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te bu ram bskol ba'i dus na 'gor dang ling nyid du mi btub pa 'gor dang ling nyid du bya ba'i phyir 'bras kyi bag phye la sogs pa ldugs pa de ni bu ram nyid yin pas zhag bdun pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: If sugar is boiled and it cannot be made into a lump, flour and so on is added in order to make a lump. Since it is sugar, it should be understood as lasting only seven days.

original: dus su rung ba nyid ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dus su rung ba nyid ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It is not suitable for a long time.

original: byin gyis brlab pa la ni sog 'jog mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa la ni sog 'jog mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But there is no transgression of storing for one who has consecrated.

original: gal te sman zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho'i bar du bcad bar byin gyis brlabs par gyur na de la dus de tsam gyis sog 'jog gi nyes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar //
analyzed: gal te sman zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho'i bar du bcad bar byin gyis brlabs par gyur na de la dus de tsam gyis sog 'jog gi nyes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar //
translated: If one has consecrated medicine to be used for seven days or as long as one lives, there is no transgression of storing for that period of time.🔽Here the scripture is:

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa pre 'tshal bas byin len bgyis pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa yongs su longs spyad du rung ngam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa pre 'tshal bas byin len bgyis pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa yongs su longs spyad du rung ngam /
translated: “Venerable Prāpta, is it proper to consume medicine that has been consecrated by another or by oneself?”

original: nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Upāli, it is proper.”

original: bro 'tshal ba zhes smos pas ni na ba la rung ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bro 'tshal ba zhes smos pas ni na ba la rung ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: Since it says “if one is sick,” it shows that it is proper for the sick.

original: nad pa'i ched du yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir rang gis dus kyi mtha'i bar du byin gyis brlab bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nad pa'i ched du yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir rang gis dus kyi mtha'i bar du byin gyis brlab bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “For the sake of the sick, one should consecrate it oneself up to the end of the day.”

original: thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag rang rang gi dus kyi mtha' tshun chad du byin gyis brlab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag rang rang gi dus kyi mtha' tshun chad du byin gyis brlab par bya ba'o //
translated: The medicine that is suitable for one day, the medicine that is suitable for seven days, and the medicine that is suitable for life should be consecrated until the end of their respective periods.

original: dus su rung ba ni byin gyis brlab mi dgos te de byin gyis brlabs pa don med pa'i phyir @219a * //
analyzed: dus su rung ba ni byin gyis brlab mi dgos te de byin gyis brlabs pa don med pa'i phyir @219a * //
translated: That which is suitable for the time does not need to be consecrated, because it is meaningless to consecrate it.

original: ro ; / de dag gi sngags ni /
analyzed: ro ; / de dag gi sngags ni /
translated: Their mantra is:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please listen!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sman thun tshod du rung ba 'di dag bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyir bgyi bar thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sman thun tshod du rung ba 'di dag bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyir bgyi bar thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis brlab po //
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, consecrate this medicine suitable for one day as suitable for one day for myself and for those who practice pure conduct together with me.

original: lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: This is repeated three times.

original: thabs yin no //
analyzed: thabs yin no //
translated: This is the method.

original: legs so zhes gsungs pa dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag la yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: legs so zhes gsungs pa dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag la yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said, “Good!” And it is said that the medicine suitable for seven days and the medicine suitable for life are also like that.

original: dus gang gi tshe byin gyis brlab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe byin gyis brlab par bya zhe na /
translated: At what time should it be consecrated?

original: de'i phyir zas snga ma'i tshe'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zas snga ma'i tshe'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “at the time of the former meal.”

original: gung tshigs kyi mdun rol du zas bza' ba thams cad kyi dus gang yin pa de ni zas snga ma li dus te cho ga'i gzhi zhes bya ba yin pas dus der byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gung tshigs kyi mdun rol du zas bza' ba thams cad kyi dus gang yin pa de ni zas snga ma li dus te cho ga'i gzhi zhes bya ba yin pas dus der byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: The time of the former meal is the time of any meal before noon. Since this is the basis of the rite, one should consecrate the food at that time.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How should one consecrate it?

original: de'i phyir byin len byas te'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byin len byas te'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “having received it.”

original: byin len byas te byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: byin len byas te byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate the food after receiving it.

original: byin len ma byas pa dang sog 'jog dang 'dres pa bsrung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin len ma byas pa dang sog 'jog dang 'dres pa bsrung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should protect it from being defiled by what is not consecrated, by what is stored, and by what is mixed.

original: byin gyis rlob pa'i chen byin len ma byas par byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung la /
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa'i chen byin len ma byas par byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung la /
translated: It is not suitable to consecrate food that is not consecrated,

original: dri ma la sogs pa dang 'bags pas sog 'jog dang 'dres pa la byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung bas de'i phyir de gnyis bsrung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dri ma la sogs pa dang 'bags pas sog 'jog dang 'dres pa la byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung bas de'i phyir de gnyis bsrung bar bya ba'o //
translated: and it is not suitable to consecrate food that is defiled by stains, etc., that is stored, or that is mixed. Therefore, one should protect it from these two.

original: de'i phyir lag pa gnyis bsnyal nas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir lag pa gnyis bsnyal nas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “having placed the two hands together.”

original: gang gi phyir byin len ma byas pa dang sog 'jog dang 'dres pa bsrung bar bya ba yin pa de'i phyir lag pa gnyis bsnyal nas byin len byas te byin gyis brlab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byin len ma byas pa dang sog 'jog dang 'dres pa bsrung bar bya ba yin pa de'i phyir lag pa gnyis bsnyal nas byin len byas te byin gyis brlab par bya ba'o //
translated: Since one should guard against not receiving, storing, and mixing, one should receive and consecrate by placing both hands together.

original: des na byin len ma byas pa dang sog 'jog dang 'dres pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na byin len ma byas pa dang sog 'jog dang 'dres pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it becomes free from not receiving, storing, and mixing.

original: lag nyar blangs pa dang sog 'jog byas pa dang byin len ma byas pa dang nang du zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa dag la byin gyis brlab pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa dang sog 'jog byas pa dang byin len ma byas pa dang nang du zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa dag la byin gyis brlab pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not consecrate what is held in the hand, what is stored, what is not received, what has passed the night, what is cooked inside, and what is cooked by a fully ordained monk.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here, the text of the question is:

original: btsun pa dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dang zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba'i sman gang dag sug nyar blangs pa dang byin len ma bgyis pa dang nang du dgung lon pa dang nang du bsgral ba dang rang gis bsgral ba
analyzed: btsun pa dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dang zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba'i sman gang dag sug nyar blangs pa dang byin len ma bgyis pa dang nang du dgung lon pa dang nang du bsgral ba dang rang gis bsgral ba
translated: Venerable, what are the medicines that are suitable for the time, suitable for the period, to be kept for seven days, and to be kept for life, which are held in the hand, not received, have passed the night, have been cooked inside, and have been cooked by oneself?

original: dang dge slong gis bsgral ba de dag yongs su longs spyod par rung ngam /
analyzed: dang dge slong gis bsgral ba de dag yongs su longs spyod par rung ngam /
translated: Is it proper for a fully ordained monk to consume that which has been dedicated by a novice or layperson?

original: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upagupta, it is not proper.

original: @219b ro dang sla ba nyid yongs su gyur na sog 'jog byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽byin gyis brlabs pa'i btung ba rgun chu la sogs pa'i ro myos par mi 'gyur ba nyid la myos par 'gyur pa nyid du yongs su gyur pa dang / sla ba bzhin snang ba las bzhin mi snang ba nyid du yongs su gyur na /
analyzed: @219b ro dang sla ba nyid yongs su gyur na sog 'jog byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni / byin gyis brlabs pa'i btung ba rgun chu la sogs pa'i ro myos par mi 'gyur ba nyid la myos par 'gyur pa nyid du yongs su gyur pa dang / sla ba bzhin snang ba las bzhin mi snang ba nyid du yongs su gyur na /
translated: If the taste or potency changes, it is stored.

original: de'i tshe sog 'jog byas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sog 'jog byas pa nyid yin te /
translated: If the taste of consecrated alcohol such as grape wine that does not intoxicate changes to that of an intoxicating drink and if the potency of a medicine that is not laxative changes to that of a laxative, then at that time it is stored.

original: de yang byin len byas shing byin gyis brlabs pa la sog 'jog byas par 'gyur gyi byin len ma byas pa la ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang byin len byas shing byin gyis brlabs pa la sog 'jog byas par 'gyur gyi byin len ma byas pa la ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Further, it is stored if it is consecrated and received through giving and taking, but not if it is not received through giving and taking,

original: byin len ma byas pa la sog 'jog mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byin len ma byas pa la sog 'jog mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to store that which is not received through giving and taking.

original: gal te ro dang sla ba gnyi ga yongs su gyur na yang btung bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //🔽ro 'ba' zhig yongs su gyur na yang btung bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te ro dang sla ba gnyi ga yongs su gyur na yang btung bar mi bya ba nyid yin no // ro 'ba' zhig yongs su gyur na yang btung bar mi bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If both the taste and the state of being a drink have changed, it is still not to be drunk.🔽If only the taste has changed, it is still not to be drunk.

original: ji ste sla ba 'ba' zhig yongs su gyur pa yang btung bar mi bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: ji ste sla ba 'ba' zhig yongs su gyur pa yang btung bar mi bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: If only the state of being a drink has changed, it is still not to be drunk.

original: byin len ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byin len ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has not been received.

original: de bas na btung ba byin len byas shing byin gyis brlabs pa re dang sla ba nyid yongs su gyur na rang gi dus kyi mtha'i mdun rol du yang sog 'jog byas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na btung ba byin len byas shing byin gyis brlabs pa re dang sla ba nyid yongs su gyur na rang gi dus kyi mtha'i mdun rol du yang sog 'jog byas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if the drink has been received and consecrated, and only the state of being a drink has changed, it is still to be drunk before the end of the time period.

original: 'dir don ni de yin no //
analyzed: 'dir don ni de yin no //
translated: This is the meaning here.

original: 'di gnyis kyis ni ngo bo nyid gyur par bstan te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis ni ngo bo nyid gyur par bstan te /
translated: These two show the change of nature.

original: des na de gnyis las gcig tu gyur na yang sog 'jog byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na de gnyis las gcig tu gyur na yang sog 'jog byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, if either of the two has changed, it is still to be drunk.

original: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu'i bu ram gyi btung ba'i skabs nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu'i bu ram gyi btung ba'i skabs nas /
translated: Here, the text is from the section on loose sugar cane juice:

original: btsun pa btung ba btsags pa dgung bdun par byin gyis brlab tu rung ngam /
analyzed: btsun pa btung ba btsags pa dgung bdun par byin gyis brlab tu rung ngam /
translated: Is it proper to consecrate drink that has been strained to last seven days?

original: nye ba 'khor rung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rung ngo //
translated: Upali, it is proper.

original: btsun pa yun ji srid du gzhag par 'tshal bar bgyi /
analyzed: btsun pa yun ji srid du gzhag par 'tshal bar bgyi /
translated: How long should it be kept?

original: nye ba 'khor shin tu sla zhing mi skyur la rang gi ngo bo nyid mi spong ba de srid du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no//
analyzed: nye ba 'khor shin tu sla zhing mi skyur la rang gi ngo bo nyid mi spong ba de srid du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no//
translated: Upali, as long as it is not spoiled, does not ferment, and does not lose its identity.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa 'og ma dang lhan cig yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa 'og ma dang lhan cig yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not consume what has been consecrated together with what is not consecrated.

original: thun tshod du rung ba byin gyis brlabs pa dus su rung ba dang lhan cig yongs su longs spyad par mi bya ba dang / zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dag dang lhan cig yongs su longs spyad par mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba byin gyis brlabs pa dus su rung ba dang lhan cig yongs su longs spyad par mi bya ba dang / zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dag dang lhan cig yongs su longs spyad par mi bya ba dang /
translated: One should not consume what is suitable for one day and night together with what has been consecrated to last seven days, nor should one consume what is suitable for one day and night together with what has been consecrated to last seven days and what is suitable for one day and night.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang bar byin gyis brlabs pa dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dang zhag bdun pa rnams dang lhan cig yongs su longs spyad par mi bya ste /🔽'dir bye brag tu ma bcad pas byin gyis brlabs pa dang @220a * //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang bar byin gyis brlabs pa dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dang zhag bdun pa rnams dang lhan cig yongs su longs spyad par mi bya ste / 'dir bye brag tu ma bcad pas byin gyis brlabs pa dang @220a * //
translated: One should not consume these medicines together with those that are suitable for a specific time, those that are suitable for seven days, and those that are suitable for life, which have been consecrated as suitable for a specific time.

original: sog 'jog gi dus lam bab pa dang / lhan cig ces bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sog 'jog gi dus lam bab pa dang / lhan cig ces bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, since it is not specified, it should be understood that it is consecrated and that it is suitable for the time of storing.

original: 'dir gzhung ni mood gal gyi bu /🔽de la thun tshod du rung ba gang yin pa dang / zhag bdun pa gang yin pa dang / 'tsho'i bar du bcad pa gang yin pa de dus su rung ba dang 'dres na yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni mood gal gyi bu / de la thun tshod du rung ba gang yin pa dang / zhag bdun pa gang yin pa dang / 'tsho'i bar du bcad pa gang yin pa de dus su rung ba dang 'dres na yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: Here is the text: Maudgalyāyana,🔽if that which is suitable for a specific time, that which is suitable for seven days, and that which is suitable for life are mixed with that which is suitable for a specific time, it should not be consumed.

original: zhag bdun pa gang yin pa dang / 'tsho'i bar du bcad pa gang yin pa de thun tshod du rung ba dang 'dres na yang yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa gang yin pa dang / 'tsho'i bar du bcad pa gang yin pa de thun tshod du rung ba dang 'dres na yang yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: If that which is suitable for seven days and that which is suitable for life are mixed with that which is suitable for a specific time, it should not be consumed.

original: 'tsho'i bar du bcad pa gang yin pa de zhag bdun pa dang 'dres na yang yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho'i bar du bcad pa gang yin pa de zhag bdun pa dang 'dres na yang yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And if that which is to be used until one is cured is mixed with the seven-day medicine, it should not be used.

original: sman gyi go rims ni dpe'o zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sman gyi go rims ni dpe'o zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The order of the medicines is merely an example.

original: sngar de ni rnam pa bzhi'o zhes smos pas dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba zhes sman rnam pa bzhi smos pa'i go rims de ni dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: sngar de ni rnam pa bzhi'o zhes smos pas dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba zhes sman rnam pa bzhi smos pa'i go rims de ni dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: Since it was previously stated that there are four types of medicine, the order of the medicines is merely an example.

original: des na 'dis mig sman la sogs pa dag kyang 'phangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dis mig sman la sogs pa dag kyang 'phangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, this also implies eye medicine and so on.

original: de'i phyir mig sman bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig sman bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “One should use eye medicine.”

original: mig sman bsten du rung ba'o //
analyzed: mig sman bsten du rung ba'o //
translated: It is suitable to use eye medicine.

original: sman ma yin pa'i don du mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sman ma yin pa'i don du mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not use it for the purpose of non-medicine.

original: sgeg pa'i don ni sman ma yin pa'i don te /
analyzed: sgeg pa'i don ni sman ma yin pa'i don te /
translated: The purpose of non-medicine is for the purpose of beauty.

original: de'i don du mig sman bsten par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i don du mig sman bsten par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not use eye medicine for that purpose.

original: de'i snod rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de'i snod rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: The vessel for that is appropriate.

original: mig sman de'i snod rung ba nye bar gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig sman de'i snod rung ba nye bar gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: The vessel is the proper container for the eye medicine.

original: gang gis snod ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis snod ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the vessel?

original: de'i phyir mig sman skyer khanda'i ni za ma tog go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig sman skyer khanda'i ni za ma tog go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “The vessel for the eye medicine is a box.”

original: mig sman ri lu'i ni sgye'u'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mig sman ri lu'i ni sgye'u'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The vessel for the eye medicine in the form of a pill is a small box.

original: de'i snod sgye'u'o //🔽mig sman du ba dang / sbrus pa dang phyi ma rnams kyi ni dong bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i snod sgye'u'o // mig sman du ba dang / sbrus pa dang phyi ma rnams kyi ni dong bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The vessel for that is a small box.🔽The vessel for the eye medicine in the form of smoke, ointment, and powder is a tube.

original: mig sman du ba dang mig sman sbrus pa dang mig sman phye ma rnams kyi snod ni smyig ma la sogs pa'i dong bu'o //🔽thur ma bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mig sman du ba dang mig sman sbrus pa dang mig sman phye ma rnams kyi snod ni smyig ma la sogs pa'i dong bu'o // thur ma bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The vessel for the eye medicine in the form of smoke, ointment, and powder is a tube made of bamboo, etc.🔽The eye medicine should be held with a stick.

original: mig bsku ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig bsku ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for applying to the eye.🔽It is good if it is made of copper or iron.

original: zangs ma dang lcags dag gis bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zangs ma dang lcags dag gis bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The stick is good if it is made of copper or iron.

original: thur ma'o // ci de gnyis thams cad kyi bzang ngam zhe na /
analyzed: thur ma'o // ci de gnyis thams cad kyi bzang ngam zhe na /
translated: Are both of them good for all eye medicines?

original: de'i phyir rang 'khrungs dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang 'khrungs dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “They are natural.”

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa dag gam bzhus te blugs pa dag go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa dag gam bzhus te blugs pa dag go //
translated: They are naturally formed or melted and poured.

original: nad pas sman gzhug pa'i phyir mchan khug bcang par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad pas sman gzhug pa'i phyir mchan khug bcang par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: A pouch should be worn by the sick in order to insert medicine.

original: mchan khug ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchan khug ces bya ba ni /
translated: A pouch is

original: lcug ma la sogs pa las byas pa'i sman gyi snod @220b ko lpags kyis bcings pa rim pa re re yang sman tha dad par gzhug par bya ba'i phyir mig mang po yod cing kha bcad du rung ba'o //
analyzed: lcug ma la sogs pa las byas pa'i sman gyi snod @220b ko lpags kyis bcings pa rim pa re re yang sman tha dad par gzhug par bya ba'i phyir mig mang po yod cing kha bcad du rung ba'o //
translated: a medicine container made of bamboo and so on, bound with leather, having many openings for inserting different medicines, and suitable for closing.

original: der ma shong pa nyid yin na brungs sam thum po byas te bcer ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der ma shong pa nyid yin na brungs sam thum po byas te bcer ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not possible to fit them in there, they should be made into a bundle or a ball and worn.

original: mchan khug der sman mangs la snod chungs pas mi shong pa nyid yin na de'i tshe sman gyi thum po dag brungs su byas te /🔽gcig gi steng du gcig bcer bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: mchan khug der sman mangs la snod chungs pas mi shong pa nyid yin na de'i tshe sman gyi thum po dag brungs su byas te / gcig gi steng du gcig bcer bar bya ba'am /
translated: If it is not possible to fit many medicines into that pouch because the container is small, then at that time the medicine balls should be made into a bundle.🔽One should be placed on top of the other and worn.

original: phyi thum gcig tu byas te gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi thum gcig tu byas te gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, making a single outer covering, it should be placed. This is the meaning.

original: bcug pa mi 'drul bar bya ba phyir dus su bskam mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcug pa mi 'drul bar bya ba phyir dus su bskam mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order that what has been inserted does not rot, it should be dried from time to time.

original: sman mtshan khug tu bcug pa rlan gyis mi 'drul bar bya ba'i phyir dus dus su bskam par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sman mtshan khug tu bcug pa rlan gyis mi 'drul bar bya ba'i phyir dus dus su bskam par bya ba'o //
translated: In order that the medicine inserted into the vagina does not rot from moisture, it should be dried from time to time.

original: gang du bskam par bya zhe na de'i phyir nyi grib la'o zhes bya ba smas te /
analyzed: gang du bskam par bya zhe na de'i phyir nyi grib la'o zhes bya ba smas te /
translated: Where should it be dried? Therefore it is said, in the shade.

original: nyi ma dang grib ma 'dres ma'i nang du bskam par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang grib ma 'dres ma'i nang du bskam par bya'o //
translated: It should be dried in a place where the sun and shade are mixed.

original: bskams na mthu 'bri'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bskams na mthu 'bri'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is dried, its potency is reduced.

original: nyi ma tsha ba 'ba' zhig la bskams na sman rnams kyi mthu 'bri bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyi ma tsha ba 'ba' zhig la bskams na sman rnams kyi mthu 'bri bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it is dried only in the hot sun, the potency of the medicines is reduced.

original: 'dis ni sman thams cad bskam pa bstan pa yin gyi mchan khug gi yul 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni sman thams cad bskam pa bstan pa yin gyi mchan khug gi yul 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: This shows that all medicines should be dried, not only those in the vagina.

original: ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu byung na rang gis drub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu byung na rang gis drub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a cause of spoilage occurs, it should be dried by oneself.

original: rlung dang char pa la sogs pa sman ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu byung na dge slong rang gis bsdu zhing drub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rlung dang char pa la sogs pa sman ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu byung na dge slong rang gis bsdu zhing drub par bya ba'o //

original: ci gnas skabs thams cad du 'am zhe na de'i phyir /

analyzed: gso ba 'di la byin len ma byas pa dang sog 'jog byas pa'i zas dag mi rung ba nyid du dogs par mi bya ba'o //

original: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here is the text: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: mtshan mo yang btung bar bya'o //

analyzed: byin len stobs pa med nas /

analyzed: reng bu las byung ba'i du ba de brdub bar bya'o //
translated: One may inhale that smoke that arises from the wick.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na reng bu'i du brdub par rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na reng bu'i du brdub par rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here is: “Therefore, it is permitted to inhale smoke from a burning wick.”

original: de ni sman gce'us 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni du ba rdub pa de'o //
analyzed: de ni sman gce'us 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni du ba rdub pa de'o //
translated: “That is accomplished with a medicine tube” refers to inhaling smoke.

original: lcags las bya'o zhes bya ba ni sman gce'u'o //
analyzed: lcags las bya'o zhes bya ba ni sman gce'u'o //
translated: “It is made of iron” refers to the medicine tube.

original: sor bcu gnyis pa bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sor bcu gnyis pa bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Twelve fingerbreadths is good.”

original: sman gce'u de'i srid kyi tshad du sor bcu gnyis pa bzang ngo //🔽rno ba dang rtsub par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sman gce'u de'i srid kyi tshad du sor bcu gnyis pa bzang ngo // rno ba dang rtsub par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The length of that medicine tube is good if it is twelve fingerbreadths.

original: sman @222b gce'u'i sbubs so //🔽zhun mar ram 'bru mar gyis bskus te shubs su gzhug go zhes bya ba ni sman gce'u'o //🔽de ni zung nga 'am chos gos kyi gdang bu la gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sman @222b gce'u'i sbubs so // zhun mar ram 'bru mar gyis bskus te shubs su gzhug go zhes bya ba ni sman gce'u'o // de ni zung nga 'am chos gos kyi gdang bu la gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It should not be sharp or rough” refers to the opening of the medicine tube.🔽“It is smeared with ghee or oil and placed in a sheath” refers to the medicine tube.

original: sman gce'u'i shubs de'o //
analyzed: sman gce'u'i shubs de'o //
translated: “It is placed in a bag or on a robe rack” refers to the sheath for the medicine tube.

original: dri ma med par bya ba'i phyir mer gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dri ma med par bya ba'i phyir mer gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In order to remove impurities, it is placed in fire” refers to the medicine tube.

original: sman gce'u'o // snar blugs pa'i las bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sman gce'u'o // snar blugs pa'i las bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The procedure for inserting it into the nose” refers to the medicine tube.

original: snar rdub pa'i las so //
analyzed: snar rdub pa'i las so //
translated: The action of inhaling through the nose.

original: de ni snar blugs pa'i spyad kyis 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni snar blugs pa'i spyad kyis 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is accomplished by the practice of inhaling through the nose.

original: snar blugs pa'i las de'o //
analyzed: snar blugs pa'i las de'o //
translated: That is the action of inhaling through the nose.

original: mchu gnyis pa mi rno ba bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchu gnyis pa mi rno ba bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Two lips are good, not sharp.

original: snar blugs pa'i spyad ni kha brag mchu gnyis pa mi rno ba bzang ngo //
analyzed: snar blugs pa'i spyad ni kha brag mchu gnyis pa mi rno ba bzang ngo //
translated: The practice of inhaling through the nose is good with two lips, not sharp.

original: de bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
translated: That should be done.

original: snar blugs pa'i spyad de'o //
analyzed: snar blugs pa'i spyad de'o //
translated: That is the practice of inhaling through the nose.

original: sman gyi go rims ni dpe'o zhes smos pa des mtshon pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir sman gyi phyir sha rlon pa bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sman gyi go rims ni dpe'o zhes smos pa des mtshon pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir sman gyi phyir sha rlon pa bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The order of the medicines is an example. In order to show other examples, it is said: For the sake of medicine, fresh meat should be relied upon.

original: sha rlon pa bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sha rlon pa bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: Fresh meat should be eaten.

original: de za mi nus na thabs bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de za mi nus na thabs bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one is unable to eat that, a method should be employed.

original: sha rlon pa de za mi nus pa'i gang zag la zar gzhug pa'i thabs bya ba'o ;
analyzed: sha rlon pa de za mi nus pa'i gang zag la zar gzhug pa'i thabs bya ba'o ;
translated: For the person who is unable to eat that fresh meat, a method should be employed to make them eat it.

original: / ras kyis mig gnyis dgab bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / ras kyis mig gnyis dgab bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The eyes should be covered with a cloth.

original: ras kyis mig gnyis bkab ste sha rlon pa yin par mi shes par bya zhing khar bsnyod pa ni thabs yin no //
analyzed: ras kyis mig gnyis bkab ste sha rlon pa yin par mi shes par bya zhing khar bsnyod pa ni thabs yin no //
translated: The method is to cover the eyes with a cloth so that one does not know that it is fresh meat, and to put it in the mouth.

original: mi rgal bar bya ba'i phyir dri zhim pos bsgo'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rgal bar bya ba'i phyir dri zhim pos bsgo'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order not to vomit, it is said that one should anoint it with a fragrant substance.

original: skyug mi bro bar bya ba'i phyir tha ba la sogs pa'i rdzas dri zhim pos sha rlon pa la bsgo zhing zar gzhug pa ste /
analyzed: skyug mi bro bar bya ba'i phyir tha ba la sogs pa'i rdzas dri zhim pos sha rlon pa la bsgo zhing zar gzhug pa ste /
translated: In order not to vomit, one should anoint the fresh meat with a fragrant substance such as camphor, and then eat it.

original: de yang thabs yin no //
analyzed: de yang thabs yin no //
translated: That is also a method.

original: shan med pa nyid na mdun du bza' ba dang bca' ba yid du 'ong ba gzhag te dgrol lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shan med pa nyid na mdun du bza' ba dang bca' ba yid du 'ong ba gzhag te dgrol lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When there is no longer a trace, one should place in front of the one who is to be trained pleasing food and drink and then remove the blindfold.

original: sha rlon pa'i dum grugs la sogs pa'i shan med pa nyid na mdun du bza' ba dang bca' ba yid du 'ong ba dag gzhag ste mig ras kyis g-yogs pa dgrol bar bya ba ste de yang thabs yin no //
analyzed: sha rlon pa'i dum grugs la sogs pa'i shan med pa nyid na mdun du bza' ba dang bca' ba yid du 'ong ba dag gzhag ste mig ras kyis g-yogs pa dgrol bar bya ba ste de yang thabs yin no //
translated: When there is no longer a trace of the fresh meat, etc., one should place in front of the one who is to be trained pleasing food and drink, and then remove the blindfold. That is also a method.

original: gzhan gyi don der na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don der na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is for the sake of another, it is a grave offense.

original: sha rlon pa de sman gyi don las gzhan pa gsang sngags bsgrub pa la sogs pa'i don der zan dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi dge 'dun lhag ma'i skabs su gtogs pa'i nyes ba sbom bor 'gyur te /
analyzed: sha rlon pa de sman gyi don las gzhan pa gsang sngags bsgrub pa la sogs pa'i don der zan dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi dge 'dun lhag ma'i skabs su gtogs pa'i nyes ba sbom bor 'gyur te /
translated: The purpose of eating fresh meat is for medicine, not for the purpose of accomplishing secret mantra and so on.

original: bdag nyid 'dre'i nang du gtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dre'i nang du gtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is a serious offense that is included in the category of partial defeat for schism in the Saṅgha, because one is counted as an evil spirit.

original: mi'i sha ni thams cad du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi'i sha ni thams cad du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Human flesh is always prohibited.

original: sman gyi don dang sman ma yin pa'i don thams cad du mi sha zos na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman gyi don dang sman ma yin pa'i don thams cad du mi sha zos na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Eating human flesh is a serious offense in all cases, whether it is for the purpose of medicine or not.

original: 'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag gi chung ma sde chen mas brla'i sha @223a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag gi chung ma sde chen mas brla'i sha @223a * //
translated: Here is the text: The wife of the householder Mahāsena cut the flesh from her thigh

original: bcad de g-yog mo la /
analyzed: bcad de g-yog mo la /
translated: and said to her servant,

original: bu mo pho sha'i khu sha gyis la /
analyzed: bu mo pho sha'i khu sha gyis la /
translated: “Girl, make soup from this human flesh

original: 'phags pa che ge mo zhig gi gan du khyer la /
analyzed: 'phags pa che ge mo zhig gi gan du khyer la /
translated: and take it to so-and-so noble one.

original: byin cig ces byin pa nas /
analyzed: byin cig ces byin pa nas /
translated: Give it to him.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag sha 'di ni tha chad yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag sha 'di ni tha chad yin te /
translated: “Monks, this flesh is vile.

original: 'di lta ste mi'i sha'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mi'i sha'o //
translated: It is human flesh.

original: de lta bas na dge slong gis mi sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gis mi sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, a monk should not eat human flesh.

original: zan nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zan nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he does, he commits a serious offense.

original: sman gyi phyir za ba yang bcom ldan 'das kyis smad pas de'i phyir 'dir thams cad du'o zhes mdor bsdu ba byas so //
analyzed: sman gyi phyir za ba yang bcom ldan 'das kyis smad pas de'i phyir 'dir thams cad du'o zhes mdor bsdu ba byas so //
translated: The Blessed One also criticized eating meat for the sake of medicine. Therefore, the word “ever” is included in the verse.

original: sha bsngos par shes na bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sha bsngos par shes na bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he knows that the meat has been offered to him, he should not eat it.

original: za ba po'i phyir sbyin bdag gis sha bsngos par zab pos mthong ba dang thos dang dogs pa'i sgo nas shes nas des sha de bza' bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: za ba po'i phyir sbyin bdag gis sha bsngos par zab pos mthong ba dang thos dang dogs pa'i sgo nas shes nas des sha de bza' bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: If the donor has offered the meat for the sake of the eater, and if the eater sees, hears, or suspects that the meat has been offered for his sake, he should not eat it.

original: de lta bas na rab tu byung ba rnams kyis ni shan pa'i gnas sam tshong dus nas sha rung ba dge bsnyen dad pa can gyis blangs te bza' bar rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na rab tu byung ba rnams kyis ni shan pa'i gnas sam tshong dus nas sha rung ba dge bsnyen dad pa can gyis blangs te bza' bar rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: Therefore, renunciates should eat meat that is suitable, which has been obtained from the butcher or the marketplace by lay people who have faith.

original: stag gi gong ma mi bza'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stag gi gong ma mi bza'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not eat meat that has been offered to him.

original: sha shes na bza' bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: sha shes na bza' bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: If he knows that the meat has been offered to him, he should not eat it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag stag ni rul sbed pa yin pas de'i phyir dge slong gis stag gi gong ma'i sha bza' bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag stag ni rul sbed pa yin pas de'i phyir dge slong gis stag gi gong ma'i sha bza' bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here is: “Monks, since a tiger is a carnivore, a monk should not eat the flesh of a tiger.”

original: de ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bkag pas de'i phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa gzhan gyis sbas par shes na yang bza' bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bkag pas de'i phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa gzhan gyis sbas par shes na yang bza' bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: Since this is a prohibition that is dependent on other factors, one should not eat the flesh of other carnivores that are known to be hidden.

original: glang po che dang rta dang klu rnams kyi mi bza'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glang po che dang rta dang klu rnams kyi mi bza'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not eat the flesh of elephants, horses, and nāgas.

original: de rnams kyi sha bza' bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sha bza' bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not eat the flesh of these animals.

original: rmig gcig pa dang wa dang spre'u dang shing rta mo dang bya rog dang bya rgod dang chu skyar dang khyi dang bya khra dang 'ug pa dang / de dag las gzhan pa'i bya mi ro zab dag dang bya gar dang pha wang dang skyin kor dang dre'u srin dang srin bu rnams kyi yang mi bza'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rmig gcig pa dang wa dang spre'u dang shing rta mo dang bya rog dang bya rgod dang chu skyar dang khyi dang bya khra dang 'ug pa dang / de dag las gzhan pa'i bya mi ro zab dag dang bya gar dang pha wang dang skyin kor dang dre'u srin dang srin bu rnams kyi yang mi bza'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not eat the flesh of one-toed animals, foxes, monkeys, camels, crows, vultures, herons, dogs, hawks, owls, or other birds that eat raw meat, nor the flesh of bats, flying foxes, rabbits, donkeys, mules, or insects.

original: de dag gi sha yang shes na bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sha yang shes na bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If one knows their meat, one should not eat it.

original: rmig gcig pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rmig gcig pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One-hoofed animals are

original: rta dang bong bu dang dre'u dang rkyang la sogs pa'o //🔽shing rta mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rta dang bong bu dang dre'u dang rkyang la sogs pa'o // shing rta mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: horses, donkeys, mules, and so on.🔽She-mules are

original: bya shing rta mo'o //🔽bya rog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya shing rta mo'o // bya rog ces bya ba ni /
translated: female mules.🔽Crows are

original: khva dang pho rog go //
analyzed: khva dang pho rog go //
translated: crows and ravens.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i bya mi ro za ba dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i bya mi ro za ba dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: Other birds that eat human flesh are

original: mi ro za ba'i bya sngar bstan pa de dag las gzhan pa'i bya mi ro za ba thams cad spyir bzung ngo //
analyzed: mi ro za ba'i bya sngar bstan pa de dag las gzhan pa'i bya mi ro za ba thams cad spyir bzung ngo //
translated: all birds that eat human flesh in general, other than those previously mentioned.

original: skyin kor zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyin kor zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Snakes are

original: chu na gnas pa dang skam na gnas pa'i skyin kor ro //
analyzed: chu na gnas pa dang skam na gnas pa'i skyin kor ro //
translated: water snakes and land snakes.

original: dre'u @223b srin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dre'u @223b srin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Tadpoles are

original: sa las skyes pa'i srin bu ring po'o //
analyzed: sa las skyes pa'i srin bu ring po'o //
translated: long worms that grow from the earth.🔽Worms refers to

original: srin bu rnams zhes bya bas ni srin bu'i rigs gzhan dag bstan to //
analyzed: srin bu rnams zhes bya bas ni srin bu'i rigs gzhan dag bstan to //
translated: other types of worms.

original: rnams zhes mang po'i tshig tu byas pas ni shing srin dang srin gyi me dang sbrul dang sdig sbrul dang sre mo dang byi ba la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //🔽srin bu zhes smos pas ni /
analyzed: rnams zhes mang po'i tshig tu byas pas ni shing srin dang srin gyi me dang sbrul dang sdig sbrul dang sre mo dang byi ba la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o // srin bu zhes smos pas ni /
translated: The plural particle in the words “worms” and “insects” includes other things, such as wood-lice, fire-bugs, snakes, lizards, mongooses, mice, and so on.

original: srin pu pad pa la sogs pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: srin pu pad pa la sogs pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: The word “worms” includes such things as the “lotus-eaters.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa pad pa'i sha 'tshal du rung ngam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa pad pa'i sha 'tshal du rung ngam /
translated: Here is the text: “Venerable, is it proper to eat the flesh of worms?

original: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: Upāli, it is not proper.

original: de bzhin du dge slong gis bya gar gyi sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong gis bya gar gyi sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: In the same way, a monk should not eat the flesh of birds,🔽nor should he eat the flesh of crows and so on.”

original: bya rog la sogs pa'i sha yang bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhung kha cig las srin bu rnams kyi tshil 'tshal bar bgyi'am 'tshal bar mi bgyi /
analyzed: bya rog la sogs pa'i sha yang bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhung kha cig las srin bu rnams kyi tshil 'tshal bar bgyi'am 'tshal bar mi bgyi /
translated: In some texts it says, “Should one eat the fat of worms or not?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: ‘Do not eat it.

original: nad dang bral ba'i phyir lus bsku bar ni bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nad dang bral ba'i phyir lus bsku bar ni bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: For the sake of health, one may anoint the body with it.’”

original: sha'i byin len stobs pa la bcad pa las byung ba nyid ma yin nam zhes dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽rab tu byung ba rnams la sbyin pa dag gis sha'i byin len bstabs pa na de la za ba pos 'di dge slong gis bzar mi rung ba'i sha bcad pa mi sha dang stag gi gong ma dang glang po che dang rta dang klu dang rmig gcig pa
analyzed: sha'i byin len stobs pa la bcad pa las byung ba nyid ma yin nam zhes dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni / rab tu byung ba rnams la sbyin pa dag gis sha'i byin len bstabs pa na de la za ba pos 'di dge slong gis bzar mi rung ba'i sha bcad pa mi sha dang stag gi gong ma dang glang po che dang rta dang klu dang rmig gcig pa
translated: One should ask, Was this meat given to you by someone who has taken a vow of abstinence?

original: la sogs pa'i sham yin nam zhes dri bar bya zhing /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i sham yin nam zhes dri bar bya zhing /
translated: When the laity give gifts to the ordained, if the ordained ask, Is this meat not the flesh of humans, tigers, elephants, horses, snakes, rhinoceroses, etc., which is not to be eaten by monks?

original: de dag las byung ba ma yin na bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las byung ba ma yin na bza' bar bya'o //
translated: If they reply, It did not come from those, then it may be eaten.

original: tshig de ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: tshig de ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
translated: This statement is merely an illustration.

original: 'di ci'i sha zhes dris na gzhan ma smos kyang nyes pa med do //🔽du ma nyid na dang pos so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ci'i sha zhes dris na gzhan ma smos kyang nyes pa med do // du ma nyid na dang pos so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one asks, Whose flesh is this? there is no fault in not mentioning the other.🔽If there are many eaters, the first one should ask.

original: za ba po du ma nyid yod na dang pos dri par bya ba ste /
analyzed: za ba po du ma nyid yod na dang pos dri par bya ba ste /
translated: If there are many eaters, the first one should ask.

original: dge slong du ma tshogs na dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong du ma tshogs na dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If there is a gathering of many monks, the most senior monk in the saṅgha should ask. This is the meaning of the text.

original: nyams na 'og mas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyams na 'og mas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is a fault, the next one should ask.

original: sha'i skabs dri'o zhes bya bar sbyar te //
analyzed: sha'i skabs dri'o zhes bya bar sbyar te //
translated: This should be applied to “the one who is in the flesh should ask.”

original: gal te dang pos dri ba nyams te ma dris na de'i 'og ma'i dge slong gis dri bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dang pos dri ba nyams te ma dris na de'i 'og ma'i dge slong gis dri bar bya ba'o //
translated: If the first one asks with a fault and does not ask, the next monk should ask.

original: glang po che dang mi'i 'o ma ngag btung bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glang po che dang mi'i 'o ma ngag btung bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not drink the milk of an elephant or a human.

original: rab tu byung bas bal glang mo dang bud med kyi 'o ma btung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung bas bal glang mo dang bud med kyi 'o ma btung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One who has gone forth should not drink the milk of an elephant or a woman.

original: pags pa dang rma bsku ba dang snar blugs pa dang mig skud cing bza' btung mi byed pa la skyon chags pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pags pa dang rma bsku ba dang snar blugs pa dang mig skud cing bza' btung mi byed pa la skyon chags pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no fault in anointing the skin, anointing a wound, using as a nasal medication, using as an ointment for the eyes, and eating and drinking.

original: sha dang 'o ma rung ba ma yin pa la sogs pas zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sha dang 'o ma rung ba ma yin pa la sogs pas zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This should be applied to “the flesh, milk, and so on that are not suitable.”

original: de dag gis pags pa skud pa dang rma skud pa dang snar blugs pa dang @224a * //
analyzed: de dag gis pags pa skud pa dang rma skud pa dang snar blugs pa dang @224a * //
translated: There is no fault in using those to anoint the skin, anoint a wound, use as a nasal medication, use as an ointment for the eyes, and eat and drink.

original: mig skud cing bza' btung mi byed pa la ni skyon chags pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig skud cing bza' btung mi byed pa la ni skyon chags pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no offense if one is blind or if one is not eating or drinking.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa sman du rung ba ma lags pa dag dang bskol ba'i 'bru mar 'tshal du rung ngam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa sman du rung ba ma lags pa dag dang bskol ba'i 'bru mar 'tshal du rung ngam /
translated: Here the text is: “Venerable, is it proper to drink oil that has been boiled with unsuitable vegetables?

original: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: Upāli, it is not proper.

original: lus skud pa dang rma'i bsku mnye bya ba dang / snar blugs pa'i las bya ba ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lus skud pa dang rma'i bsku mnye bya ba dang / snar blugs pa'i las bya ba ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one anoints the body, if one anoints a wound, or if one performs the rite of pouring oil into the ears.

original: btsun pa bud med kyi 'o ma 'tshal du rung ngam /
analyzed: btsun pa bud med kyi 'o ma 'tshal du rung ngam /
translated: Venerable, is it proper to drink the milk of a woman?

original: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: Upāli, it is not proper.

original: mig bsku ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽nad pas ni zhun mar dang 'bru mar chad dang 'dres pa btung bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mig bsku ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no // nad pas ni zhun mar dang 'bru mar chad dang 'dres pa btung bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense if one anoints the eyes.🔽One who is sick may drink clarified butter and oil mixed with alcohol.

original: gang zag nad pas ni zhun mar dang 'bru mar chang dang 'dres par gyur pa btung bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zag nad pas ni zhun mar dang 'bru mar chang dang 'dres par gyur pa btung bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: One who is sick may drink clarified butter and oil mixed with alcohol.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig zhun mar dang 'bru mar skyems dang lhan cig 'dres par gyur na 'tshal du rung ngam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig zhun mar dang 'bru mar skyems dang lhan cig 'dres par gyur na 'tshal du rung ngam /
translated: Here the text is: “Venerable, if ghee and oil are mixed with a drink, is it suitable to drink it?

original: nye ba 'khor rung ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rung ste /
translated: Upāli, it is suitable,

original: de yang nad pas yin gyi mi na bas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang nad pas yin gyi mi na bas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: but only for the sick, not for those who are not sick.”

original: chang ma yin pa nyid na nyes pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chang ma yin pa nyid na nyes pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not beer, there is no offense.

original: chang dag chang ma yin pa nyid du gyur na thams cad la nyes par mi 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: chang dag chang ma yin pa nyid du gyur na thams cad la nyes par mi 'gyur pa ste /
translated: If beer becomes not beer, there is no offense for anyone.

original: 'dir chang ma yin pa nyid ces bya bas ni de'i dri dang ro gnyi ga med par gyur pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir chang ma yin pa nyid ces bya bas ni de'i dri dang ro gnyi ga med par gyur pa bstan te /
translated: Here, not beer indicates that both its smell and taste are absent.

original: gal te dri dang ro'i myang ba myos par mi byed pa dag ces gsungs pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dri dang ro'i myang ba myos par mi byed pa dag ces gsungs pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the statement, “If the taste and smell of beer do not intoxicate.”

original: de ni bskol ba las 'grub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni bskol ba las 'grub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is established by boiling.

original: chang ma yin pa nyid de ni bskol ba las chang yang chang ma yin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chang ma yin pa nyid de ni bskol ba las chang yang chang ma yin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it is not beer, it becomes beer by boiling.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa myos par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba zhugs kyis bskol na 'tshal du rung ngam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa myos par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba zhugs kyis bskol na 'tshal du rung ngam /
translated: “If one drinks beer that has been boiled by a monk who has incurred a downfall, is it allowable?”

original: nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: “Upāli, it is allowable.”

original: / de ni nas brngos pas btab cing sa'i nang du bcug na tshva nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / de ni nas brngos pas btab cing sa'i nang du bcug na tshva nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one pours boiled barley into it and buries it in the ground, it will become salt.”

original: chang de'i nang du yos blugs te snod dang bcas par sa'i nang du bcug na tshvar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chang de'i nang du yos blugs te snod dang bcas par sa'i nang du bcug na tshvar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one pours roasted barley into that beer and buries the container in the ground, it will become salt.

original: rgun gyi khu ba ni bskol na chang nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgun gyi khu ba ni bskol na chang nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The juice of grapes does not become beer when boiled.”

original: rgun gyi khu ba btsir ma thag tu bskol na yun ring du bzhag kyang phyes chang du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgun gyi khu ba btsir ma thag tu bskol na yun ring du bzhag kyang phyes chang du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one boils grape juice immediately after it is pressed, it will not become beer even if it is left for a long time.

original: dron zha yin no //
analyzed: dron zha yin no //
translated: It will remain warm.🔽Here the text states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni bskol te gzhag par bya zhing dge 'dun gyi dus ma yin pa'i btung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bskol te gzhag par bya zhing dge 'dun gyi dus ma yin pa'i btung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It should be boiled and then set aside. It becomes allowable for the Saṅgha to drink it at an inappropriate time.”

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid la ni yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid la ni yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It does not exist in what is not different.”

original: dper na til dag las til @224b mar tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa dang bu ram shing dag las khu ba tha dad pa nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: dper na til dag las til @224b mar tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa dang bu ram shing dag las khu ba tha dad pa nyid ma yin pas /
translated: For example, oil is not different from sesame seeds, and juice is not different from sugarcane.

original: til de la yang til mar yod pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: til de la yang til mar yod pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, sesame seeds do not have oil,

original: bu rum shing de la yang bu ram yod pa nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o //🔽de lta bas na til byin len byas pas til mar byin len byas par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bu rum shing de la yang bu ram yod pa nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o // de lta bas na til byin len byas pas til mar byin len byas par mi 'gyur la /
translated: and sugarcane does not have sugar.🔽Thus, one should understand that when sesame seeds are received, oil is not received.

original: bu ram shing byin len byas pas kyang bu ram byin len byas par mi 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bu ram shing byin len byas pas kyang bu ram byin len byas par mi 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: And when sugarcane is received, sugar is not received.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: dge slong gis til byin len byas te btsags na de'i til mar gzod byin len bya dgos la /
analyzed: dge slong gis til byin len byas te btsags na de'i til mar gzod byin len bya dgos la /
translated: When a monk receives sesame seeds and then presses them, he must receive the oil.

original: bu ram shing byin len byas te btsir na de'i khu ba gzod byin len bya dgos so //
analyzed: bu ram shing byin len byas te btsir na de'i khu ba gzod byin len bya dgos so //
translated: When he receives sugarcane and then presses it, he must receive the juice.

original: des na byin len byas pa'i til dang bu ram shing ni bzar rung la /
analyzed: des na byin len byas pa'i til dang bu ram shing ni bzar rung la /
translated: Therefore, sesame seeds and sugarcane that have been received are suitable to be eaten.

original: de nyid btsir cing btsags pa'i til mar dang khu ba ni yang byin len ma byas par bzar mi rung ngo //🔽bag chags su gyur pa nyid ni yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid btsir cing btsags pa'i til mar dang khu ba ni yang byin len ma byas par bzar mi rung ngo // bag chags su gyur pa nyid ni yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The oil and juice that are pressed and squeezed out of them are not to be eaten without being offered to the Sangha.🔽The latent impressions are real.

original: bag chags su gyur pa nyid ni yod pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags su gyur pa nyid ni yod pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The latent impressions are real.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa zhag rung ba ma lags pa dag dang bskol ba'i dbon tsha 'tshal du rung ngam mi rung /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa zhag rung ba ma lags pa dag dang bskol ba'i dbon tsha 'tshal du rung ngam mi rung /
translated: Here the text is: “Venerable, is it permissible to eat the oil cake and salt boiled with the unallowable oils?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said:

original: nad pas ni bzar rung la min bas ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nad pas ni bzar rung la min bas ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is permissible for the sick, but not for those who are not sick.🔽The same applies to meat.

original: sha la yang de bzhin no zhes zhu ba las rdzas rung ba ma yin pa dang 'bags pa bza' bar bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes gsungs pa de 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sha la yang de bzhin no zhes zhu ba las rdzas rung ba ma yin pa dang 'bags pa bza' bar bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes gsungs pa de 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is what is included in the statement in the Questions of Revata Sūtra that substances that are not allowable and those that are contaminated are not to be eaten.

original: chang gi sred pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i sman skam po'i phye ma chang gi dris bsgos pa'i chu dang sbyar ba btung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chang gi sred pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i sman skam po'i phye ma chang gi dris bsgos pa'i chu dang sbyar ba btung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to free oneself from craving for alcohol, one should drink a beverage prepared from the powder of dried medicinal roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits, mixed with water that has been perfumed with the smell of alcohol.

original: chang 'dod pa'i sred pa yod na de dang dbral bar bya ba'i phyir chang gi yo byad du rung ba'i rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i sman skam po'i phye ma chang gi rlangs pas bsgos pa dang sbyar ba'i chu btung🔽bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: chang 'dod pa'i sred pa yod na de dang dbral bar bya ba'i phyir chang gi yo byad du rung ba'i rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i sman skam po'i phye ma chang gi rlangs pas bsgos pa dang sbyar ba'i chu btung bar bya ba ste /
translated: If one has craving for alcohol, in order to free oneself from that, one should drink a beverage prepared from the powder of dried medicinal roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits, which are suitable as ingredients for alcohol, mixed with water that has been perfumed with the vapor of alcohol.

original: de ni phye ma dang sbyar ba'i btung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phye ma dang sbyar ba'i btung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called a beverage prepared from powder.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na chang ngu rung ba'i rtsa ba dang sdong bu la sogs pa'i rdzas skam po gang dag yin pa de dag phye mar byas te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na chang ngu rung ba'i rtsa ba dang sdong bu la sogs pa'i rdzas skam po gang dag yin pa de dag phye mar byas te /
translated: Here the text says, “Therefore, any dried substances such as roots, stems, and so on, which are suitable as ingredients for alcohol, should be made into a powder and mixed with water that has been perfumed with the vapor of alcohol.

original: ras ma dkar por phur nas chang gi shugs dag dang bral ba'i snod ma gang bar bcang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: ras ma dkar por phur nas chang gi shugs dag dang bral ba'i snod ma gang bar bcang bar bya zhing /
translated: and having wrapped it in a white cloth, it should be placed in a vessel that is not filled with the force of the beer.

original: de nas phyung ste byi dor byas nas zas dang ma 'bags pa'i chu dang lhan cig sbyar zhing btsags te btung bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas phyung ste byi dor byas nas zas dang ma 'bags pa'i chu dang lhan cig sbyar zhing btsags te btung bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Then, having taken it out and cleaned it, it is permitted to drink it after mixing it with water that is not contaminated with food and straining it.

original: @225a * // chang gi dris bsgo bar bya'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: @225a * // chang gi dris bsgo bar bya'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: If it is said that it should be announced as beer,

original: ji ltar bsgo bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgo bar bya zhe na /
translated: how should it be announced?

original: de'i phyir chang dang bcas pa'i snod du dpyangs te gzhag pas bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chang dang bcas pa'i snod du dpyangs te gzhag pas bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said that it should be announced by hanging it in a vessel with beer.

original: sman gyi phye ma'i phur ma de chang dang bcas pa'i snod kyi nang du chang la ma reg par dpyangs te gzhag pas bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: sman gyi phye ma'i phur ma de chang dang bcas pa'i snod kyi nang du chang la ma reg par dpyangs te gzhag pas bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: That bag of medicinal powder should be announced by hanging it in a vessel with beer without touching the beer.

original: reg pa bsrung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: reg pa bsrung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Protecting from contact means

original: phye ma'i phur ma de chang dang reg par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir bsrung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: phye ma'i phur ma de chang dang reg par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir bsrung bar bya ba'o //
translated: protecting it so that the bag of powder does not come into contact with the beer.

original: de'i phyir ma gang ba dang shugs dang bral ba nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma gang ba dang shugs dang bral ba nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it should be hung in a place that is not filled with the smell of alcohol and is free of the power of alcohol.

original: gang gi phyir reg pa bsrung dgos pa de'i phyir chang gis ma gang ba'i snod chang gi shugs dang bral ba nyid kyi nang du dpyangs te gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir reg pa bsrung dgos pa de'i phyir chang gis ma gang ba'i snod chang gi shugs dang bral ba nyid kyi nang du dpyangs te gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Because contact must be protected, therefore, a vessel that is not filled with alcohol should be hung in a place that is free of the power of alcohol.

original: gzhan du na gyen du ldud pas reg par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gyen du ldud pas reg par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be in contact with the alcohol because it would be immersed in it.

original: de bzhin du ro med par byed pa dang dus ma yin par btung ba la zas dang yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du ro med par byed pa dang dus ma yin par btung ba la zas dang yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Similarly, it is said that food and contact must be protected in regard to that which is made tasteless and that which is drunk at the wrong time.

original: ji ltar phye ma chang dang reg pa bsrung bar bya ba yin te de bzhin du rdzas gang gis btung ba de ro med par byed par 'gyur ba'i rdzas de dang reg pa yang bsrung bar bya ba dang / dus ma yin par btung ba la zas dang reg pa yang bsrung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar phye ma chang dang reg pa bsrung bar bya ba yin te de bzhin du rdzas gang gis btung ba de ro med par byed par 'gyur ba'i rdzas de dang reg pa yang bsrung bar bya ba dang / dus ma yin par btung ba la zas dang reg pa yang bsrung bar bya ba'o //
translated: Just as flour and alcohol must be protected from contact, so too, food and contact must be protected in regard to a substance that will make the drink tasteless and in regard to drinking at the wrong time.

original: mdzes pa yang bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdzes pa yang bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also good to be attractive.

original: phye ma skam po chang gi dris bsgos pa dang sbyar ba'i chu de zas dang reg pa de las de ltar bsrung bar bya ba nyid mdzes pa yin te de bzang ba'o //
analyzed: phye ma skam po chang gi dris bsgos pa dang sbyar ba'i chu de zas dang reg pa de las de ltar bsrung bar bya ba nyid mdzes pa yin te de bzang ba'o //
translated: That is proper and good.

original: de'i phyir ras ma dkar pos btsag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ras ma dkar pos btsag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, one should be purified with a white cloth.

original: gang gi phyir mdzes pa bzang ba de'i phyir ras ma dkar pos btsag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdzes pa bzang ba de'i phyir ras ma dkar pos btsag par bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is proper and good, therefore one should be purified with a white cloth.

original: nad pas chang ni rtsva mchog gis kyang mi btung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: nad pas chang ni rtsva mchog gis kyang mi btung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: The sick should not drink alcohol even with kuśa grass.
