original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa thams cad nad pa'i yul la rjes su gnang ba de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa thams cad nad pa'i yul la rjes su gnang ba de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is a special case taught for all proscribed offenses that are permitted for the sick.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'akya na bar gyur pa dag la de nyid ma gnang bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'akya na bar gyur pa dag la de nyid ma gnang bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Just as the Blessed One did not allow that for the sick Śākyas.

original: de ltar yang dge slong gang nga la ston pa zhes zer ba khyed cag gis chang tha na rtsva mchog gis kyang mi blud mi btung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang dge slong gang nga la ston pa zhes zer ba khyed cag gis chang tha na rtsva mchog gis kyang mi blud mi btung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, you who say that I am your teacher should not drink alcohol, even as much as can be held on a blade of grass.

original: dge bsnyen yan chad thams cad kyis mi blud do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge bsnyen yan chad thams cad kyis mi blud do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: No one should drink alcohol, beginning with the lay practitioner.

original: dge bsnyen gyi mtha' yan chad chos 'di pa bslab pa ma blangs pa thams cad kyis kyang chang blud par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi mtha' yan chad chos 'di pa bslab pa ma blangs pa thams cad kyis kyang chang blud par mi bya'o //
translated: No one should drink alcohol, beginning with the lay practitioner, and including those who have not taken the precepts of this teaching.🔽The text says:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge bsnyen gyis mi bya ba'i las drug ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge bsnyen gyis mi bya ba'i las drug ste /
translated: There are six actions that a lay practitioner should not do:

original: sems can btsong pa dang / @225b mtshon cha btsong ba dang / chang btsong ba dang / dug btsong ba dang / rgya skyegs kyi las dang / til btsir ba'i las so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can btsong pa dang / @225b mtshon cha btsong ba dang / chang btsong ba dang / dug btsong ba dang / rgya skyegs kyi las dang / til btsir ba'i las so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: selling living beings, selling weapons, selling intoxicants, selling poisons, running a tavern, and running a place for the sale of intoxicants.

original: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las gzhan pa thams cad la gso ba'i don nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las gzhan pa thams cad la gso ba'i don nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The remainder is that all actions other than those that are naturally reprehensible are reprehensible only when there is a vow, except for the purpose of healing.

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa thams cad bkag pa la gso ba'i don nyid du ni ma gtogs te de'i don du ni dgag pa med do zhes gsungs pa de'i lhag ma ni myos par 'gyur ba'i btung ba bkag pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa thams cad bkag pa la gso ba'i don nyid du ni ma gtogs te de'i don du ni dgag pa med do zhes gsungs pa de'i lhag ma ni myos par 'gyur ba'i btung ba bkag pa 'di yin te /
translated: The remainder is this prohibition of intoxicating beverages.

original: 'di ni gso ba'i don du yang bkag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gso ba'i don du yang bkag par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is prohibited even for the purpose of healing.

original: nad pa gso ba'i don de nyid du bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa lhag par spyod pa la ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: nad pa gso ba'i don de nyid du bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa lhag par spyod pa la ni ltung ba med de /
translated: There is no offense for one who engages in proscribed offenses for the purpose of healing a patient.

original: dper na / sha bsngos par shes na bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcag pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa thams cad gso ba'i don nyid du ma gtogs so zhes bstan pa de'i lhag ma dmigs kyis bsal ba ni myos par 'gyur ba'i ltung
analyzed: dper na / sha bsngos par shes na bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcag pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa thams cad gso ba'i don nyid du ma gtogs so zhes bstan pa de'i lhag ma dmigs kyis bsal ba ni myos par 'gyur ba'i ltung
translated: For example, it is taught that all proscribed offenses are prohibited except for the purpose of healing, such as the statement, “If one knows that meat is spoiled, one should not eat it.”

original: ba ma gtogs so zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: ba ma gtogs so zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The remainder of that is the exception, which is this: “Except for the intoxicating downfall.”

original: sdig pa thams cad kyi sgor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs kyis bsal ba med do //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad kyi sgor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs kyis bsal ba med do //
translated: There is no exception to this rule, because alcohol is the door to all sins.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa nad pa'i g-yog ji ltar bgyi /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa nad pa'i g-yog ji ltar bgyi /
translated: Here is the text: “Venerable, how should one care for the sick?

original: nye ba 'khor rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma gtogs par ci nas kyang nad pa sos par 'gyur ba ltar ro //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma gtogs par ci nas kyang nad pa sos par 'gyur ba ltar ro //
translated: Upāli, except for natural sins, in such a way that the sick person recovers.

original: de lta bas na dge slong gis sgog skya bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gis sgog skya bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, a monk should not eat garlic, and so on.

original: sgog skya dang kun dong dang ke'u bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgog skya dang kun dong dang ke'u bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not eat garlic, onions, or leeks,

original: btsos kyang rung ma btsos kyang rung ba'o //🔽nad pas ni dben pa'i phyogs su'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btsos kyang rung ma btsos kyang rung ba'o // nad pas ni dben pa'i phyogs su'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: whether cooked or uncooked.

original: sgog skya la sogs pa bza' ba'o //🔽zos nas sgog skya ni zhag bdun /
analyzed: sgog skya la sogs pa bza' ba'o // zos nas sgog skya ni zhag bdun /
translated: If one is sick, one may eat garlic, and so on, in a secluded place.🔽After eating garlic, one may not enter the monastery for seven days.

original: kun dong zhag gsum ke'u ni zhag gcig ma lon par gtsug lag khang du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun dong zhag gsum ke'u ni zhag gcig ma lon par gtsug lag khang du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: After eating onions, for three days. After eating leeks, for one day.

original: nad pas dben pa'i phyogs su sgog skya la sogs pa zos nas gtsug lag khang du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nad pas dben pa'i phyogs su sgog skya la sogs pa zos nas gtsug lag khang du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: A sick person should not enter a monastery after eating garlic, etc.

original: zos ma thag tu 'jug par mi bya bar ma zad kyi sgog skya ni zos nas zhag bdun ma lon par 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zos ma thag tu 'jug par mi bya bar ma zad kyi sgog skya ni zos nas zhag bdun ma lon par 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: Not only should one not enter immediately after eating garlic, but one should not enter for seven days after eating garlic.

original: kun dong ni zos nas zhag gsum ma lon par 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: kun dong ni zos nas zhag gsum ma lon par 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not enter for three days after eating onion.

original: ke'u ni zos nas zhag gcig ma lon par 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ke'u ni zos nas zhag gcig ma lon par 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not enter for one day after eating leek.

original: @226a * // gnas mal la mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @226a * // gnas mal la mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not use bedding.

original: longs spyad par ro //
analyzed: longs spyad par ro //
translated: One should not use it.

original: bshad pa'i sar 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bshad pa'i sar 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not enter the place of teaching.

original: dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: This refers to the Saṅgha.

original: gci ba'i sar mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: gci ba'i sar mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang /
translated: One should not enter the place of defecating.

original: dge 'dun gyir 'jug par ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyir 'jug par ro //
translated: This refers to the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang /
translated: One should not enter the Saṅgha.

original: nad pa sgog skya la sogs pa zos pas so //
analyzed: nad pa sgog skya la sogs pa zos pas so //
translated: This refers to a sick person who has eaten garlic, etc.

original: mchod rten gyi nyen kor du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi nyen kor du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not enter the vicinity of a stūpa.

original: mchod rten gyi nyen kor du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchod rten gyi nyen kor du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go near a stupa.

original: de'i thag ni 'dom gang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i thag ni 'dom gang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The distance is one fathom.

original: mchod rten gyi nyen kor de'i'o //
analyzed: mchod rten gyi nyen kor de'i'o //
translated: This is the distance near a stupa.

original: 'dir gzhung ni mchod rten gyi nyen kor 'dom gang spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni mchod rten gyi nyen kor 'dom gang spang bar bya ste /
translated: The text says: “One should avoid going within one fathom of a stupa.

original: dge slong dag mchod rten ni lta mngon par dad pa can dag gis kun nas gang ba yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag mchod rten ni lta mngon par dad pa can dag gis kun nas gang ba yin la /
translated: Monks, stupas are filled with those who have great faith.

original: lha rnams ni gtsang sbra 'dod pa yin pas /
analyzed: lha rnams ni gtsang sbra 'dod pa yin pas /
translated: The gods desire purity.

original: dri de ni de dag dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dri de ni de dag dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because that smell is disagreeable to them.”

original: khyim pa dag la chos bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang nad bsgo skya la sogs pa zos pas so //🔽khyim dag tu 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim pa dag la chos bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang nad bsgo skya la sogs pa zos pas so // khyim dag tu 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should not teach the Dharma to householders” means one should not teach the Dharma to those who have not taken the purificatory fast precepts and so on.

original: khyim pa'i khyim dag tu'o //🔽skye bos gang ba'i phyogs su mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim pa'i khyim dag tu'o // skye bos gang ba'i phyogs su mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should not go to the houses of householders” means one should not go to the houses of householders.🔽“One should not go to a place where people gather” means one should not go to a place where people gather.

original: skye bos gang ba'i phyogs su yang 'gro bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye bos gang ba'i phyogs su yang 'gro bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: “One should not go to a place where people are” means one should not go to a place where people are.

original: mjug tu khrus bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mjug tu khrus bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At the end, one should bathe.

original: nad pas de ltar sgog skya la sogs pa bsten pa'i dgos pa bsgrubs zin nas mjug tu khrus bya ba'o //
analyzed: nad pas de ltar sgog skya la sogs pa bsten pa'i dgos pa bsgrubs zin nas mjug tu khrus bya ba'o //
translated: Having accomplished the purpose of relying on garlic and so on, at the end one should bathe.

original: gos dag gi dri ni bkru ba dang du bdag gis bsal lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos dag gi dri ni bkru ba dang du bdag gis bsal lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The smell of the clothes is removed by washing and by the wind.

original: nad pas sgeg skya la sogs pa bsten pa de'i gos dag la dri chags pa ni thabs de gnyis kyis bsal bar bya ba'o /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: nad pas sgeg skya la sogs pa bsten pa de'i gos dag la dri chags pa ni thabs de gnyis kyis bsal bar bya ba'o / // / bam po lnga bcu bdun pa /
translated: The smell that adheres to the clothes of the patient who relies on garlic and so on is removed by those two methods.

original: rung ba nyid du byin gyis brlab par btsos pa dang gnas pa dag ni phyi rol dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rung ba nyid du byin gyis brlab par btsos pa dang gnas pa dag ni phyi rol dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The consecration of the place and the consecration of the food are like the external.🔽For example, in the case of a monk, the place is the monastery and the wilderness and so on that are outside the one cubit perimeter.

original: dper na dge slong gi gnas nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa nas phyi rol du gyur pa'i kun dga' ra ba dang 'brog dgon pa la sogs pa'i gnas gang yin pa der zas 'tshod pa dang 'chang ba dag la nang du btsos pa dang nang du zhag
analyzed: dper na dge slong gi gnas nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa nas phyi rol du gyur pa'i kun dga' ra ba dang 'brog dgon pa la sogs pa'i gnas gang yin pa der zas 'tshod pa dang 'chang ba dag la nang du btsos pa dang nang du zhag
translated: The cooking and keeping of food in those places is like cooking and keeping food inside the perimeter.

original: lon pa'i nyes pas gos par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gtsug lag khang gi nang du yang rung ba nyid du byin gyis brlabs pa'i rung ba'i khang ba byas na der yang nyes pa de dag mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lon pa'i nyes pas gos par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gtsug lag khang gi nang du yang rung ba nyid du byin gyis brlabs pa'i rung ba'i khang ba byas na der yang nyes pa de dag mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Just as one is not defiled by the fault of stealing when one takes back one’s own property, in the same way, if one makes a suitable house consecrated as suitable in the monastery, then those faults do not occur there.

original: rung ba'i khang pa de byin gyis brlab tu rung bar bstan pa'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rung ba'i khang pa de byin gyis brlab tu rung bar bstan pa'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to show that that suitable house is suitable to be consecrated, it says “one should consecrate it.”

original: rung ba'i @226b khang pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rung ba'i @226b khang pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It should be connected with “a suitable house.”

original: shing drung dang glang po che'i rab dang mu steg can gyi 'dug gnas dang rgyal po'i pho brang sa dang dge slong ma'i dbyar khang dang gtsug lag khang gi pang ri ma dang sgo khang dang khyams dang bsro gang dang dpong sa'i ra ba dag tu mi bya'o🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing drung dang glang po che'i rab dang mu steg can gyi 'dug gnas dang rgyal po'i pho brang sa dang dge slong ma'i dbyar khang dang gtsug lag khang gi pang ri ma dang sgo khang dang khyams dang bsro gang dang dpong sa'i ra ba dag tu mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not make it under a tree, in an elephant stable, in a non-Buddhist’s dwelling, in a king’s palace, in a nun’s rainy season retreat house, in a monastery’s outer wall, in a gatehouse, in a courtyard, in a sauna, or in a latrine.

original: rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It should be connected with “consecrate a suitable house.”

original: shing drung la sogs pa de dag tu rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shing drung la sogs pa de dag tu rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: One should not consecrate a suitable house at the foot of a tree, and so on,

original: gtum phugs can dang smyon thabs mkhan dang zil gyis gnon par byed pa dag yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtum phugs can dang smyon thabs mkhan dang zil gyis gnon par byed pa dag yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one should avoid those who are violent, who are mad, and who are overbearing.

original: kha cig las bla gab med pa dang me khang dang mchod rten gyi gzhi dang khyim bdag gi gzhir yang zhes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig las bla gab med pa dang me khang dang mchod rten gyi gzhi dang khyim bdag gi gzhir yang zhes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Some texts say, “One should not consecrate a suitable house in the open air, in a kitchen, in the foundation of a stupa, or in the foundation of a householder’s building.”

original: gzhung kha cig las de dag tu yang rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las de dag tu yang rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Some texts say that one should not consecrate a suitable house in those places.

original: 'di dag dang sngar smos pa dag tu rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag dang sngar smos pa dag tu rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not consecrate a suitable house in those places or in the places mentioned earlier.

original: deng g-yos dang btso ba yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: deng g-yos dang btso ba yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not cook or prepare food there.

original: shing drung la sogs pa dang blag ba med pa deng ro //
analyzed: shing drung la sogs pa dang blag ba med pa deng ro //
translated: One should not prepare food in the open air, at the foot of a tree, and so on.

original: 'dir g-yos zhes bya ba ni 'bras chan la bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir g-yos zhes bya ba ni 'bras chan la bya ba'o //
translated: Here, “to prepare” means to cook rice.

original: de las gzhan pa ni btso ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni btso ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The other is cooking.

original: dge slong gis de gnyis phyogs mi dben par gzhan gyi lag tu yang byed du mi gzhug na rang gis bya ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dge slong gis de gnyis phyogs mi dben par gzhan gyi lag tu yang byed du mi gzhug na rang gis bya ba lta ci smos te /
translated: A monk should not have another do these two actions in an exposed place, much less do them himself,

original: dang po nyid nas bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po nyid nas bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are prohibited from the beginning.

original: de lta bas na dge slong gis shing drung la sogs pa dang bla gab med pa la sogs pa der g-yos dang btso ba gzhan byed du yang mi gzhug ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gis shing drung la sogs pa dang bla gab med pa la sogs pa der g-yos dang btso ba gzhan byed du yang mi gzhug ste /
translated: Therefore, a monk should not have another cook or boil food in a place such as under a tree or in the open,

original: tshul ma yin pas gzhan dag las zil gyis gnon pa dang mi gus pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul ma yin pas gzhan dag las zil gyis gnon pa dang mi gus pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be improper to surpass others and to be disrespectful to them.

original: chos pa'i byi dor yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos pa'i byi dor yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not even clean up after a meal.

original: shing drung la sogs pa dang bla gab med pa la sogs pa der zas tshos zin pa'i byi dor yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: shing drung la sogs pa dang bla gab med pa la sogs pa der zas tshos zin pa'i byi dor yang mi bya'o //
translated: He should not clean up after a meal in a place such as under a tree or in the open.

original: tshos pa zhes bya ba ni mi snyi ba rnams kyi ni sum cha bangs pa na tshos pa yin no //
analyzed: tshos pa zhes bya ba ni mi snyi ba rnams kyi ni sum cha bangs pa na tshos pa yin no //
translated: “Cooked” means that for those who are not tender, one-third is cooked when it is boiled.

original: snyi ba rnams kyi ni kha dog gyur pa ni tshos pa yin no//
analyzed: snyi ba rnams kyi ni kha dog gyur pa ni tshos pa yin no//
translated: For the soft ones, the color change is the cooking.

original: khu ba rnams kyi ni lan gnyis khol bar gyur pa na chos pa yin te /
analyzed: khu ba rnams kyi ni lan gnyis khol bar gyur pa na chos pa yin te /
translated: For the liquids, the cooking is when they boil twice.

original: chos pa de dag dge slong rang gis gnas de dag tu byi dor bya ba bkag go //
analyzed: chos pa de dag dge slong rang gis gnas de dag tu byi dor bya ba bkag go //
translated: Those monks are prohibited from cleaning those places.

original: 'di la dus bzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la dus bzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There are four times for this,

original: rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlabs pa 'di la dus bzhi yod pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlabs pa 'di la dus bzhi yod pa'o //
translated: There are four times for this consecrated suitable house.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽dang po so phag @227a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na / dang po so phag @227a * //
translated: What are they?

original: 'grems pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'grems pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: First, the bricks are laid out.

original: rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus gcig ni rung ba'i khang pa de nyid thog ma'i rtsig pa'i tshe dang po so phag gi gcal 'grems pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus gcig ni rung ba'i khang pa de nyid thog ma'i rtsig pa'i tshe dang po so phag gi gcal 'grems pa'i tshe'o //
translated: This is the first time for the consecrated suitable house.

original: phyis las sar pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyis las sar pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Later, it is still under construction.

original: dang po so phag bkram pa'i 'og tu de phyin chad nas ji srid du las sar pa zhes bya ba de'i mkhar len gyi las ma rdzogs shing da dung las sar pa'i mjug yod pa nyid kyi bar gyi dus gang yang rung ba de yang dus gzhan cig🔽yin pa'o // gzhan gyi tshe dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang po so phag bkram pa'i 'og tu de phyin chad nas ji srid du las sar pa zhes bya ba de'i mkhar len gyi las ma rdzogs shing da dung las sar pa'i mjug yod pa nyid kyi bar gyi dus gang yang rung ba de yang dus gzhan cig yin pa'o // gzhan gyi tshe dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The twelfth is when the work of the door lock is completed, but the work of the door keyhole is not yet completed, and any time in between.🔽The thirteenth is when the work of the door keyhole is completed, but the work of the door latch is not yet completed, and any time in between.🔽The fourteenth is when the work of the door latch is completed, but the work of the door bolt is not yet completed, and any time in between.🔽The fifteenth is when the work of the door bolt is completed, but the work of the door handle is not yet completed, and any time in between.

original: las sar pa mthar phyin pa'i 'og tu dus gzhan gyi chog nas der dang po dge slong zhugs pa nas phyis nam gyi che de na dge slong 'ga' yang med par ma gyur pa'i bar gyi dus gang yang rung ba de yang dus gzhan cig yin pa'o //
analyzed: las sar pa mthar phyin pa'i 'og tu dus gzhan gyi chog nas der dang po dge slong zhugs pa nas phyis nam gyi che de na dge slong 'ga' yang med par ma gyur pa'i bar gyi dus gang yang rung ba de yang dus gzhan cig yin pa'o //
translated: The sixteenth is when the work of the door handle is completed, but the work of the door lock is not yet completed, and any time in between.

original: de dag med pa ni gnas pa'i phyir dge slong dag phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag med pa ni gnas pa'i phyir dge slong dag phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The seventeenth is when the work of

original: de na dge slong sngar gnas gnas pa de dag med pa na dge slong phyi ma gzhan dag der gnas pa'i phyir gnas der phyin pa'i tshe kho na'i dus de yang dus gzhan cig yin pa ste /
analyzed: de na dge slong sngar gnas gnas pa de dag med pa na dge slong phyi ma gzhan dag der gnas pa'i phyir gnas der phyin pa'i tshe kho na'i dus de yang dus gzhan cig yin pa ste /
translated: The time when they arrive is also a different time.

original: dus bzhi po de dag las gang yang rung bar byin gyis brlabs kyang rung gi / rung ba'i khang pa gcig la yang dus de bzhi char du byin gyis brlabs par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus bzhi po de dag las gang yang rung bar byin gyis brlabs kyang rung gi / rung ba'i khang pa gcig la yang dus de bzhi char du byin gyis brlabs par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is permissible to consecrate any of those four times, but it is not permissible to consecrate a single suitable house for all four times.

original: de dag med pa na gnas pa'i phyir dge slong dag phyin pa zhes smos pa de'i phyin pa'i dus kyi tshigs cis bzung zhe na /
analyzed: de dag med pa na gnas pa'i phyir dge slong dag phyin pa zhes smos pa de'i phyin pa'i dus kyi tshigs cis bzung zhe na /
translated: Since monks come to live there when those former monks are no longer there, why is the time when they arrive called the time of arrival?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir bya ba gzhan rtsom pa dang ngal bso ba ma byas pa tshun chad ni de nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba gzhan rtsom pa dang ngal bso ba ma byas pa tshun chad ni de nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: As long as they do not begin other activities and rest, it is the same.

original: de gnyis dngos ni da dung ma byas la de gnyis la bya ba'i mtshams la thug pa tshun chad kyi dus ni der phyin pa zhes bya ba yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de gnyis dngos ni da dung ma byas la de gnyis la bya ba'i mtshams la thug pa tshun chad kyi dus ni der phyin pa zhes bya ba yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The actual times of those two are not yet past, but the time up to the point of engaging in those two is called “having gone” and is connected with that.

original: bya ba gzhan brtsam pa ma byas pa tshun chad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya ba gzhan brtsam pa ma byas pa tshun chad ces bya ba ni /
translated: Up to the point of engaging in other activities is the time of not resting.

original: phyin pa de dag gis phyin pa las gzhan pa'i bya ba chu btsag pa dang gtsug lag khang bsgro ba la sogs pa ji srid du ma brtsams pa tshun chad do //
analyzed: phyin pa de dag gis phyin pa las gzhan pa'i bya ba chu btsag pa dang gtsug lag khang bsgro ba la sogs pa ji srid du ma brtsams pa tshun chad do //
translated: Up to the point of engaging in other activities that are different from the activity of going, such as washing clothes or building a temple, is the time of not resting.

original: ngal bso ba ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngal bso ba ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Up to the point of not resting is the time of not resting.

original: stan la sogs pa 'dug par bya ba ji srid dum bshams pa tshun chad do //
analyzed: stan la sogs pa 'dug par bya ba ji srid dum bshams pa tshun chad do //
translated: Up to the point of not arranging seats and so on for sitting is the time of not resting.

original: de ltar bya ba gzhan brtsam pa dang ngal bso ba de gnyis ma byas pa tshun chad kyi bar gyi dus de ni de dag med pa na gnas pa'i phyir dge slong dag phyin pa nyid kyi dus yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bya ba gzhan brtsam pa dang ngal bso ba de gnyis ma byas pa tshun chad kyi bar gyi dus de ni de dag med pa na gnas pa'i phyir dge slong dag phyin pa nyid kyi dus yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The time between those two, engaging in other activities and resting, up to the point of not doing those is the time of the bhikṣus having gone, because they remain without doing those.

original: thams @227b cad la dge 'dun gyi las kyis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams @227b cad la dge 'dun gyi las kyis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All of them are to be consecrated by the Saṅgha's legal procedure, it is said.

original: dus bzhi pa ji skad bstan pa de dag thams cad la dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dus bzhi pa ji skad bstan pa de dag thams cad la dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: All of those four times, as they have been taught, are to be consecrated as suitable by the Saṅgha's legal procedure consisting of an announcement followed by a single proclamation.🔽The mantra for that is:

original: de'i sngags ni dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: The Saṅgha, reverend Sirs, please listen!

original: gnas thams cad grub ba ma bgyis pa'am lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par bzhed na gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang
analyzed: gnas thams cad grub ba ma bgyis pa'am lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par bzhed na gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang
translated: If this place, whether it is not yet completed or is completed, together with the inner boundary and the outer boundary of one fathom, is considered by the Saṅgha to be a suitable dwelling, then, if the time is suitable for the Saṅgha and it is acceptable, let the Saṅgha agree to it.

original: / dge 'dun gyis gnas thams cad grub pa'am bgyis pa'am lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyis rung ba'i khang par bgyi'o //
analyzed: / dge 'dun gyis gnas thams cad grub pa'am bgyis pa'am lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyis rung ba'i khang par bgyi'o //
translated: The Saṅgha will make this place, whether it is not yet completed or is completed, together with the inner boundary and the outer boundary of one fathom, a suitable dwelling.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the announcement.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen.

original: gnas thams cad grub pa'am bgyis pa'am lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par bzhed de /
analyzed: gnas thams cad grub pa'am bgyis pa'am lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par bzhed de /
translated: This site, which is complete, built, and ready, together with the inner boundary and the outer boundary one fathom wide, is considered by the saṅgha to be a suitable house.

original: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyi gnas thams cad du grub pa'am bgyis pa'am /
analyzed: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyi gnas thams cad du grub pa'am bgyis pa'am /
translated: Therefore, if the saṅgha is ready, the saṅgha will make this site, which is complete, built, and ready,

original: lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par bgyi na /
analyzed: lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par bgyi na /
translated: together with the inner boundary and the outer boundary one fathom wide, into a suitable house.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag gnas thams cad grub pa'am bgyis pa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag gnas thams cad grub pa'am bgyis pa'am /
translated: Those venerable ones who agree that this site, which is complete, built, and ready,

original: lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par bgyi bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang
analyzed: lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par bgyi bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang
translated: together with the inner boundary and the outer boundary one fathom wide, should be made into a suitable house, should remain silent. Those who do not agree should speak.🔽The saṅgha has agreed and is ready to

original: nas / dge 'dun gyi gnas thams cad grub pa'am /
analyzed: nas / dge 'dun gyi gnas thams cad grub pa'am /
translated: and the entire site of the Sangha is completed,

original: bgyis pa'am / lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang bar bgyis lags te /
analyzed: bgyis pa'am / lags pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang bar bgyis lags te /
translated: or is being made, or is made, together with the inner boundary and the outer perimeter one fathom wide, then this is made a suitable dwelling place of the Sangha.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: Since the Sangha has remained silent, this is how I will hold it.

original: /'dir gnas thams cad grub pa'am bgyis pa'am lags pa zhes tshig gsum smos pa ni gnas la rnam pa de lta bu gsum srid pas spyir bstan pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: /'dir gnas thams cad grub pa'am bgyis pa'am lags pa zhes tshig gsum smos pa ni gnas la rnam pa de lta bu gsum srid pas spyir bstan pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: Here, the three phrases “the entire site is completed, or is being made, or is made” are taught in general because three such types of sites are possible.

original: las byed pa'i dus na ni gnas de rnam pa de gsum gang yin pa gcig smos par bya ste /🔽dper na gnas thams cad @228a * //
analyzed: las byed pa'i dus na ni gnas de rnam pa de gsum gang yin pa gcig smos par bya ste / dper na gnas thams cad @228a * //
translated: But when the rite is being performed, one of these three types of sites should be stated.

original: grub pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyin kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di zhes bya ba lta bur sbyar te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: grub pa nang mtshams dang phyi rol nyin kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa 'di zhes bya ba lta bur sbyar te brjod par bya'o //
translated: For example, “The entire site is completed, together with the inner boundary and the outer perimeter one fathom wide.”

original: dang po gnyis la ni gang zag gis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang po gnyis la ni gang zag gis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The first two are also by the individual.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus dang po gnyis te /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus dang po gnyis te /
translated: The first two times are the times of consecration.🔽The first is the time of laying out the bricks, and the second is the time of the new work.

original: dang po so phag 'grems pa'o zhes bya ba dang / phyis las sar pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba de gnyis kyi dus su ni gang zag gis kyang phyin gyis brlab tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: dang po so phag 'grems pa'o zhes bya ba dang / phyis las sar pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba de gnyis kyi dus su ni gang zag gis kyang phyin gyis brlab tu rung ba'o //
translated: At these two times, it is suitable for a person to consecrate.

original: gang zag ji lta bus shen de'i phyir lag gi blas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang zag ji lta bus shen de'i phyir lag gi blas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: By what kind of person? Therefore it says “by a hand-appointed person.”

original: dang po shos la ni 'ba' zhig gis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang po shos la ni 'ba' zhig gis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the first of the two, it is also suitable for a single person.

original: dang po gnyis las kyang dang po shos te dang po so phag 'grems pa'o zhes bya ba'i dus der ni gang zag gi bla 'ba' zhig gis kyang byin gyis brlab tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: dang po gnyis las kyang dang po shos te dang po so phag 'grems pa'o zhes bya ba'i dus der ni gang zag gi bla 'ba' zhig gis kyang byin gyis brlab tu rung ba'o //
translated: In the first of the two, the first is the time of laying out the bricks. At that time, it is suitable for a single person to consecrate.

original: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dge slong gzhan dang lhan cig pas kyang rung bar ston to //
analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dge slong gzhan dang lhan cig pas kyang rung bar ston to //
translated: The word “also” indicates that it is also suitable for a single monk.

original: ji ltar phyin gyis brlab par bya zhe na de'i phyir brjod pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar phyin gyis brlab par bya zhe na de'i phyir brjod pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How is it consecrated? Therefore it says “by declaration.”

original: sems bskyed pa sngar btang nas tshig tu brjod pas byin gyis brlab par bya'i /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa sngar btang nas tshig tu brjod pas byin gyis brlab par bya'i /
translated: The consecration is done by generating the thought and speaking the words,

original: cang mi smras bas ni ma yin no //🔽'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar dge slong lag gi blas rdo bteg pa na de'i dang por gzhi 'di ni dge 'dun gyi dung ba'i khang par 'gyur ba'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing /
analyzed: cang mi smras bas ni ma yin no // 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar dge slong lag gi blas rdo bteg pa na de'i dang por gzhi 'di ni dge 'dun gyi dung ba'i khang par 'gyur ba'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing /
translated: not by remaining silent.

original: tshig tu yang brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig tu yang brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here is the text: When the monk Upāli lifts a stone, he should first generate the thought and speak the words, “This place will become a dwelling for the Saṅgha’s pleasure.”

original: 'dir gang zag gis byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags kyang gzhung de nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gang zag gis byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags kyang gzhung de nyid yin no //
translated: Here, the ritual and mantra for consecrating a person are also from that text.

original: dus dang por byin gyis brlabs pa'i rung ba'i khang pa 'di'i ming ni bteg pa'i mtha' las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus dang por byin gyis brlabs pa'i rung ba'i khang pa 'di'i ming ni bteg pa'i mtha' las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The name of this dwelling consecrated in the first period is called “Arisen from the End of Lifting.”

original: gnyis pa la ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag gis sems bsdu bas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag gis sems bsdu bas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the second, by many monks gathering their minds.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus gnyis pa ste /
translated: This is the second period of consecration.

original: phyis las sar pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i dus der ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag gir rung ba'i khang par sems bsdu bas byin gyis brlab par bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyis las sar pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i dus der ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag gir rung ba'i khang par sems bsdu bas byin gyis brlab par bya ba ste /
translated: At that time, many monks should consecrate a suitable house by collecting their minds.

original: 'di'i sngags ni /
analyzed: 'di'i sngags ni /
translated: Its mantra is:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gzhi 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par 'gyur bar sems bsdus shig ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gzhi 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par 'gyur bar sems bsdus shig ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Venerable ones, collect your minds in this house suitable for the Saṅgha.

original: dus gnyis bar byin gyis brlabs pa'i rung ba'i khang ba 'di'i ming ni sems bsdus pa'i mtha' las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus gnyis bar byin gyis brlabs pa'i rung ba'i khang ba 'di'i ming ni sems bsdus pa'i mtha' las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The name of this suitable house consecrated at the second time is derived from the end of collecting the mind.

original: gsum pa la ni las kho nas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni las kho nas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At the third, it is only by action.

original: byin gyis brlab pa'i @228b dus gsum pa ste /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa'i @228b dus gsum pa ste /
translated: The third time for consecration is:

original: gzhan gyi tshe dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i dus de'i tshe ni dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis byin gyis brlab pa kho nar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i dus de'i tshe ni dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis byin gyis brlab pa kho nar bya ba'o //
translated: At another time, a monk should not be separated from the site. At that time, the Saṅgha should only consecrate it with a two-part action.

original: dus gsum par byin gyis brlabs pa'i rung ba'i khang pa 'di'i ming ni las kyi mtha' las byung pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: dus gsum par byin gyis brlabs pa'i rung ba'i khang pa 'di'i ming ni las kyi mtha' las byung pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: The name of this suitable house consecrated in the third period is called arisen from the conclusion of an action.

original: / bzhi pa la ni ji snyed phyin pa de snyed kyis rung ba'i khang pa nyid du bsgrag pa'i tshig cig car brjod pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / bzhi pa la ni ji snyed phyin pa de snyed kyis rung ba'i khang pa nyid du bsgrag pa'i tshig cig car brjod pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the fourth, as many as have arrived should simultaneously proclaim the words that it is a suitable house.

original: byin gyis brlab pa'i dus bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa'i dus bzhi pa ste /
translated: This is the fourth period of consecration.

original: de dag med pa na gnas pa'i phyir dge slong dag phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i dus der ni dge slong gsum la sogs pa ji snyed der phyin pa de snyed kyis rung ba'i khang pa nyid du bsgrag pa'i tshig cig car brjod pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o
analyzed: de dag med pa na gnas pa'i phyir dge slong dag phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i dus der ni dge slong gsum la sogs pa ji snyed der phyin pa de snyed kyis rung ba'i khang pa nyid du bsgrag pa'i tshig cig car brjod pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o
translated: When those are absent, the monks who have arrived should consecrate it by simultaneously proclaiming the words that it is a suitable house, as many as have arrived there, such as three monks and so on.

original: // 'di'i tshe cho ga dang sngags ni /
analyzed: // 'di'i tshe cho ga dang sngags ni /
translated: At this time, the rite and mantra are as follows.

original: dge slong phyin pa thams cad kyis gzhi 'di ni dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par 'gyur ba'o zhes tshigs mthun par cig car brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong phyin pa thams cad kyis gzhi 'di ni dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par 'gyur ba'o zhes tshigs mthun par cig car brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The monks who have gone there should all say in unison, This place is suitable for the Saṅgha's dwelling.

original: dus bzhi par byin gyis brlab pa'i rung ba'i khang pa 'di'i ming ni 'phral la byung ba'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus bzhi par byin gyis brlab pa'i rung ba'i khang pa 'di'i ming ni 'phral la byung ba'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the fourth type of dwelling, called a temporary dwelling.

original: 'phral la byung ba zhes bya ba ni ched du ma bsams pa ste /
analyzed: 'phral la byung ba zhes bya ba ni ched du ma bsams pa ste /
translated: Temporary means not premeditated.

original: gnas 'di ched du ma bsams par byung pa yin pas 'phral la byung ba'i gnas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas 'di ched du ma bsams par byung pa yin pas 'phral la byung ba'i gnas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since this dwelling is not premeditated, it is called a temporary dwelling.

original: gcig gis gtsug lag khang du ma'i bya ba byed pa la mi mdzes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcig gis gtsug lag khang du ma'i bya ba byed pa la mi mdzes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no fault in one person performing the duties of many monasteries.

original: rung pa'i khang pa gcig gis gtsug lag khang du ma'i bya ba nang du bco ba dang nang du zhag lon pa dag byed pa la ni mi mdzes pa med de mdzes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rung pa'i khang pa gcig gis gtsug lag khang du ma'i bya ba nang du bco ba dang nang du zhag lon pa dag byed pa la ni mi mdzes pa med de mdzes pa kho na'o //
translated: There is no fault, but rather a benefit, in one monastery performing the duties of many monasteries, such as cooking inside and spending the night inside.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gtsug lag khang yul tha dad pa na gnas pa gnas de tha dad pa du ma dag tu rung ba'i khang pa gcig byin gyis brlabs par gyur na /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang yul tha dad pa na gnas pa gnas de tha dad pa du ma dag tu rung ba'i khang pa gcig byin gyis brlabs par gyur na /
translated: If one consecrated house is suitable for many different monasteries located in different places,

original: des gtsug lag khang thams cad na gnas pa dag gis nang du zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed na de mi mdzes pa ma yin par shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: des gtsug lag khang thams cad na gnas pa dag gis nang du zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed na de mi mdzes pa ma yin par shes par bya ba'o //
translated: then it should be understood that it is not improper for those who live in all the monasteries to perform the activities of staying indoors, cooking indoors, and so on.

original: gcig gis gtsug lag khang du ma'i bya ba byed pa'i rung ba'i khang ba 'di'i ming ni ba lang gi gnas lta bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gcig gis gtsug lag khang du ma'i bya ba byed pa'i rung ba'i khang ba 'di'i ming ni ba lang gi gnas lta bu zhes bya ste /
translated: This house that is suitable for the activities of many monasteries is called “like a cow pen.”🔽In one house that is suitable, many monasteries are situated like cows with separate mouths.

original: rung ba'i khang pa gcig la gtsug lag khang mang po ba lang ltar kha tha dad pa dag nas 'khod pa de ni ba lang gi gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i khang pa gcig la gtsug lag khang mang po ba lang ltar kha tha dad pa dag nas 'khod pa de ni ba lang gi gnas lta bu'o //
translated: This is like a cow pen.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ba lang gi gnas lta bu gang zhe na /🔽gzhi gang la tha dad pa dag nas @229a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ba lang gi gnas lta bu gang zhe na / gzhi gang la tha dad pa dag nas @229a * //
translated: Here the text says, “What is like a cow pen?

original: 'khod pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khod pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is a basis on which many are situated with separate mouths.”

original: de ni tha dad par gyur pa'i rung ba nyid dam bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni tha dad par gyur pa'i rung ba nyid dam bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is explained as a separate suitable dwelling.

original: gnas pa'i gzhi kha tha dad pa dag nas 'khod pa zhes bstan pa'i rung ba'i khar pa de ni gtsug lag khang gi gnas 'brel pa med pa tha dad par gyur pa dag gi rung ba'i khang pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin par shes par bya ste
analyzed: gnas pa'i gzhi kha tha dad pa dag nas 'khod pa zhes bstan pa'i rung ba'i khar pa de ni gtsug lag khang gi gnas 'brel pa med pa tha dad par gyur pa dag gi rung ba'i khang pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin par shes par bya ste
translated: It should be understood that the suitable dwelling that is explained as being established in separate dwelling places is not a separate suitable dwelling that is not related to the dwelling place of the monastery.

original: / 'di ltar gtsug lag khang gi gnas 'brel pas byin gyis brlab pa'i rung pa'i khang pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: / 'di ltar gtsug lag khang gi gnas 'brel pas byin gyis brlab pa'i rung pa'i khang pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because the suitable dwelling is blessed by the related dwelling place of the monastery.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: rung pa'i khang pa de ni gnas pa'i gzhi ma 'brel pa des byin gyis brlabs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rung pa'i khang pa de ni gnas pa'i gzhi ma 'brel pa des byin gyis brlabs pa ma yin no //
translated: That suitable dwelling is not blessed by that unrelated dwelling place.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar mtshams gcig tu gtsug lag khang rab tu mang po kha tha dad pa dag tu bkod par gyur cing /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar mtshams gcig tu gtsug lag khang rab tu mang po kha tha dad pa dag tu bkod par gyur cing /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: Many separate monasteries are established in one boundary.
